Members of Dance 2XS International have performed with internationally acclaimed artists such as: Michael Jackson, Janet Jackson, Justin Timberlake, R Kelly, Aaliyah, Britney Spears, Kylie Minogue, Mya, Fat Joe, Snoop Dog, Pharrell Williams, Red Man, Chingy, James Brown, Tyrese, Mariah Carey, Pink, 50 Cent, Alicia Keys, Dido, Mis-Teeq, DJ Bobo, SugarBabes, CoCo Lee, Matrix II & III, Honey Promo, You Got Served, and J.Cole.

 

We are a dedicated and passionate group of dancers who strive to inspire each other, explore the possibilities within the hip hop industry, and provide a space to develop our creative and athletic talents. 

 

 

Check out some of our recent performances below:

Winter Barnite 2023:

https://youtu.be/-U3FGhMWPqE

2XSKRRT Concept Video:

https://youtu.be/VZXHteFnT6c

Urbanite 2023:

https://youtu.be/d0OY5ZryLT8

Fall Barnite 2022:

https://youtu.be/oetu-kQG8sI

Winter Barnite 2022:

https://youtu.be/xG4oEn7OOi0

Urbanite 2022:

https://youtu.be/QJuoEZnOz_M

Fall Barnite 2021:

https://youtu.be/nY3ufjRtDTc
Summary: Dance 2XS Michigan is a chapter of 2XS International, a multicultural hip hop dance company. We strive to incorporate many hip hop styles, such as funk, commercial, crump, & house. During the year, we perform in multiple shows both on and off campus.

Name: Dance Marathon at the University of Michigan
Description:
Dance Marathon at the University of Michigan (DMUM) is a non-profit student organization dedicated to supporting children with disabilities and illnesses, and their families, by raising funds and generating awareness for pediatric therapies at University of Michigan Health C.S. Mott Children’s Hospital. Our members are paired with these children and their families, and together participate in activities and build relationships throughout the year. Members also have the unique opportunity to volunteer at a number of pediatric therapies, allowing them to see the direct impact of their fundraising and empowering them to form a deeper connection and passion for our cause. Our year-long efforts culminate with VictorThon, a 24-hour event where members stand on their feet to show their dedication to our cause. Through these initiatives, we strive to unite the University of Michigan campus and community around supporting children with disabilities by encouraging, inspiring, and strengthening opportunities for physical, social, and emotional development.

 

Interested in joining? Register here!!
Summary: Dance Marathon at the University of Michigan (DMUM) is a student-run nonprofit dedicated to raising funds and generating awareness for pediatric therapies at C.S. Mott Children's Hospital.

Name: Dance Mix
Description: Dance Mix is an organization that unifies a diverse array of student-run performance groups to celebrate the art of dance.  Each year, our Core - composed of EnCore, FunKtion, Impact and RhythM - invites a constantly changing diverse selection of premier dance groups from the University of Michigan that represent our principles of multiculturalism, diversity, an self-expression to join with us in the largest student run dance show on campus!
Summary: Started in 2001, Dance Mix provides an outlet for established dance groups on campus to showcase their talents and skills to the University of Michigan community.

Name: DB3
Description:
We are DB3, otherwise known as Daebak 3, the official all-male K-Pop/Hip-Hop dance crew at the University of Michigan. We actively perform in major dance and cultural events around campus year-round and occasionally create dance covers.

 

Our group was founded in 2013 by 3 UofM male students who wanted to form a multicultural group that could be a vector for their interests in Korean pop music and dancing. Our mission is to spread awareness about Korean culture through the art of dance and to create a close-knit community for our members.

 

We aim to embrace both new and old K-pop music through our performances and strike a chord with a wide audience. Additionally, we sometimes incorporate modern hip-hop discography into our performances to add variety and nuance to our capabilities. Our goal for all performances is to present the audience with a kaleidoscope of personalities and characters through dance in which they can enjoy.

 

 

Dance Mix 2023 Performance
Summary: We are DB3, otherwise known as Daebak 3, the official all-male K-Pop/Hip-Hop dance crew at the University of Michigan. Our mission is to spread awareness about Korean culture through the art of dance and to create a close-knit community for our members.

Name: Dead Pizza Society
Description:
The following narrative is loosely based on true events.

Harry the hamster had it all. He graduated with honors from the Hamster High School for gifted hamsters, and was admitted to the prestigious University of Hamster, Go Ham! A double major in Business and Hamster Studies, president of the Hamster's Glee Club, celebrated member of the Business Honor Society, Eta Alpha Mu (HAM), and all still with time to cut loose on the weekends, Harry had it going on, with more coming. 

Yet in all his handsome achievements, one thought kept nagging at Harry. "If I have so much going for me, why do I feel so empty?" Harry would ask himself while standing on the ham-bus, looking around at all the other hamsters. Luckily, with his busy schedule, coupled with all the parties and events that an institution like the University of Hamster has to offer, Harry found he could easily push such unsettling thoughts out of his mind. 

Then one night, lying awake after having received an A- on a short research paper, Harry spoke bitterly into the silence, "What's the point of it all, anyway? All this running around, chasing grades and awards, making money just to spend it. Work, party, repeat. Sometimes my life just feels like a big hamster wheel. (Contrary to popular stereotypes, studies show that educated hamsters have a strong aversion to hamster wheels.) Always running and never going anywhere. Will it really be different once I'm employed? I mean, look at Howard. Sure, he gets the occasional nice vacation, but he's always complaining about his job. And Hannah says she got her dream job, but she still parties like work sucks. At the end of the day, what am I even doing here?" 

Harry continued to toss and turn all night. He thought about everything he ever wanted in life. He knew those things could make him happy, but he began to wonder how long they could keep him happy. "Why doesn't anyone ever talk about these things, Oscar?" Harry asked his stuffed orca. "Am I really the only hamster on this campus who wants to find the answers to this stuff? Surely there must be others!" And so began Harry's quest to find other hamsters who were willing to come alongside him in his search for answers. To this day, it is said that Harry continues on his quest, holding fast to his conviction that no hamster should be made to stand alone before the looming mysteries of the world. 

The Dead Pizza Society is a community of students dedicated to creating a safe space to contemplate the mysteries of life, share experiences and perspectives, and enjoy some free pizza. It is here that students of every background are encouraged to come together and step out of their weekly rhythms to enjoy the beauty of life and question how we might more fully enjoy all that it has to offer. Whether you're looking for a good time, deeply conflicted, or just interested in free pizza, feel free to stop by most Tuesday nights at 7:00pm (Michigan time; it will never die in our hearts). Find details on location under events, or join our roster to get emailed updates. We usually meet until around 9:30pm, but you are welcome to come as late and leave as early as you desire.
Summary: FREE perspective with FREE pizza! We are a group of hungry deep thinkers, ever eager to address the deeper questions of life, hear new perspectives, and catch a free meal. Check the events page for meeting info!

Name: Deleted Accounts
Summary: This organization is used to house old accounts that groups no longer want or need. This is needed due to the fact that MaizePages does not have the ability to delete accounts.

Name: Delight Ministry
Description:
Join our mailing list! http://eepurl.com/c4wH2P

The heart of Delight Ministries is to provide an environment for women to vulnerably share about how Christ has been at work in their lives. Our curriculum is made of stories from college women sharing about the ups and downs of their faith journeys. We've heard stories of depression, loneliness, heartbreak, identity crisis and pain, but the common theme throughout them all is that even still, God is good. 

These stories are paired with scripture and discussion questions and are used weekly by all Delight communities. Stories of real women opens the door for authentic conversations and deep-rooted relationships. We truly believe in the power of vulnerability and how it impacts our relationship with Christ and others. 

Delight is more than just a bible study! Each community meets weekly to share stories of God at work. They also incorporate worship nights, opportunities to serve and fun get-togethers that help foster relationships. We fully believe in doing life together. Delight provides the opportunity for hundreds of women to Delight in the Lord together throughout their college journey.
Summary: Delight is a college women's community that grows together, serves together, learns together and does life together while chasing the heart of God. Our Mission is to invite college women into a Christ-centered community that fosters vulnerability.

Name: Delta Epsilon Mu
Description:
The Members of Delta Epsilon Mu are committed to serving the community by advocating health education and care, and through active participation in service activities, fundraising, and outreach programs. Members are given the opportunity to directly participate in health-oriented workshops and discussions, thereby attaining access to pertinent academic and career information through association with professors, advisors, career professionals, alumni members and fellow active members.

Learn more about us at our website: https://www.demuofm.com/
Summary: Delta Epsilon Mu (DEM) is a pre-health fraternity that seeks to unite students with an interest in healthcare.

Name: Delta Gamma Phi
Description:
Delta Gamma Phi is the only pre-law sorority on campus (and the first pre-law sorority in the United States). We strive to advance future careers in law by promoting academic excellence, increased knowledge of the law, unique opportunities for leadership and service, a network of devoted sisters, friendship, unity, and unlimited guidance and support. Members include women and non-man-identifying individuals who will be applying to law school, are interested in law, or are simply considering law school as an option. We represent a future of law that is diverse, honorable, and one in which women have a presence and a voice.

 

Feel free to visit and follow our Instagram @deltagammaphi_umich and reach out if you have any questions!
Summary: Delta Gamma Phi is the only pre-law sorority on campus and our mission is to create a dedicated network of women who are applying to law school, interested in law, or considering law school as an option. We recruit in the Fall and Winter semesters.

Name: Delta Phi Epsilon Sorority
Description: The Delta Eta chapter of Delta Phi Epsilon at the University of Michigan values service and sisterhood, and has a lot of fun along the way! Our spirit, enthusiasm, and friendships are what make being a part of our chapter so unique. We participate in the Greek and local communities, as well as support our sorority's philanthropies, which are Anorexia Nervosa and Associated Disorders, Cystic Fibrosis Foundation, and the Delta Phi Epsilon Educational Foundation.
Summary: The Delta Eta chapter of the Delta Phi Epsilon sorority is a member of the University of Michigan's Panhellenic Association.

Name: Delta Sigma Pi
Description: Delta Sigma Pi is the single Ross exclusive business fraternity on campus. We are committed to fostering professionalism, volunteering in our community, and creating a positive social impact on those in business. Our alumni work in industries including finance, marketing, consulting, technology, government, accounting and entertainment.
Summary: Delta Sigma Pi is a professional business fraternity.

Name: Delta Tau Lambda Sorority, Incorporated
Description:
The mission of Delta Tau Lambda Sorority, Incorporated is to build and strengthen Latina's position in society through community service, commitment, and professionalism. Together, we will unite to develop and empower Latinas, women of color, and women in general through personal evolution and teamwork. We will continue to build a strong foundation of resources through networking and community connections. We will work in collaboration with diverse women to create opportunities for growth and change.

 

We were were founded April 2, 1994, at the University of Michigan- Ann Arbor by two dedicated Latinas who saw a need for an organization that was committed to professional development & community service. We are a community service based organization that strives to help our surrounding communities.

 

As a chapter, we host various events, fundraisers, and educational seminars yearly. We also award an annual scholarship to help a woman of color in her journey through college.
Summary: The phenomenal women of DTL promote professionalism, academic excellence, community service, and women empowerment. We welcome all women who are interested in being the trailblazers in their community and an influence on women for generations to come.

Name: Delta Upsilon
Description: Delta Upsilon Fraternity's Mission Statement is "Building Better Men"
Summary: Since 1834, Delta Upsilon has differentiated itself from other fraternal societies.  We are "Building Better Men." We preach and practice our four founding principles of Friendship, Justice, Culture, Character.

Name: Department of Sociology
Description: The Undergraduate Program in the Department of Sociology is a vibrant and diverse community of 400-500 majors and minors who are passionate about investigating social issues using empirical evidence and acting as agents of social change. We ask societal questions like how does race affect your treatment in the criminal justice system or how does geographic location affect the health of a population and use various data sources & sociological research methods to investigate these issues. The department offers a variety of course options, from dynamic larger classes that cover a wide exposure to the discipline to interactive smaller classes where students delve deeply into specific topics of interest. Students in our program pursue learning opportunities outside of the classroom, such as volunteer work at community sites (SOC 225), faculty and doctoral student research assistance (SOC 394), study abroad, undergraduate speakers series events, and independent research and writing through our Honors Program in Sociology. We invite you to browse through our website (https://lsa.umich.edu/soc/undergraduates.html) and reach out to us at socadvisor@umich.edu if you have questions about our majors, minors, courses, or department opportunities. Thank you for visiting Sociology at the University of Michigan!
Summary: The Undergraduate Program in the Department of Sociology is a vibrant and diverse community of 400-500 majors and minors who are passionate about investigating social issues using empirical evidence and acting as agents of social change.

Name: Dermatology Interest Group
Description: The Dermatology Interest Group seeks to foster interest in the field of Dermatology and help medical students explore opportunities for mentorship, research, and resources to help match into the field. Through meetings with Dermatology faculty, residents, and other interested medical students, we hope to foster the interest of Dermatology in the medical school classes. For more information, please visit our website.
Summary: This organization's purpose is to allow students to explore their interest in dermatology through mentorship, seminars, workshops, lunch talks, journal clubs, and meetings with dermatology faculty and residents.

Name: Design Movement
Description:
The purpose of the Chapter is to create a space for South Asian American students and those
interested in the South Asian community to understand what it means to have a relationship with
Jesus Christ and to contextualize the teachings of Jesus in the various aspects of the South Asian
culture. The Design Movement serves the South Asian American community by offering
spiritual resources and a place to find community.
Summary: The Design Movement creates a safe space for those interested in South Asian community to explore the person and teachings of Jesus Christ.

Name: Design+Business
Description: The Design + Business (D+B) Club is a Ross student organization focused on education, practical application, and career development in design thinking fields.  The mission of D+B is to provide a multidisciplinary community for students interested in using design methodologies to lead organizations and facilitate innovation.
Summary: The Design + Business (D+B) Club is a Ross student organization focused on education, practical application, and career development in design thinking fields.

Name: Detroit Education Society at the University of Michigan Chapter
Description: Detroit Education Society is a non-profit founded by a few Detroit based professionals with the intent of giving back to and improving the metro Detroit community. To this end, we, with the backing of our DES parent organization, have endeavored to promote educational excellence in Detroit Public Schools by offering free remote tutoring programs to these institutions. We tutor in all subjects in grades K-12 and also instruct our mentees on the subject matters covered in the major standardized exams assessed at the high school level - the SAT and ACT. We are well experienced with managing small groups and training students in a variety of subject matters. Our program has, thus far, partnered with 3 Detroit Public Schools and we are actively looking to expand our influence further in the community.
Summary: Our organization is dedicated to providing additional educational infrastructure to underserved areas. We are partnered with various Detroit Public Schools and virtually tutor in all subjects K-12 as well as standardized testing.

Name: Detroit Initiative at Ross
Description:
About the Organization

Discover. Engage. Commit. Launched in 2010 by students at the Ross School of Business, the Detroit Initiative at Ross (DIR) supports Ross students passionate about discovering the city of Detroit, engaging with Detroit communities, and supporting impactful causes within this great American city.  To do so, the organization lends opportunity to engage in consulting projects with Detroit nonprofits, mentor Detroit high school students interested in business, plan a conference involving stakeholders across the city, and partake in cultural events within Detroit.

Impact Projects: DIR pairs groups of students with organizations in Detroit to work alongside nonprofit leaders to drive community impact.  Students have worked across an array of organizations with some focusing on child literacy while others support food and housing insecurity. 

Mentorship: DIR partners with high schools in Detroit to pair Ross students with mentees interested in business careers.  The Detroit students travel to Ann Arbor throughout the school year to learn about foundational business concepts and work on a capstone project, which is presented during the final session.

The inaugural Detroit Impact Conference, 2010 Focus Detroit, began the process of introducing business students to the city of Detroit. Ensuing conferences took the discussion further, shifting the conversation about Detroit at the University of Michigan to one of opportunity and possibility.

The club also focuses on planning events in Detroit and providing exposure to city leaders and historians.
Summary: The Detroit Revitalization & Business Initiative connects Ross students to the city of Detroit through impact projects, student mentorship, conferences, and historical and cultural events.  The club serves as a bridge between Michigan and the Motor City!

Name: Developing Future Biologists
Description: Developing Future Biologists (DFB), is a graduate student- and postdoc-led organization dedicated to ensuring that the next generation of biologists, regardless of race, gender, or socioeconomic status, have the opportunity to learn core developmental biology concepts and are made aware of the opportunities that exist to pursue a career in science. To achieve this mission, DFB (1) designs and implements an immersive weeklong short course to provide undergraduates with hands-on lab experience and career development activities, and (2) fosters long-term mentoring and networking opportunities to DFB participants. At the same time, DFB provides its trainee instructors with invaluable experience in course design, teaching, mentoring, and more.
Summary: We are a student-led organization dedicated to ensuring that the next generation of biologists, regardless of race, gender, or socioeconomic status, have the opportunity to learn the core concepts of developmental biology.

Name: Digital Asset Law Association at The University of Michigan Law School
Description: The purpose of DALA shall be to create a community of students curious about blockchain technology and its legal, policy, and regulatory implications. DALA seeks both to i) provide opportunities for students to learn, research, and discuss the novel benefits and risks associated with digital assets and their applications (both financial and otherwise), and ii) serve as a hub of academic, professional, and social resources relating to blockchain at the law school.
Summary: DALA is a student organization for students eager to learn more about the intersection of blockchain technology and the law

Name: Digital Painting
Description:
Digital Painting (DigiPaint) is the first Digital Art club at the University of Michigan and is a new and rising club where students learn digital painting and grow with a community of artists! We have both casual and professional focuses—whether you're looking to learn about digital painting, or get a job in the digital art industry!

Our club nurtures students throughout their digital painting journey by fostering a sense of community where artists of all levels can grow and form meaningful connections with like-minded individuals. We support each other through social and professional events where students can hone their skills and their careers through workshops, art challenges and critique, casual painting jams and professional networking opportunities.


Join our community on discord here! https://discord.gg/eW8fzuV8C6
Summary: Learn digital painting and grow with a community of artists at DigiPaint, the first Digital Art club at the University of Michigan!

Name: Digital Studies Institute
Description: The University of Michigan is a center of innovation in key digital technologies such as self-driving cars and artificial intelligence that will already are or will become part of our everyday lives. There are ethical, cultural, social, and aesthetic implications to these rapidly developing technologies that Michigan faculty and students are uniquely qualified to address. The Digital Studies Institute provides space for scholars of the humanities and qualitative social sciences who are experts on digital studies and supports their research and teaching. We are the nation's first one-stop shop for all things digital, including digital media studies, digital humanities, digital pedagogy, digital art, aesthetic practice and design, and critical thinking about our digital future. Digital Studies is a big tent that has always included practitioners, critics, theorists, and artists. We are also a national leader in the study of digital media and race, gender, and identity.
Summary: The Digital Studies Institute provides space for scholars of the humanities and qualitative social sciences who are experts on digital studies and supports their research and teaching.

Name: Dil Se
Description:
Dil Se's mission is to provide a collaborative brave space for those challenged with or who want to be educated on Mental Health. Dil Se is focused on supporting the South Asian community, but welcomes those of other intersecting identities, including but not limited to differing race, gender, sexuality, ethnicity, socioeconomic status, ability, etc.  We want to design and initiate an environment where those that are challenged with Mental Health can come to in order to build a community of supportive peers that can relate and understand such struggles.

We are not offering professional support ourselves, but rather can guide those that need professional help to appropriate resources. Our team hopes to create differing yet significant programs and projects that can facilitate these dialogues.

Dil Se aims to develop ways in which the stigma of Mental Health, especially in South Asian communities, can be combated with emphasis on advocacy and giving voice to narratives that may not be heard due to it.
Summary: Dil Se's mission is to provide a collaborative brave space for those challenged with or who want to be educated on Mental Health. Dil Se is focused on supporting the South Asian community, but welcomes those of other intersecting identities as well.

Name: Disability Rights Organization
Description: The Disability Rights Organization (DRO) at Michigan Law School advocates for students with disabilities in the legal community, promotes disability law scholarship, and seeks to further disability rights on campus and beyond.
Summary: This organization at the law school will serve to advocate for students with disabilities in the legal community.

Name: Disc Golf Club at the University of Michigan
Description: The goal of the Disc Golf Club at the University of Michigan shall be to create an organization that brings students, faculty and staff together through the sport of disc golf. The club will work to travel to disc golf courses and participate in tournaments with other universities outside of our local area. Disc golf is an increasingly popular sport and we believe that the University of Michigan ought to play a leading role in facilitating the growth of the sport both locally and nationally.
Summary: The goal of the Disc Golf Club at the University of Michigan shall be to create an organization that brings students, faculty and staff together through the sport of disc golf.

Name: Disney Interest Group
Description: Hakuna Matata. It means “no worries.” Through movie nights, games, and lively discussions we revel in the magic Walt Disney brought into the world. The purpose of the organization is to unite students with likeminded interests in The Walt Disney Company, whether they love the movies or theme parks, seek employment opportunities, or desire to relive their childhood. As our motto states, we provide a worry-free environment for those seeking to escape from the stresses of the world in order to create magical memories.
Summary: We're bringing magic to the university through movie nights, fun games, and lively discussions, ranging in everything from the worldwide theme parks to favorite memories to Marvel.

Name: Diversity in Medicine
Description: Diversity in Medicine at the University of Michigan aims to unite health professions students and faculty from across the country to share the work they are doing to increase diversity in medicine. Our vision is to generate conversations within the medical community surrounding not only the problems associated with institutions lacking a diverse system of healthcare providers, but also the innovative solutions that many institutions are actively implementing. While many medical pipeline programs across the country have found success within their local communities, our ultimate goal is to create a coordinated effort to address the lack of diversity in medicine at a national level. We strongly believe that the most effective way to do so is to create a space for students and faculty to come together to present their work, exchange ideas, discover opportunities for collaboration, and reinforce why the work we are doing is so important.
Summary: Diversity in Medicine at UM aims to unite health professionals from across the country to highlight efforts to increase diversity in medicine. We hold an annual academic conference that creates national dialogue about increasing diversity in medicine.

Name: Division of Public Safety & Security
Description:
The Division of Public Safety and Security (DPSS) conducts all police and security operations at the University of Michigan and are on call 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, 365 days a year.

Created in October 2012 to unify security functions that previously were embedded within different areas of the University, DPSS offers a truly integrated approach to safety and security, partnering across the University and helping everyone in the U-M community to take charge of their own safety.

DPSS supports the mission of the university as a partner serving to ensure a safe and secure environment while improving the quality of life for all those living, learning, working, healing and visiting within our community.

"The University of Michigan Division of Public Safety and Security is dedicated to providing a safe and secure environment for all U-M students, faculty and staff, with an emphasis on community outreach, prevention and education."
– Eddie Washington, Jr. | DPSS Executive Director

Students interested in learning more about or getting involved with DPSS services are encouraged to connect with the DPSS Student Advisory Board.
Summary: Police and Security functions on the U-M Ann Arbor campus - ensuring a safe community together.

Name: DJs A Cappella
Description: The DJs are a fun-loving, goofy, diverse group of students, and while all members come from different sides of campus, they share the same intense passion for making music! Known for experimenting with all different types of genres and sounds, this incredibly close musical family thrives on pushing boundaries and trying new things. While their priority is dedicated to fostering a fun and inclusive environment for all members, audiences, and friends, they also compete in the annual International Competition of Collegiate A Cappella (ICCA), where they snagged first place in the 2020 Great Lakes Quarterfinals and second place in 2022!
Summary: DJs A Cappella is a gender-inclusive a cappella group devoted to making quality music and loving our DJ family. We have regular fall and winter semester concerts, compete in ICCA, and sing at other gigs and events.

Name: Do Random Acts of Kindness
Description:
We are DoRAK, a student led organization whose goal is to promote genuine acts of kindness on the U of M campus and the wider Michigan community. We have several teams that meet every week to do small but impactful things to brighten people's days and bring a smile on their face.

We expect nothing in return, though we hope our deeds will inspire others to spread kindness through their lives and through the lives of others.

Check our website dorak.weebly.com!
Summary: We are DoRAK, a student led organization from the amazing University of Michigan that Does Random Acts of Kindness. Our goal is to promote genuine acts of kindness on campus.

Name: Doctors of Tomorrow
Description: The mission of the Doctors of Tomorrow program is to stimulate interest in medicine and inspire underrepresented in medicine students to pursue careers in the health field and to provide them with the skill set that will help them to be successful on this pursuit. The undergraduate branch of DoT will further this mission by offering resources and advice to aid past participants during the college admission process.
Summary: The mission of the Doctors of Tomorrow program is to stimulate interest and inspire underrepresented minority students to pursue careers in the health field and to provide them with the skill set that will help them to be successful on this pursuit.

Name: Doctors Without Borders Friends of MSF at UMich
Description: Doctors Without Borders Friends of MSF is a national level organization affiliated with Doctors Without Borders. Our objective on campus is to advocate and fundraise for Doctors Without Borders and raise awareness to social and humanitarian global issues addressed by Doctors Without Borders.
Summary: Doctors Without Borders Student Chapter is a national level organization affiliated with Doctors without borders. Our objective on campus is to advocate and fundraise for Doctors Without Borders and raise awareness to social and humanitarian global issue

Name: Domestic Policy Corps
Description: Domestic Policy Corps (DPC) is a student organization devoted to fostering discussion and debate around pressing issues in domestic policy analysis and practice. We offer discussions, master classes, panels, and social events around specific topics that may be skipped over in class, and bring together the broader Ford and UM community in the process. At DPC, our goal is to provide candid, but informative events that explore how what we learn in Ford coursework intersects with politics, professional development, and social change.
Summary: Domestic Policy Corps (DPC) is a student organization run by students of the Ford School of Public Policy devoted to fostering discussion and debate around pressing issues in domestic policy analysis and practice.

Name: Donate A Spice Here
Description: Donate a Spice Here is a student-run group working to open donation drives across campus to collect kitchen necessities. All goods are donated to the Maize and Blue Cupboard, the free pantry on campus, for free access for all students.
Summary: Donate a Spice Here is a student-run group working to open donation drives across campus to collect kitchen necessities. All goods are donated to the Maize and Blue Cupboard, the free pantry on campus, for free access for all students.

Name: Doors of Opportunity
Description:
Doors of Opportunity (DOPP) is an organization with a mission to expose socioeconomically disadvantaged students in the Metro-Detroit area to higher education opportunities that lie outside their communities. 

Our projects consist of campus days, middle school presentations, student shadowing programs, college application workshops, and an elementary school pen pal program. Through our initiatives we strive to equip our students with the resources and information needed to support and encourage them in their pursuit of the higher education. 

We collaborate with a variety of on campus organizations including Multi-Ethnic Student Affairs - University of Michigan (MESA) and Center for Educational Outreach - University of Michigan (CEO).
Summary: Doors of Opportunity (DOPP) is an organization with a mission to expose socioeconomically disadvantaged students in the Metro-Detroit area to higher education opportunities that lie outside their communities through volunteer opportunities and service.

Name: Doulas Caring For Michigan
Description: The mission of DCFM is to support and affirm the reproductive and birthing choices of pregnant people in or around the U of M community and the Southeast Michigan area. We aim to provide students with the resources to become birth doulas and take clients to help improve parental health outcomes and achieve client birthing goals. By connecting students to resources that center a Reproductive Justice framework we will help them foster skills and knowledge to either continue or complete their doula education. Additionally, we want to foster equity and inclusion by training and working with students, mentors, and clients with marginalized identities whose voices often are overlooked in mainstream discussions about birth and reproduction.
Summary: We support and affirm the reproductive and birthing choices of pregnant people in or around the U of M community and Southeast Michigan area by providing students with the resources to become birth doulas and work with community clients.

Name: Dream Corps International at the University of Michigan
Description: DC@UM is affiliated with Dream Corps International, a non-profit organization dedicated to promoting reading among underprivileged children in rural China. DC@UM supports Dream Corps' mission through event hosting and fundraising during the school year. Over the summer, DC@UM also sends volunteers to rural China to build libraries and conduct hand-on teaching projects.
Summary: DC@UM is affiliated with Dream Corps International, a non-profit organization dedicated to promoting reading among underprivileged children in rural China. DC@UM supports Dream Corps' mission through event hosting and fundraising.

Name: Dreams Multicultural Council
Description:
Dreams

BY NIKKI GIOVANNI

in my younger years
before i learned
black people aren’t
suppose to dream
i wanted to be
a raelet
and say “dr o wn d in my youn tears”
or “tal kin bout tal kin bout”
or marjorie hendricks and grind   
all up against the mic
and scream
“baaaaaby nightandday   
baaaaaby nightandday”
then as i grew and matured
i became more sensible   
and decided i would   
settle down
and just become
a sweet inspiration
Summary: Dreams is the Multicultural Council in Mosher Jordan Residence Hall. Its mission is to promote social justice and cultural awareness by building an inclusive, supportive and multicultural community through various events for the residents of MoJo.

Name: Dressember at the University of Michigan
Description:
What is Dressember?

Dressember at the University of Michigan is a university chapter of the national Dressember Foundation. Dressember is a nonprofit organization and advocacy campaign for which advocates wear a dress or tie every day of December to raise awareness of human trafficking while fundraising to help end it. The dress or tie serves as the conversation starter to educate your community about human trafficking.

The Problem

Human trafficking is a widespread human rights issue that disproportionately impacts women, girls, people of color, and LGBTQ+ people. According to the United Nations and the International Labour Organization, more than 40 million people are currently victims of human trafficking, about 1 in 4 victims are children, and human trafficking generates about $150 billion per year. 

Where Does the Money Go?

The funds that advocates raise for Dressember are distributed to Dressember's partner organizations to fund vital anti-trafficking work worldwide. Through advocacy, prevention work (stopping it before it starts), intervention (reaching those in need), and survivor empowerment programs (comprehensive care for survivors), Dressember is working towards its vision of a world where all people are free. Get involved with Dressember at U of M if you are determined to fight for freedom and dignity!

Learn More

Watch the TEDx talk to hear from Dressember's founder, Blythe Hill, about how a dress (or tie) can change the world. Check out the Dressember documentary, too! Visit dressember.org to learn more. TEDxtalk Documentary

Connect With Us

Complete this Google Form to be added to our email list in order to stay updated on our meetings, events, and other ways to get involved!
Email dressemberatuofm@gmail.com to ask any questions you may have or to partner with us and follow us on Instagram @dressemberatuofm – We're excited to meet you!
Summary: Dressember at U of M is a chapter of Dressember, a nonprofit organization and advocacy campaign for which advocates wear a dress or tie every day of December to raise awareness of human trafficking while fundraising to help end it.

Name: Duck Game Club
Description:
Duck Game Club aims to provide a welcoming social ecosystem for anybody who loves Duck Game and most people who don’t. Membership will likely include occasional casual gatherings, snacks, and playing Duck Game.

 

//

 

“Hi, I’m Alec Meyer, founder and president of Duck Game Club. Duck Game is a player-versus-player arcade-platformer shooter developed by Landon Podbielski and published by Adult Swim Games. It released on Steam just over seven years ago on June 4th, 2015, soon after which my father discovered it and introduced it to my siblings and I. Duck Game was a beloved family pastime for us, and some years later when I received a laptop of my very own, I purchased a digital copy of Duck Game in my own name to carry on the legacy. Since then, I've formed countless valuable memories and friendships around playing Duck Game, and now, I wish to bring that experience to you."

— Alec Meyer, President and Founder of Duck Game Club

*Duck Game Club is not legally affiliated with its published namesake, nor with the University of Michigan.

Home
Summary: Duck Game Club aims to provide a welcoming social ecosystem for anybody who loves Duck Game and most people who don’t. Membership will likely include occasional casual gatherings, snacks, and playing Duck Game.

Name: Dudes Rugby Football Club
Description: Dudes Rugby Football Club plays rugby union and trains and competes together.
Summary: Recreational rugby team

Name: DUEMODA
Description: Through DUEMODA, our mission is to increase visibility of people with different walks of life that are otherwise underrepresented in the Fashion industry such as BIPOC individuals, the LGBTQ+ community, Women and people with disabilities. With this, our mission would also be to give resources and for people with lack of resources to become well connected in the world of fashion such as First generation college students, children of immigrants and people who are getting acquainted with US culture. However, this is not only limited to just underrepresented communities but for people who are passionate and interested in breaking into the fashion industry. We want our members to feel that they aren’t just another diversity token, but to feel that they can simply exist within fashion without having to explain their existence whether that be being BIPOC or Queer or both as examples of completing our mission of inclusion. Our organization also aims at social commentary through articles that question the lack of representation of marginalized groups in the fashion market at the University of Michigan.
Summary: We, the members of DUEMODA at the University of Michigan, work towards a future of giving real world opportunities paired with a vision of inclusion and acceptance for International Fashion for those aspiring to break into the international fashion world

Name: Dynamic Dolls
Description: The goal of The Dynamic Dolls is to impact the overall community as well as the Black community through service and the expression of dance. We aim to provide a safe environment for African-American women to positively influence, impact, and empower each other and the community. As well as allow women to spread creativity and relaxation through dance.
Summary:
To impact the overall community as well as the Black community through service
and the expression of dance. We aim to provide a safe environment for African-American
women to positively influence, impact, and empower each other and the community.

Name: East African Student Association
Description: The East African diaspora is a vulnerable population that lacks an established support network withholding them from upward mobility. Our prerogative is to connect East African UM students with the larger community in Michigan to establish a network, forging strong relationships to uplift our population to succeed while healing the unaddressed wounds of intergenerational trauma. Lastly we hope to create a space to celebrate our unique heritage and background.
Summary: East African Student Association at the University of Michigan

Name: East Quad Hall Council
Description: EQ Hall Council is dedicated to make life better for all students and faculties in East Quadrangle.
Summary: EQ Hall Council is the governing body for East Quadrangle.

Name: Ecological Restoration Club
Description: The Ecological Restoration Club is dedicated to ecological restoration and biological diversity conservation around UM. Workdays consist of seed collecting, prescribed burns, invasive species control, and so much more! No background or skills are required. All are welcome!
Summary: The Ecological Restoration Club is dedicated to ecological restoration and biological diversity conservation around UM.

Name: Economics Investment Committee
Description:
Through meetings and events, our mission is to help each member to better understand and be able to explain the ever-changing financial world and economic policy. We hope to prepare students interested in Economics for potential careers in the field, such as finance, consulting, and public policy roles through education and professional development.

 

Our Application Deadline is January 24th, 2023 at 11:59 PM.

https://forms.gle/eJfk824K74Vma425A
Summary: EIC is established for the expressed purpose of developing each member to have a strong understanding of capital markets, value investing, portfolio diversification, financials & metrics, and governmental economic policy.

Name: ECS University of Michigan Student Chapter
Description: ECS University of Michigan Student Chapter aims to establish a more connected peer network amongst students – both graduate and undergraduate – to promote science and technology related to electrochemistry. The goal of the chapter is to promote collaborative teaching, learning, and networking opportunities for students at the University of Michigan.
Summary: The members of ECS University of Michigan Student Chapter, in order to establish an interdisciplinary peer network focused on advancing solid state, electrochemical science, and technology

Name: Education Law and Policy Society
Description: Prior to coming to law school, many Michigan Law students served as teachers either through education graduate programs, Teach For America, Teaching Fellows, or the Peace Corps.  There are also students who do not come from the aforementioned programs who nevertheless have a strong desire to discuss, debate and address education-related issues.  Some students are eager to pursue careers in education law and policy.  The Society strives to provide awareness to the Michigan Law School community about the tremendous educational inequities that still exist over 50 years after the monumental Brown decision of 1954.  We seek to host speakers and events throughout the school year to generate discussions surrounding issues relating to education.  The Society also strives to serve as a resource for law students who are interested in pursuing careers in education.
Summary: Education Law and Policy Society (ELPS) is a student-led organization designed to create awareness by providing Michigan law students with a forum to discuss all issues relating to education.

Name: Effective Altruism at the University of Michigan
Description:
At EA UMich, we seek the best opportunities to solve the world's biggest problems.
 
We're part of the Effective Altruism community — a global movement about using evidence and careful analysis to figure out how we can use our resources to help others the most. Combining the head and the heart, our inclusive community aims to make the world a better place as effectively as possible.

We'll help you enter impactful careers, discuss neglected global issues, identify the most effective donation opportunities, and have fun along the way!

Notable thinkers in Effective Altruism include
  • Peter Singer, an intellectual founder for the modern animal rights movement
  • William MacAskill, founder of Giving What We Can, an organization encouraging people to donate 10% of their incomes to evidence-backed charities
  •  Toby Ord, author of 'The Precipice: Existential Risk and the Future of Humanity'
Causes many of us care about:
  • Global health and poverty
  • Animal welfare
  • Improving the long term future
and more... Tell us what YOU care about!

What we do as a club:
 
1. Introductory fellowships
  • 8-week programs
  • Learn the fundamentals of Effective Altruism
2. Discussion events
  • Important cause areas
  • Intriguing philosophy
  • Guest speakers
  • Every two weeks
3. Retreats and conferences
  • Meet the wider Effective Altruism community
  • Funded travel and accommodation
  • 2-3 times a year
4. Social events
  • Board game nights
  • Cooking and baking nights
5. Study groups
  • A quiet space to study
  • Weekly
We accept new members year-round! 

Get in touch:
  • Join our Slack
  • Explore our website
  • Check out our upcoming events
  • Schedule an informal chat with our president
  • Join our mailing list by joining us on Maizepages
Or learn more about effective altruism!

Joining via Maizepages will add you to our mailing list. Please let us know if you'd prefer not to be added.
Summary: Effective Altruism is about using evidence and careful analysis to figure out how we can use our resources to help others the most.

Name: Egyptian Student Association
Description: The Egyptian Student Association at the University of Michigan serves Egyptian students and Egyptian enthusiasts alike. ESA contributes to the richness and diversity of the campus environment by organizing activities and events that revolve around Egypt and Egyptian culture. We are an apolitical and non-religious organization open to all Egyptians and Egypt enthusiasts. The ESA organizes various social and community service events as well as educational panels pertaining to events in Egypt and the Middle East.
Summary: We are an apolitical, non-religious organization open to all Egyptians and Egyptian enthusiasts alike. The ESA organizes various social and community service events as well as educational panels pertaining to Egypt and the Middle East.

Name: Eisenberg Family Depression Center
Description: Campus Mind Works (www.campusmindworks.org) is a website and outreach program developed by the Eisenberg Family Depression Center to support student mental health. The website was designed to simplify access to resources and provide information about managing mental health in college. Free, bi-monthly education and support groups are offered for undergraduate and graduate students.
Summary: Campus Mind Works (www.campusmindworks.org) is a website and outreach program developed by the Eisenberg Family Depression Center to support student mental health.

Name: Element 1
Description: Element-1 is the University of Michigan's only breakdancing club. We are committed to fostering friendship and leadership through hip-hop and in particular its dance form, bboying (breakdancing). In order to uphold our objective, we meet at least twice a week to practice and learn from each other. We also hold workshops and once a year we host a large breakdancing competition as well as smaller one which brings many renowned figures in the hip-hop community together, giving University of Michigan students the chance to meet them and learn about the impact hip hop has on modern culture.
Summary: Element 1 is the University of Michigan's only breakdancing club. We are committed to fostering friendship and leadership through hip-hop, and in particular, its dance form, bboying (breakdancing).

Name: Elementary Engineering Partnerships
Description: We aim to provide elementary students with exposure to engineering careers through student-led, human-centered, interactive design experiences and sustained mentorship with undergraduate engineering students. Our mission is accomplished by adhering to our values of learning and education, relationships, creativity, and innovation. Our program can be easily incorporated into classrooms by supplementing the Next Generation Science Standards for engineering design and Essential Elements of Project Based Learning.
Summary: We aim to provide elementary students with exposure to engineering disciplines through student-led, human-centered, interactive design experiences and sustained mentorship with undergraduate engineering students.

Name: Elevate
Description: Elevate’s mission is to give a platform to those committed to promoting traditionally underrepresented voices in feminist movements by underlining the value of intersectional feminism. We also seek to focus on the diversity of women’s experiences and the importance of different backgrounds and identities. We want to destabilize the myth that all women have the same experiences and same understandings of empowerment and highlight the scope of what it means to be a feminist.
Summary: Elevate’s purpose is to provide a platform for students to forward projects that promote underrepresented voices in the feminist movement through dialogue. We seek to focus on the diversity of women’s experiences and the importance of intersectionality.

Name: Empower Through Health at the University of Michigan
Description: We are a group of multi-disciplinary students with a shared passion for global health and mitigating health disparities and gender inequalities. Through collaborative project planning and global health education, we hope to execute projects to holistically and proactively improve sexual and reproductive health in the Busoga region of Uganda. The University of Michigan chapter hopes to achieve an increase in contraceptive education, use, and access, and give vulnerable women agency to make empowered life decisions.
Summary: ETH UM works to plan, fundraise, and execute a women's health-related project every year in Uganda. We send ~4 members every summer to Uganda to perform a project and use the school year to evaluate previous projects and plan for upcoming projects.

Name: Empowering Women in Law UMICH
Description:
Empowering Women in Law UMich is the second established chapter of the national Empowering Women in Law organization. We are an organization that serves to bring together dedicated, like-minded students to discuss issues involving women in the world of law, while working together to achieve our professional and academic goals.
We host bi-weekly meetings in which we invite prominent speakers - including women lawyers, judges, and politicians - to come in and share their experiences as a woman in the legal field, answer your questions, and provide invaluable advice and networking opportunities. Most of these meetings take place on Zoom, as we are able to have a larger, more impressive variety of speakers join us on this platform. In addition to speaker meetings, we also host bonding events like group dinners or study sessions so members can connect with peers and develop resourceful friendships.
EWIL also hosts law school tours, provides members with LSAT prep class discounts, and participates in philanthropy aimed at improving educational opportunities for women and girls.
EWIL began as an organization at Michigan State University in 2018, and enjoyed great success and membership participation there. As a result, EWIL has expanded to and will continue to expand as a national organization.
Summary: We are an organization that serves to bring together dedicated, like-minded students to discuss issues involving women in the world of law, while working together to achieve our professional and academic goals.

Name: Empty Mug Records
Description: Empty Mug Records is a student-run record label based in Ann Arbor, Michigan, devoted to helping artists that we’re passionate about and creating a local community of music lovers. Whether that’s through booking concerts, producing music and videos, promoting, or design — we’re excited to help musicians get their sound out there!
Summary: Empty Mug Records is an independent, student-run record label that aims to create a support network for local musicians and give means to distribute creative works on the University of Michigan’s campus through live shows, production, and design.

Name: Enactus
Description: Enactus was founded to enable progress through entrepreneurial action. Our projects are selected looking both at our own community here in Ann Arbor, but other communities around the world that can be improved through entrepreneurial consulting. This can include teaching business concepts, building a public work that helps the community, or starting a business within that community. We love to take on big problems and want to create solutions that better the communities we care about.
Summary: Enactus enables progress through entrepreneurial action. We use our unique set of skills, knowledge, and entrepreneurial drive to empower the community through our projects with hopes to create positive social impact.

Name: End the Cycle
Description:
In Washtenaw County, around 1/3 of homeless people are children. These homeless children are 9 times more likely to repeat a grade and 4 times more likely to drop out compared to a student with a stable home. In End the Cycle, we are dedicated to creating equal opportunities for all, with the goal of bridging the gap in educational inequity. We provide educational services in the form of after-school tutoring, college application help, standardized test prep, and mentorship to students from lower socioeconomic backgrounds.

Members of ETC can be a tutor (where you tutor underserved students on zoom based on your schedule), and they can also join committees. We have committees dedicated to fundraising/donations, social media/advocacy, educational resource creation, and programming/workshops that anyone can join. Committee members do not need to apply to join, and projects are up to the committee to decide what to pursue. Past projects include: refugee/immigrant english program, juvenile court after school program, summer program, thanksgiving fundraiser for homeless students, etc.

 

For more information, please visit our website: https://endthecycleatum.org
Summary: We provide educational services in the form of after-school tutoring, college application help, and mentorship to homeless students within Washtenaw County. We focus on creating programs that respond to the needs of our community.

Name: Energy Club at Ross
Description:
Our mission is to provide our members with education and employment opportunities in the energy industry that enable them to become leaders of the energy transition. This includes three primary objectives:

  1. To promote interest in energy among students and faculty at the Ross School of Business.
  2. To provide a forum for students to learn more about opportunities in the energy industry and discuss energy-related topics.
  3. To facilitate career development in traditional and renewable energy sectors by mentoring talented students and connecting energy recruiters with these knowledgeable, motivated career seekers.
Summary: The Energy Club at Ross (ECR) is a group of primarily graduate students who share an interest in energy. ECR provides opportunities to explore the rapidly-changing energy landscape, while gaining exposure to career opportunities in the industry.

Name: Engaging Scientists in Policy and Advocacy
Description:
Founded in Fall of 2017, Engaging Scientists in Policy and Advocacy (ESPA) aims to promote the participation of research scientists in policy and advocacy. We are an interdisciplinary group of undergraduates, graduate students, faculty, and staff at the University of Michigan, ranging from chemistry to public policy. The goals of this group is to provide training and implementation for two skills:

1. Effective science advocacy and communication

2. Comprehension and analysis of science policy

Both of the above skills are vital for the professional development of aspiring science policy professionals, as well as the engagement of scientists as public citizens. Additionally, many of our events help members engage with the public and government, providing valuable opportunities to build trust in scientists and science.
Summary: Promoting the participation of research scientists in policy and advocacy

Name: Engineering Global Leadership Honors Society
Description: The mission of the Engineering Global Leadership Honors Program is to develop the personal, professional, and academic capabilities of our members. Through this development, members strive to build lasting relationships with other members, company representatives, and the University of Michigan community. EGL is built on 4 key "pillars": Engineering, Business, Culture and Leadership.
Summary: The mission of the Engineering Global Leadership Honors Program is to develop the personal, professional, and academic capabilities of our members through engineering excellence, business acumen, cultural awareness, and leadership development.

Name: Engineering Honors Student Advisory Board
Description: The Honors Student Advisory Board (HSAB) creates social, academic and community engagement opportunities for students in the College of Engineering Honors Program.  The HSAB advises the Honors Program staff on student priorities and promotes community-building experiences.
Summary: The Honors Student Advisory Board (HSAB) creates social, academic and community engagement opportunities for students in the College of Engineering Honors Program.  The HSAB advises the Honors Program staff on student priorities and promotes community.

Name: Engineering Student Government
Description:
The mission of Engineering Student Government (ESG) is to support students and work directly to improve the student experience in the University of Michigan College of Engineering. ESG works through a combination of committee initiatives, resolutions, funding, and direct action with faculty and staff to improve the academic, social, extracurricular, and day-to-day lives of students.

Our purpose is to foster a community of support, leadership, and camaraderie within the college, facilitating collective action, finding solutions to broad problems, and enabling students to thrive.

You can get involved by emailing esg.executive@umich.edu or visiting https://esg.engin.umich.edu/ .
Summary: Engineering Student Government handles funding, programming, and represents the College of Engineering student body.

Name: Engineering Trek
Description: etrek is an annual trip for University of Michigan Engineering Graduate Students to Israel to explore the unique technical and academic community and experience Israel's unique culture. Approximately 30 graduate engineering students will be granted the opportunity to explore Israel's facademic and tech communities and the rich culture by means of a one week trip throughout Israel. Participants will visit the Israel's premier technical university, Technion, in Haifa, the vibrant start-up community in Tel-Aviv, and the innovative ways that Israel manages the water in the Israeli desert, the Negev. Furthermore, participants will have the opportunity to see rich history in Caesarea, visit important religious sites in Jerusalem and more! Visit our website, etrekMichigan.org, for more information on this year's trek.
Summary: etrek is an annual trip for University of Michigan Engineering Graduate Students to Israel to explore the unique technical and academic community and experience Israel's unique culture.

Name: Ensemble of Computer Science and Engineering Ladies+
Description:
We are a vibrant and inclusive CSE graduate student community. Through meaningful conversations, interactive activities, and workshops, we create welcoming environments where everyone feels comfortable, supported, and empowered to take charge of their own growth and learning in graduate school.

Our Mission: 

  1. Celebrate our Identities and Forge Connections: We are a vibrant and inclusive community that embraces diversity and celebrates individuality. We discover new perspectives together, engage in meaningful conversations, and build friendships.
  2. Foster Welcoming and Approachable Communities: Stepping into new social settings can be intimidating, but rest assured, we foster an environment that encourages conversations, ensuring that even those of us who are shy feel comfortable. We participate in ice-breakers, interactive activities, and workshops specifically designed to help us feel comfortable and confident in social situations.
  3. Advocate and Support one another: Our organization is rooted in the principles of support and safety. No matter what we're looking for - whether it's advice, guidance, or just someone to talk to -, we are here for one another. We advocate for ourselves, promoting and encouraging each other throughout our grad school journeys.
  4. Create Empowerment and Learning Opportunities: our organization places students at the forefront, empowering us to take charge of our own growth and learning. Together, we can organize or host any events that would enhance our graduate school experiences.
Summary: A vibrant and inclusive CSE graduate student community. Through conversations, interactive activities, and workshops, we create welcoming environments where everyone feels comfortable, supported, and empowered to take charge of their own growth.

Name: EnspiRED Runway
Description: EnspiRED hosts a variety of events throughout the year that aim to raise arts awareness on campus. We serve as an advocate of the arts through several outlets including but not limited to singing, dancing, painting and so much more. Our biggest event each year is our annual charity fashion show.
Summary: EnspiRED aims to bring to the University of Michigan community a space for artistic expression by providing and supporting all individuals in their creative endeavors.

Name: Entertainment & Media Club
Description: The Entertainment + Digital Media Club is a student-run organization for University of Michigan graduate students actively pursuing careers in the Entertainment industry. E+DM works to support graduate students actively pursuing careers in the Entertainment industry (film & television, media, music, and gaming).
Summary: The Entertainment + Digital Media Club works to support graduate students actively pursuing careers in the Entertainment industry (film & television, media, music, and gaming).

Name: Entertainment, Media, and Arts Law Students Association
Description: EMALSA is a student-run organization that strives to provide events for the University of Michigan community to explore opportunities within the entertainment, media and arts law fields.
Summary: EMALSA is a student-run organization that strives to provide events for the University of Michigan community to explore opportunities within the entertainment, media and arts law fields.

Name: Entomology Club
Description: Welcome to Bug Club! We are a club for bugs and bug enthusiasts. We focus on three main goals: Appreciation, Advocacy, and Education. As a club we appreciate insects for their beautiful and complex lives, behaviors, and biology. Our second goal is advocacy; we want to create an herbicide-free world that fosters insect and plant life, sustaining the rest of us in the process. Finally, Education. We want to learn and teach about insects through speakers, meetings, activities, and any opportunities that present themselves. If one of these do not interest you, don't worry! Members are free to participate in what interests them and avoid what does not. Bug Club is a welcoming space for people of all races, genders, sexualities, religious affiliation, and species (bugs included!). We hope to see you at one of our treks or meetings!
Summary: We are a club for insect enthusiastics, activists, and anyone who wants to learn more about entomology.

Name: Entrepreneurial Power Hour
Description:
Michigan’s Entrepreneurial Power Hour is the place to connect for Michigan’s most talented and hardworking entrepreneurs. We have creators, builders, published authors, musicians, event planners, engineers, pilots, oil futures traders, drop shippers, actors, stand-up comedians, side hustlers, Tik Tok stars, SAAS experts, camera kids, hedge fund founders, ferry boat nonprofit founders, blood plasma donators, and everything in between. My name is Bobby Housel and I’m proud to be the founder of this community.

 

We want people that are excited about entrepreneurship, making things, hustling, side hustles, small businesses, investing, VC, finding a greater purpose, creating things, telling stories, and doing what you love with remorse.

 

The people in this community are quite literally Michigan’s most talented entrepreneurs. Some insane people doing insane stuff. No better way to meet and enjoy the company of fellow founders and aspiring founders.
Summary: The place to connect and network for Michigan’s most talented and hardworking entrepreneurs. We have creators, builders, published authors, musicians, event planners, engineers, pilots, oil futures traders, drop shippers, and everything in between.

Name: Entrepreneurship and Venture Capital (EVC) Club
Description:
EVC is comprised of graduate University of Michigan students that are dedicated to furthering their educational and professional goals as prospective entrepreneurs, intrapreneurs, and investors in the startup ecosystem.

Whether students want to start their own venture, learn about investing in ventures, or seeking opportunities as a founder or funder post-Ross, EVC will facilitate experiences and active relationships with firms, founders, advisors, and alumni in the entrepreneurship and venture capital ecosystem. 

Thank you for your interest in EVC! To join Entrepreneurship & Venture Capital, you must join on CampusGroups: http://ross.campusgroups.com/evc
Summary: The Entrepreneurship and Venture Capital (EVC) club brings together students dedicated to educational and professional goals of becoming founders or funders in the startup ecosystem. Learn more and join the club at http://ross.campusgroups.com/evc

Name: Entrepreneurship Creativity Club
Description: ECC is established for the expressed purpose of furthering student entrepreneurial skills/projects in an action-based learning environment via access to peers and local start-ups. Additionally, there will be a development component focused on expanding on the ideas taught in PSYCH 218/UC 270/ALA 261.
Summary: The Entrepreneurship Club hopes to develop effective student organizations and leaders through training and education.

Name: Entrepreneurship Through Acquisition Club
Description: The ETA Club gathers students, alumni, investors, advisors, and business owners to discuss finding, acquiring, and running lower-middle-market (LMM) companies. The Club organizes educational sessions with ETA investors, hosts an annual conference, and provides resources -- such as introductions to anchor investors and internships -- to prepare students to launch their own search fund. The ETA club is committed to increasing accessibility and awareness to the search fund asset class across the entire Ross community.
Summary: The ETA Club aims to educate and motivate Ross MBA students to pursue a career in entrepreneurship through acquisition / search funds.

Name: Environmental Consulting Organization at the University of Michigan
Description: The Environmental Consulting Organization at the University of Michigan is a business consulting club that focuses on sustainability. ECO-UM’s mission is to demonstrate that businesses in any field are able to adopt sustainable practices. We aim to create a community of students and professionals that collaborate on innovative, sustainability-oriented projects. Members are divided into teams that work with local businesses to set and achieve sustainability-oriented goals. ECO-UM also offers a team dedicated to technological efforts like data visualization, web development, and widget/application development for use by the AA business community.
Summary: Our mission is to demonstrate that any business is able to adopt sustainable practices. We aim to create a community of students and professionals that collaborate on innovative, sustainable projects. All majors are welcome!

Name: Environmental Health Student Association
Description:
The Environmental Health Student Association (EHSA) will bring currently enrolled Environmental Health Science (EHS) students together in an informal environment for both social and academic engagements. This organization will prioritize providing a platform for the development of professional relationships with all students, faculty, and the University of Michigan’s administration, as well as outside entities in the field of public health. It will represent all Environmental Health Science students and promote interdepartmental interactions within the School of Public Health.

EHSA hopes to:

  1. Develop fellowship among all students, faculty, and staff within EHS;
  2. Facilitate discussion surrounding departmental, campus-wide, and local/global environmental issues (i.e. curriculum, waste composting, Flint’s water crisis, and Great Lakes’ Oil Pipeline);
  3. Provide a social network to corroborate positive interactions and mentorship between 1st and 2nd year students in the EHS program;
  4. Encourage interest in Environmental Health Sciences to prospective and current University of Michigan Graduate students;
  5. Present ideas and innovative programs/activities related to EHS to benefit the University of Michigan’s campus community, and
  6. Promote volunteer opportunities that allow EHS students to interact with surrounding communities and provide beneficial assistance when needed (i.e. Huron river clean up, and community kitchen volunteer).
Summary: EHSA will bring currently enrolled EHS students, SPH Faculty, U of M administration, and outside entities in the field of public health together to provide a platform for the development of professional relationships through social & academic engagement.

Name: Environmental Law Society
Description:
ELS enhances the law school experience by providing opportunities for students to explore issues related to environmental law in a variety of settings. ELS also aims to enrich the law school and university environment by sponsoring various opportunities for students with an interest in the intersection between the environment and law.

ELS may pursue any activity that the ELS Executive Board deems relevant and beneficial to our mission, so long as such activity is not prohibited by policies of the University of Michigan (UM) and the University of Michigan Law School (UMLS). In the past, among other activities ELS has hosted speakers on topics relevant to our mission, arranged activities that concern or address issues of the environment and the law, offered law students with these interests an opportunity to socialize and network, sponsored various academic and professional opportunities for law students interested in environmental law, and provided information about post-law school employment in the environmental field.
Summary: ELS provides an opportunity to learn about environmental law and to connect with other interested students.

Name: Epidemiology 890 Student Organization
Description: To support students in Epidemiology 890, Doctoral Seminar in Epidemiology, including but not limited to building a sense of professional affiliation with the field of epidemiology and provide practice in the presentation modalities of the discipline.
Summary: To support students in Epidemiology 890, Doctoral Seminar in Epidemiology, including but not limited to building a sense of professional affiliation with the field of epidemiology and provide practice in the presentation modalities of the discipline.

Name: Epidemiology Doctoral Student Organization
Description: The Epidemiology Doctoral Student Organization (EDSO) provides opportunities to build social and professional connections between UM epidemiology students and faculty through activities designed to encourage skill-building, communication, and social engagement.  The goal of EDSO is to facilitate a positive and welcoming environment for doctoral students.
Summary: The purpose of EDSO is to facilitate communication between UM Epidemiology doctoral students and faculty and to provide opportunities to enhance the experience of Epid doctoral students.

Name: Epidemiology Student Organization
Description:
The Epidemiology Student Organization is a student-run organization whose mission is to provide academic, professional, and social support to Epidemiology students at the University of Michigan School of Public Health. 

ESO functions as mediator and advocate for students within the Epidemiology Department and, more broadly, at the School of Public Health. The goals of the organization are to: collaborate with faculty, staff, administration, and alumni to strengthen the department and to represent the student voice within the department and to the school; and to provide programming that supports the mental, physical, emotional, and academic well-being of Epidemiology students
Summary: ESO provides academic, professional, and social organization for Epidemiology students in the School of Public Health.

Name: Epsilon Alpha Sigma Sorority
Description: The Empowered Arab Sisterhood (ΕΑΣ) was founded by Rula Othman on April 24, 2012 at the University of California, Los Angeles. Upon the recruitment of nine founding mothers, ΕΑΣ was born. Striving to bring an Arab presence to Greek life, the organization worked towards becoming the first Arab sorority in the nation. As a strictly cultural organization, ΕΑΣ expresses no religious or political affiliation but rather focuses on the humanitarian aspect of the conflicts plaguing our Arab countries today. Through this focus, the ladies of Epsilon Alpha Sigma aim to expose our peers to the diversity that exists within the Arab world and the impact Empowered Arab Women have made and continue to make both within our immediate communities and all around the world.
Summary: The purpose of this sorority shall be to unite it's members in a sisterhood based upon the bonds of sincere and lasting friendship, to stimulate one another in the pursuit of knowledge and success, to promote the moral and social culture of it's members.

Name: Epsilon Eta
Description: The purpose of Epsilon Eta (Beta Chapter) is to foster a community with a conscious awareness of the intrinsic relationship between people and their environment through academics, communities, and service. This includes a networking environment that enables members to utilize the fraternity’s resources during and after college within a diverse range of environmental fields.
Summary: A Professional Environmental Fraternity

Name: Equity, Civil Rights & Title IX Office
Description: The Equity, Civil Rights & Title IX Office oversees, facilitates and supports the University’s efforts to ensure equal opportunity for all persons regardless of race, color, national origin, age, marital status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, disability, religion, height, weight, or veteran status in employment, educational programs and activities, and admissions.
Summary: The Equity, Civil Rights & Title IX Office oversees, facilitates and supports the University’s efforts to ensure equal opportunity for all persons in employment, educational programs and activities, and admissions.

Name: Erb Institute Student Advisory Board
