Tryouts are held annually.
Summary: Michigan International Law Moot Court Association is a group of law students who participate in various international law moot court competitions, including the annual Jessup International Law Moot Court Competition.

Name: Michigan International Student Anthropology Association
Description: The primary goal of this group will be to provide an inclusive and welcoming community for all our international students by representing international student needs and concerns to the Department and relevant University administration.
Summary: The Michigan International Student Anthropology Association (MISAA) is an organization solely dedicated to current and incoming international students in the Department of Anthropology at the University of Michigan.

Name: Michigan International Student Ministry
Description:
Michigan International Student Ministry is a Christian club focused on helping international students adjust to life in the US. Our hope is to not only help students learn about Christianity and the Bible, but to really be a "Home Away From Home" for our students.

Throughout the year we do a lot of different things including English conversation groups, mentorship, outings to unique locations in the Midwest, eat REALLY good food together, build new friendships with people from different background and study the Bible. We know that many people may not have had a chance to learn about Christianity so we like to approach it with a lot of explanation and opportunities to ask a lot of questions.

So come check us out!
Summary: Michigan International Student Ministry is a Christian club that is a "Home Away From Home" for our students from all around the world. Our activities include: English Conversation Groups, Outings, Learning About the Bible, & Service Opportunities.

Name: Michigan International Students Society
Description:
The Michigan International Students Society is a student-lead group at the University of Michigan seeking: 

  1. To celebrate the different cultures and traditions of the world amongst its members.
  2. To build a well-connected international society at the University of Michigan.
  3. To represent the collective interests of the international students at the University of  Michigan.
  4. To promote international awareness through the Society’s events and activities.
  5. To support international students in their transition  into life and education at the University of Michigan.
  6. To build lasting relationships and connections for a global experience.
Summary: Michigan International Students Society is Michigan's first international organization aiming to improve life of internationals on campus and spread awareness of the global community at University of Michigan.

Name: Michigan Investment Banking Club
Description:
The Michigan Investment Banking Club's mission is to assist members in obtaining internships and full-time positions in the investment banking through its unique programs and industry partnerships. 

The rigorous education program is the backbone of the club and provides members with the theoretical knowledge investment banks seek in incoming analysts. The career services program exposes members to industry professionals and hosts development workshops. High-performing individuals are selected and placed onto teams that work directly with a Wall Street-based boutique investment bank.

Please visit us at http://www.themibc.org/ to learn more
Summary: The Michigan Investment Banking Club is the premier undergraduate student organization at the University of Michigan. Our goal is to prepare our members for securing and succeeding in competitive internships and full-time analyst positions.

Name: Michigan Investment Group
Description: Michigan Investment Group is Michigan’s first investment group focused on the intersection of Finance & Technology. MIG has two groups: a fundamental investing team that analyzes and pitches equities across a diverse range of sectors, and an algorithmic trading team that develops software to buy and sell stocks in real-time using hundreds of thousands of data points. MIG members jointly manage an equity fund, while also leading education and networking sessions with the top finance and technology firms.
Summary: Michigan Investment Group is Michigan’s only investment group focused on the intersection of Finance & Technology. We help members develop financial and technicals skills and provide job recruiting resources.

Name: Michigan Investment Society
Description: The Michigan Investment Society is envisioned as a high level seminar style club with the goal of implementing financial literacy for dedicated undergraduates through hands-on, interactive programs. The central pillar of the club is the online portfolio which is built each semester after choosing from proposed investments. This portfolio is presented to the Portfolio Oversight Committee on a weekly basis. Weekly educational sessions will focus on a specific soft or hard skill (Brokerage account, Bloomberg terminal, Yahoo Finance, etc.) for the first 6 week period.
Summary: The Michigan Investment Society is envisioned as a high level seminar style club with the goal of implementing financial literacy into dedicated undergraduates through hands on, interactive programs.

Name: Michigan Journal of Asian Studies
Description:
The Michigan Journal of Asian Studies (MJAS) was founded in 2011 for the purpose of offering undergraduate and graduate students the opportunity to publish their research or analytical papers relevant to the field of Asian studies in a peer-reviewed journal.

In addition to providing students an opportunity for academic publication, MJAS wishes to mentor students interested in Asian studies through the establishment of a forum for academic discourse on campus. MJAS is committed to contributing to the larger community of scholarship through our open-access website. MJAS accepts submissions from around the globe in the social sciences and humanities concerning Asian studies. Where opportunities exist, other journals confine their dialogues so narrowly as to include only one region, which consequently limits discussions that transcend regional boundaries. MJAS supports a broader scope of Asian culture, which consequently allows MJAS to accept more submissions and publish more frequently. Furthermore, it is the intention of MJAS to deepen appreciation and encourage interest into the rich and diverse cultures found in greater Asia, which is facilitated by affording students the venues in which to participate in the discussion.

Besides appealing to those students who wish to publish, MJAS is useful for students at large in the field because MJAS archives its publications online, free to the public. With respect to MJAS’s component on campus, MJAS wishes to manifest its presence through hosting various meetings: recruitment for both editors and would-be authors; mini-presentations from students preparing research projects; and appearances by professors to lecture or discuss their current research in the field of Asian studies.
Summary: The Michigan Journal of Asian Studies (MJAS) was founded for the purpose of offering undergraduate and graduate students the opportunity to publish their research or analytical papers relevant to the field of Asian Studies.

Name: Michigan Journal of Economics
Description: The Michigan Journal of Economics evaluates current economic events and markets to provide well written and succinct analyses. Writers can cover any topic ranging from stock market analyses and buyer preferences to public policy recommendations. Articles are published bi-weekly by students interested in economics, business, journalism, or public policy. Articles can be read on our website https://sites.lsa.umich.edu/mje/
Summary: The Michigan Journal of Economics evaluates current economic events and markets to provide well written and succinct analyses and research. Writers cover any topic ranging from stock market analyses and buyer preferences to public policy recommendations.

Name: Michigan Journal of Gender and Law
Description: The central mission of the Michigan Journal of Gender & Law is to create a feminist legal publication that will help expand and develop legal discourse beyond traditional boundaries. The Journal, which was founded in 1992, is dedicated to providing a forum for exploring how gender issues (and related issues of race, class, sexual orientation, gender identity, and culture) impact law and society. The Journal seeks to compare, contrast, and combine theoretical and practical perspectives on gender issues in order to provide a bridge between theory and practice. To achieve these purposes, the Journal publishes the views of legal scholars, social scientists, practitioners, students and others. The Journal is committed to representing a broad range of perspectives, however unconventional or unpopular they may be. We welcome the submissions and responses of our readers.
Summary: Michigan Journal of Gender & Law.

Name: Michigan Journal of History
Description: The Michigan Journal of History is a student-run organization seeking to publish undergraduate papers in an online journal with limited circulation paper copies.  Our aim is to encourage students to pursue their passion for history by providing them a chance to become published historians. Online editions of the journal are published annually near the end of the Winter Semester. Printed copies will be mailed to students whose submissions are accepted for publication.
Summary: The Michigan Journal of History is a student-run organization seeking to publish undergraduate history papers.  Our aim is to encourage students to pursue their passion for history by providing them a chance to become published historians.

Name: Michigan Journal of International Law
Description:
The Michigan Journal of International Law (MJIL) is the student-run international publication at the Law School. MJIL presents cutting-edge articles from scholars and practitioners in international law, as well as research notes written by the student editors.

In verifying and editing authors' work, and researching their own pieces, student members of MJIL draw on the Law School's world-renowned faculty, curriculum, and library in international legal studies. The interactive learning process involved in editing sophisticated scholarship in international law can be a rewarding complement to class work at Michigan. Editorial board positions can further this experience as senior students work closely with leading authors in the field, and simultaneously gain valuable leadership experience.

First published as the Michigan Yearbook of International Legal Studies, MJIL has evolved into one of the most highly-regarded quarterly journals in international law. Recent issues have featured pieces by many of the leading international legal scholars in the United States and abroad. MJIL additionally publishes Book Reviews that provide a different forum for critical review and commentary.

The editorial board selects new associate editors from the first-year class each year on the basis of writing ability, international interest and experience, and diversity of perspectives. Student editors gain substantial writing and editing experience. Working on MJIL provides opportunities to work with foreign law and languages and interact with authors from around the world. Associate editors also participate in the many social events sponsored by the Journal, including staff dinners, lunches with international law professors, and social gatherings with LL.M. students.
Summary: The Michigan Journal of International Law (MJIL) is the student-run international publication at the Law School. MJIL presents cutting-edge articles from scholars and practitioners in international law as well as notes written by student editors.

Name: Michigan Journal of Law & Society
Description:
The Michigan Journal of Law & Society (MJLS) is the nation’s first law-school journal to focus on the intersections of law, history, and the social sciences. MJLS is also the nation’s first law-school journal to incorporate law students, PhD students, and a faculty editorial board into its review and editorial processes. 

MJLS’ central goal is to imbue legal and legal-adjacent scholarship with the tools of the social sciences and humanities to enrich our understanding of the law and the lawmaking process. 

MJLS combines the best elements of peer-reviewed journals and student-run journals to speed up the process by which cutting-edge scholarship can enter scholarly debates and inform the public consciousness. 

MJLS publishes scholarly articles, comments, essays, and online blog posts. MJLS is soliciting content for our first issue. If you are interested in learning more, please view our inaugural theme and submission guidelines pages.
Summary: The Michigan Journal of Law & Society (MJLS) is the nation’s first law-school journal to focus on the intersections of law, history, and the social sciences and to incorporate law students, PhD students, and a faculty editorial board.

Name: Michigan Journal of Medicine
Description:
The Michigan Journal of Medicine (MJM) is a peer-reviewed, student-led organization designed to highlight the professional student body at the University of Michigan and publish high-quality biomedical, translational, and clinical research to the scientific community at large. This journal is focused on helping future physician-scientists develop a leadership portfolio within the publishing community and become familiar with the review process. Submissions are solicited from members of several graduate programs including, but not limited to, students within the school of medicine, dentistry, nursing, public policy, and social work. All submissions are required to have one health professions student as a co-author.

Every step of the review process is addressed by a current student at the University of Michigan Medical School. Once an article is submitted to the MJM, it is given to a team of three to four reviewers and an editor. Reviewers independently assess the manuscript within a given deadline and come together with their editor to discuss the necessary changes that need to be made prior to publication. The executive editor and editor-in-chief review the manuscript and make a final decision on publication.
Summary: The Michigan Journal of Medicine (MJM) is a student-run, peer-reviewed journal that welcomes submissions from graduate students in health sciences programs at the University of Michigan.

Name: Michigan Journal of Political Science
Description:
The Michigan Journal of Political Science is a journal, established in 1981 with the goal of discussing current issues and topics in the field of Political Science through highlighting undergraduate work, in a non-partisan and academic fashion. Through both staff writers and submissions, we hope to collect the best work by undergraduates and publish it.

For more information, contact our Co-Editors selinb@umich.edu or deochand@umich.edu, or visit our website: https://mjps.polisci.lsa.umich.edu/
Summary: The Michigan Journal of Political Science is a journal, established in 1981 with the goal of discussing current issues and topics in the field of Political Science through highlighting undergraduate work, in a non-partisan and academic fashion.

Name: Michigan Journal of Public Affairs
Description:
The Michigan Journal of Public Affairs is dedicated to publishing innovative public policy-related articles drawn from a wide range of policy professionals, academic, and graduate students.

MJPA is the student-run journal of the Gerald R. Ford School of Public Policy at the University of Michigan. The journal was founded by Ford School graduate students in 2003. Membership on MJPA's editorial board is open to current Ford School graduate students and the journal is supervised by the faculty of the Ford School.

Articles for the MJPA are solicited from graduate and professional students from all over the United States and internationally, as well as policy practitioners and academics. The MJPA welcomes submissions focused on topical issues relevant to public policy in the United States and throughout the world. Submissions are related to numerous policy areas such as economics, social policy, public administration, international development, political science, and the law. The articles are evaluated in light of their relevance as a contribution to an important policy debate and originality, as well as writing quality and style.

A formal call for articles with submission criteria is issued each fall with a deadline for submissions in late December. The Michigan Journal of Public Affairs is then published online the following spring.

Any questions about the MJPA can be directed to fsppmjpa@umich.edu.
Summary: The Michigan Journal of Public Affairs is dedicated to publishing innovative public policy-related articles drawn from a wide range of policy professionals, academic, and graduate students.

Name: Michigan Journal of Race & Law
Description: The Michigan Journal of Race & Law is a legal journal that serves as a forum for the exploration of issues relating to race and law. To that end, MJR&L publishes articles, notes, and essays on the cutting edge of civil rights scholarship from a wide variety of scholarly perspectives. MJR&L’s diversity is reflected by the authors with whom we collaborate, ranging from scholars and students to practitioners and social scientists. In addition to having been recognized as one of the leading civil rights journals in the country, MJR&L has also been consistently ranked among the top 25 specialty journals overall.
Summary: The Michigan Journal of Race & Law is a University of Michigan Law School academic journal dedicated to civil rights scholarship and exploring issues related to race and law.

Name: Michigan Kendama Club
Description: Through biweekly meetings each semester, MKC gathers around Ann Arbor to play kendama. Both competitive and casual kendama playing is welcome, all experience levels are welcome!
Summary: Student Organization intended to provide students with a community to bond through playing kendama.

Name: Michigan Knitting
Description:
Where: Michigan Union either Blain (1st floor) or Crofoot (1st floor); Room switches each week. Please see email that goes out every week for room.

When: 6-8pm every Wednesday

What: We teach students how to knit and/or crochet. All projects made with club supplies are donated to those in need. During weekly meetings, students knit, crochet, and converse for two hours. Meetings are not mandatory. The club provides all knitting/crocheting supplies (yarn, needles, crochet hooks, etc). To take a project home, a deposit of $5 for yarn and $5 for the needles/crochet hook ($10 total) is required. The money is returned after the completion of the project. This way, students who want to learn to knit/crochet can without needing to invest money in supplies. We accept students of all skill levels, from I-have-never-picked-up-yarn-before beginners to I-am-on-my-fifteenth-sweater experts. Although most projects are for charity donations, the club also welcomes folks who want to work on their own personal projects in a group setting.

Why: Create goods to warm the local community and learn/expand crafty skills

If you would like to set up a time to sign out materials, or if you want to donate items you have knit or crocheted (or items like food products or toiletries) to homeless shelters without joining Mknit, or for any other questions/comments/concerns, please feel free to contact Jillian Dore at jdore@umich.edu
Summary: We teach students how to knit/crochet scarves and donate them to homeless shelters and other places of need within the area.

Name: Michigan Law & Political Economy
Description: Michigan Law and Political Economy at the University of Michigan Law School is dedicated to engaging with and advancing the study of Law and Political Economy, a legal movement that aims to transform legal scholarship and pedagogy by centering issues of economic power, racial and gender subordination, and meaningful democratic inclusion. To that end, this student group creates opportunities for the law school community to think collectively about how to develop new policy solutions, intellectual approaches, and political strategies adequate to the crises of our time.
Summary: Michigan Law and Political Economy at the University of Michigan Law School is dedicated to transforming legal scholarship and pedagogy by centering issues of economic power, racial and gender subordination, and meaningful democratic inclusion.

Name: Michigan Law Ski & Snowboard Club
Description: The Michigan Law Ski & Snowboard Club is a student run organization at the University of Michigan Law School to bring folks together in their shared love of snow sports. We aim to build friendships, plan group trips, discuss and swap gear, and help people interested in skiing and snowboarding take their first step to hitting the slopes.
Summary: Michigan Law student club for all those interested in snowsports! Open to all skill levels. We facilitate group trips and help connect folks to others on and off the slopes.

Name: Michigan Law Veterans Society
Description: The University of Michigan Law School Veterans Society (MILVETS) is a community of veterans and those interested in supporting veterans or serving in the Armed Forces. The Veterans Society's purpose is to connect and supports its members and contribute a unique perspective to the law school community.
Summary: The University of Michigan Law School Veterans Society (MILVETS) is a community of veterans, family of veterans, and those interested in supporting veterans or serving in the Armed Forces.

Name: Michigan Linguistic Anthropology Graduate Organization
Description: Michigan Linguistic Anthropology Graduate Organization is a forum for graduate students in linguistic anthropology to plan events, hold conferences, and provide an environment to promote student research and interests within the field. The main organized event is our annual Michicagoan conference which serves as a public forum to present the ongoing research of graduate students in linguistic anthropology between the University of Michigan and the University of Chicago.
Summary: Michigan Linguistic Anthropology Graduate Organization is a forum for graduate students in linguistic anthropology to plan events, hold conferences, and provide an environment to promote student research and interests within the field.

Name: Michigan Magic
Description:
A space for fellow cardists and magicians to work on their tricks and cardistry. Discuss sleights and illusions, new cardistry moves, and have fun! We perform together at events around campus, which is always fun. All skill levels welcome.

For the latest udpates on our weekly meetings, logistics and events, please join our discord channel: https://discord.gg/Pa2b4B89nB.

For Fall 2023, most of our weekly meetings will take place on Thursdays, 7-8:30PM at Palmer Commons, 6th floor, Boardroom 2.
Summary:
A space for fellow cardists and magicians to jam and learn cardistry/magic! All skill levels welcome.

For event booking, please contact MichiganMagicMembers-requests@umich.edu.

Name: Michigan Manzat
Description: Michigan Manzat is the premier co-ed Bollywood Fusion dance team at the University of Michigan! Hailing from the legacies of Michigan Manzil and Izzat, Manzat seeks to combine U-M talent to put on creative and expressive performances on stage.
Summary: Michigan Manzat is the premier co-ed Bollywood Fusion dance team at the University of Michigan! Hailing from the legacies of Michigan Manzil and Izzat, Manzat seeks to combine U-M talent to put on creative and expressive performances on stage.

Name: Michigan Marketing Club
Description:
NOTE: THIS IS A CLUB FOR MBA STUDENTS. 

Philosophy:

To further the Ross School of Business’s reputation as an outstanding marketing school and to develop MBA students’ skills and knowledge necessary for a successful career in marketing.

Goals:

To further develop students’ understanding of the marketing function and its different career opportunities.

To encourage corporations to recruit and hire Ross School of Business graduates for marketing careers.

To make the Michigan Marketing Club a conduit for successful communication among students, the faculty and administration, Ross alumni and recruiting companies.

To provide a social framework in which students interested in marketing can interact and share common experiences.

To provide an opportunity for students to exhibit their leadership skills.

Planned Activities:

Marketing Symposium

Corporate presentations, mock interviews, and workshops

Field trips to various corporations

Recruiting events

Social events

MBA2 connections

Case competitions

Weekly student newsletters
Summary:
NOTE: THIS IS A CLUB FOR MBAs.

The Michigan Marketing Club exists to further the Ross School of Business’s reputation as an outstanding marketing school and to develop MBA students’ skills and knowledge necessary for a successful career in marketing.

Name: Michigan Mars Rover Team
Description: MRover is a student-run, multidisciplinary team whose mission is to cultivate an inclusive environment for students to pursue and develop an interest in robotics for space exploration. Students gain and apply engineering and teamwork skills by designing, building, and testing a rover to compete and place in the Rover Challenge Series. Additionally, we use our platform to inspire a love for space and promote STEM education for K-12 students through various outreach events.
Summary: The Michigan Mars Rover Team (MRover) is a student-run, multidisciplinary organization whose mission is to design, build, and test a rover for the exploration of Mars-like environments and to assist astronauts on a mission to Mars.

Name: Michigan Materials Society
Description:
The Michigan Materials Society (MMS) serves as the student society for those studying Materials Science and Engineering. MMS operates as the umbrella society for many of the professional societies in the field of materials science. This organization is also known as the “University of Michigan Materials Advantage Student Chapter of the American Ceramic Society (ACerS), ASM International, the Association for Iron and Steel Technology (AIST), and The Minerals, Metals & Materials Society (TMS)".

In order to accomplish our mission, MMS offers students opportunities to network with professionals and compete in contests and scholarships in various places like professional societies. MMS also holds a close knit relationship with the university's MSE department in order to unite the student body. Many events, such as our luncheon seminars and student/faculty mixers, are held throughout the year to foster the development of students.
Summary: Michigan Materials Society (MMS) is a student organization for Materials Science and Engineering undergraduates. We provide professional, social, and academic opportunities to our students and seek to better their overall experience at Michigan.

Name: Michigan Math Meet
Description:
Michigan Math Meet organizes an annual on-campus mathematics tournament for high school students from Michigan and the Midwest. Our goal is to help students prepare for major mathematics competitions, improve their problem solving skills, and cultivate a love of mathematics. In addition, we aim to provide outreach opportunities for undergraduate students to pursue their passion for mathematics outside the classroom through writing problems, designing activities, and working with high school students. Past competition experience is preferred, but anyone knowledgeable and enthusiastic about mathematics is welcome to join!

Fill out this form to join our email list: https://forms.gle/A9hz838m5x3Esz729
Summary: Michigan Math Meet is an undergraduate-run annual math competition for local high school students.

Name: Michigan Mayuri
Description: Michigan Mayuri, previously known as Michigan Mastani, is the first co-ed Indian classical competitive dance team at the University of Michigan. We value growth as people, dancers, and creatives by constantly exploring different styles of Indian classical dance.
Summary: Michigan Mayuri is the first co-ed Indian classical competitive dance team at the University of Michigan. We value growth as people, dancers, and creatives by constantly exploring different styles of Indian classical dance.

Name: Michigan Medicine First in Family
Summary: The Michigan Medicine First in Family Student Organization aims to provide first-generation and low-income medical students with the academic, professional, financial, and community resources necessary to succeed during medical school.

Name: Michigan Men
Description:
What is Michigan Men?

Michigan Men programming focuses on socialization around gender, specifically masculinity, and its impacts on individuals, relationships, and communities. Our programming equips participants with skill sets promoting wellness, healthy relationships, and values-driven communities. We envision an inclusive and empathetic campus community where all members can be their authentic selves, develop individualized wellness plans, acquire toolkits for interpersonal violence prevention, and build mutually supportive relationships. Michigan Men is a SAPAC Program in collaboration with various departments across campus.

 

Michigan Men offers a variety of programs, including:

The Michigan Man-Box

The Michigan Man-Box program is a single-session program. Our 90-minute session focuses on orienting participants to conversations around masculinity and social dynamics.

Expedition of Manhood

Over the course of seven sessions, participants meet once per week for 90-minute dialogues on topics such as:

  • Develop a personal definition of healthy masculinity
  • Self-care and personal well-being strategies
  • Healthy relationship skills, consent, and sexuality
  • Power, privilege, oppression, and social justice
  • Living out personal and community values

Upon the completion of the program, members will have created personalized action plans to support the wellness of themselves, their communities, and receive a certificate of completion.

Michigan Men Peer Facilitators

Michigan Men Peer Facilitators co-facilitate sessions regarding diversity, equity, inclusion, and wellness. Members lead dialogues and support participants of other Michigan Men programs in gaining new skills and strategy tools. Members meet for 90-minute meetings every week for ongoing education, programming preparation, and action planning.

 

Eligibility: Michigan Men programming focuses particularly on the societal expectations of masculine-identified people and the effects these have on masculine-identified individuals, relationships, and communities at large. All interested parties are invited to partake in any of the programs offered, regardless of gender, sex, sexual orientation, physical ability, or any other identities.
Summary: Michigan Men introduces individuals to engaging dialogue and activities regarding masculinity. Our peer facilitators support participants' skills development in wellness, healthy relationships, harm prevention, & cultivating values-driven communities.

Name: Michigan Men's & Women's Club Wrestling
Description:
The Michigan Club Wrestling team was founded 12 years ago to create an opportunity for students of all skill levels to wrestle just for fun at practices or competitively in the NCWA league. When not wrestling, we organize charity, fundraising, and social events. The organization is student-run and provides great leadership opportunities.

Check out our website for more info:

https://sites.google.com/umich.edu/michiganclubwrestling/
Summary:
The Michigan Men's & Women's Club Wrestling team provides an opportunity for non-varsity athletes to compete at a collegiate level in the sport of wrestling. Check out our Website for info:

https://sites.google.com/umich.edu/michiganclubwrestling/

Name: Michigan Men's Volleyball
Description:
The University of Michigan Men's Club Volleyball team competes in the Midwestern Intercollegiate Volleyball Association (MIVA) and also in the Big Ten Conference, ensuring a fun and competitive atmosphere for those who love the game of volleyball.

 

Please fill out this form to receive information regarding open gyms & tryouts for the 2023-2024 season! We look forward to meeting you soon. 

 

Go Blue!
Summary: The University of Michigan Men's Club Volleyball team competes in the Midwestern Intercollegiate Volleyball Association (MIVA) and also in the Big Ten Conference, ensuring a fun and competitive atmosphere for those who love the game of volleyball.

Name: Michigan Mental Health Initiative
Description: MMHI works to reach out to various communities in a local setting as well as outside of the immediate community to work on improving the impact of mental health programs at various schools. The organization and its members will provide assistance to increase awareness and participation in mental health programs at various education levels in these communities. The organization will also volunteer to help improve and institute mental health programs under the guidance of officials within the schools, faculty advisors, and medical professionals to further their impact. The goal is to foster new engagement initiatives with students in order to improve mental well-being.
Summary: We aim to utilize collaborative efforts with mental health programs in various communities to enrich their students’ lives and make meaningful progress toward broadening the impact of existing and new mental health programs.

Name: Michigan Motorcycle Club
Description:
MMC is established to provide a community for riders with diverse backgrounds, giving them access to information about rider safety, awareness, and maintenance, while providing the opportunity for riders to simply share their enjoyment of motorcycling with each other.  

Through campus involvement, our mission is to create meaningful experiences, a vibrant community, and lifelong memories for University of Michigan students. In this process, the members will become more skilled, knowledgeable, and safer motorcyclists.
Summary: This club is meant to promote riding in the Ann Arbor and University of Michigan community. It is a place where fellow students and alumni can come together to meet and ride in a social environment.

Name: Michigan Movement
Description:
Our mission: MIM believes every individual, regardless of race, gender, socioeconomic status, or personal beliefs, deserves the same quality of life. Rooted in sustainability, innovation, and collaboration, students provide aid to individuals and families experiencing homelessness and poverty in the local community. 

MIM believes in three P’s to making progress: 

  1. Provision of basic daily necessities
  2. Promotion of individual autonomy through education, health and wellness
  3. Passion for community engagement and social advocacy.

We are the only student organization at U of M whose main goal is to provide aid to those experiencing homelessness or poverty in our local community. 

Although there are other service organizations on campus, there are none that primarily focus on empowering the homeless population by directly working with them. 

MIM listens to those experiencing homelessness and works together with the community to effectively discover innovative ways to help. We cater programs and services that target specific needs of this population through actively listening and recognizing every individual's fundamental needs.
Summary: An Ann Arbor-based grass roots organization that believes everyone deserves a fair and just opportunity to maximize their health, and ultimately their quality of life.

Name: Michigan Mudbowl Club
Description: The Michigan Mudbowl Club is established for the purpose of promoting philanthropy and student body engagement, through the organization of and participation in one of the oldest and most cherished annual traditions on campus, the Mudbowl. Our mission is to encourage widespread participation in Mudbowl and raise money for local charitable organizations. The Michigan Mudbowl Club understands and is committed to abiding by the University of Michigan’s policies and procedures for Non-Affiliated Student Organizations.
Summary:
Mudbowl Club is established for the purpose of promoting
philanthropy and student body engagement, through the organization of and participation
in one of the oldest and most cherished annual traditions on campus.

Name: Michigan Muscle Club
Description:
PLEASE READ THE NOTE BELOW!

Membership to MMC begins with reaching out via Facebook or Instagram. Please reach out in one of those ways instead of messaging the MaizePages account (we only check MaizePages twice a year to update descriptions, links, etc.)

The Michigan Muscle Club (MMC) is the fastest growing U of M fitness organization dedicated to improving the wellness of all students. We are a fitness group that welcomes all levels of experience, genders, orientations, ethnicities, etc. And if you need a mentor, we got your back!

Our favorite activity at MMC is the 7 AM challenge. Our aim with the challenge is to provide a supportive environment that motivates our members to wake up early and exercise. We strongly believe that exercising in the morning leads to a productive day. The 7 AM challenge is completely optional and members are free to exercise with their mentor at any time that works for everyone.

MMC provides members with a community of people to help them begin or continue their fitness journey. Our mentors will help you develop solid workouts and nutrition plans. We also hold regular workshops discussing topics such as nutrition, technique, and mental health. We regularly invite fitness celebrities to host seminars, and we also invite other fitness clubs, like Parkour and Calisthenics, to both attend and host our workshops.

Outside of the gym, MMC hosts many social events to bring its members closer together. We often go to local restaurants, have movie nights, and do other fun activities. 

For everyone trying to live a healthy life, MMC is the place to be! Join us and reach your true physical potential! We want to make an impact. MMC will help guide you towards your aesthetic goals and a healthy lifestyle. We are a community of passionate mentors and mentees, and we want to share our passion for health with you!

 

***NOTE***

If you would like more information, please reach out to us on any of our social media platforms (links below). 

 

Check out our Facebook and Instagram!
Summary: The Michigan Muscle Club (MMC) is a student-run organization that will help guide you to a healthy lifestyle. We focus on weightlifting and nutrition, but also touch on other forms of activity and health including calisthenics, meditation, and technique.

Name: Michigan Music Business Club
Description:
The Michigan Music Business Club is a club at the University of Michigan that strives to give our members an exclusive, educational experience through hands on speaking events, social events, and internship recruitment events.

The Ross community believes in change starting at the root of powerful ideas. Our club strives to enable our members to explore their creative abilities in the music industry while gaining inspiration from the personal conversations they have with industry leaders throughout each school year.

At the Ross School of Business, we believe that change requires purpose-driven leaders. Given the fact that the music industry is one of the most rapidly accelerating industries in the world, the current generation of college students in just a few years will be the new leaders of the business world, in all fields.

At the Michigan Music Business Club, we strive to create the next generation of executives, tastemakers, and power-players in the Music Industry.
Summary: A revolutionary organization striving to create the next generation of executives, tastemakers, and power-players in the music industry. MMBC features a speaker series, celebrity events, field trips, music industry education, and much more.

Name: Michigan Muslim Premeds
Description: Michigan Muslim Pre-Health is a student-run organization to help Muslim and other pre-health students at the University of Michigan. We hope to create a community of pre-health students through leadership panels, mentorship, and shared resources. Any student is welcome to join our organization. We hope to help students on their pre-health journeys and create an inclusive and learning-rich environment within our club. We will have a variety of different events and will make sure that we are tending to the needs of our members.
Summary: Michigan Muslim Premeds is a student-run organization to help Muslim and other pre-health students at the University of Michigan. We hope to create a community of pre-health students through leadership panels, mentorship, and shared resources.

Name: Michigan Neuroprosthetics
Description:
Michigan Neuroprosthetics is a student organization that designs cost affordable, accessible, and scalable muscle-controlled prostheses for children, while simultaneously offering students an opportunity to learn through real world project experience. We focus primarily on working with families to build devices customized to their needs, with a secondary aim of increasing global accessibility.

Check out some of what we have created!
Summary:
Michigan Neuroprosthetics is a student organization that utilizes 3D design and fabrication to design and build pediatric prostheses. 

https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLvLzKrklzJanMN5GXKT65bOAarrSz2ukT

Name: Michigan Nordic Ski Club
Description:
The Michigan Nordic Ski Club is a group of Michigan students that pursue physical fitness, camaraderie, and outdoor recreation through nordic skiing. We are a competitive team that welcomes athletes of all skill and experience levels. Club activity involves regular optional practices (on snow and off), trips to local and regional races, as well as weekend ski retreats. There are no tryouts or prerequisites to join, and all are welcome!

While the officers section is currently being updated, please email sfay@umich.edu for more information about the team!
Summary: Group of Michigan students that pursue physical fitness, camaraderie, and outdoor recreation through nordic skiing. We are competitive, however, we accept people of all skill levels and commitments.

Name: Michigan Open UX
Description:
Michigan Open UX is the first and only student organization dedicated to providing students with opportunities to learn and practice UX.

 

Our Fellowship Program is a weekly in-person educational seminar series that covers the fundamentals of UX (design, research, professional development) through interactive lessons designed to bring you up to speed on your UX knowledge. 

 

Our Associate Program is a semester-long project-based initiative designed to give students the chance to work on real-world UX-related projects. Students can either apply to work on a Personal Project team and address a specific design/research challenge or apply to work on a Client Project team that works for business or an organization.
Summary: Michigan Open UX is the only student organization dedicated to user experience (UX) education and practice. Attend weekly seminars on design, research, and professional development or gain practical experience through real-world project work.

Name: Michigan OpenBio
Description:
Our goal is to revolutionize the field of biological research by ensuring that the necessary resources and funding for impactful research are available to everyone. OpenBio offers a platform where students can access space, resources, funding, and guidance to bring their research ideas to life. Through this community, we aim to facilitate meaningful research and transform the culture of undergraduate biology not only at Michigan but also beyond.

We are dedicated to supporting student-led projects that have the potential to make a lasting global impact through the application of biology. Furthermore, we are committed to promoting inclusivity and expanding scientific education and opportunities for underrepresented groups. We believe that diversity plays a crucial role in driving progress and fostering innovation. With great enthusiasm, we are determined to pursue this mission and utilize biology as a means to create a brighter future for everyone.
Summary: OpenBio is a platform where students can access space, resources, funding, and guidance to bring their research ideas to life. The mission of OpenBio is to foster a collaborative community at Michigan centered around biology that moves the world forward.

Name: Michigan Outdoor Expedition Photo/Video Club
Description: Through a minimum of twelve annual gatherings, our mission is to create lifelong friendships through helping students find a love for exploring the outdoors, while best capturing the moments to relive for years to come. We hope that through exploring the outdoors and creating captivating content, we can relieve academic stress and inspire our members to be respectful and driven explorers and documentors of nature. We aim to focus on developing our members as learners of this craft, and want to focus on development and learning above all else.
Summary: The purpose of MOEPVC is to provide an outlet to express creativity, enjoy the beauty of outdoor exploration, and learn to best document outdoor expeditions through the mediums of photo and video creation, while above all else, providing fun experiences.

Name: Michigan Parity Project
Description:
Michigan Parity Project is a chapter of People’s Parity Project, a national advocacy organization.

As law students, we believe it’s our responsibility to demystify and dismantle coercive legal tools that allow corporations to get away with violating workers’ rights, ripping off consumers, and shielding themselves from accountability. We do this work through legislative advocacy, administrative advocacy, targeted campaigns against companies, and public education.
Summary: Future lawyers fighting for fairness.

Name: Michigan Parkour
Description:
Anyone and everyone is welcome! No prior experience is required. We hold regular practices Tuesday, Thursdays at 5pm and Sundays at 4pm starting at the rails outside of Couzens on Palmer Field. After warming up, we pick a spot around campus and work on various challenges and/or techniques. Our practices are self-directed and involve a relaxed, motivational community atmosphere. We also regularly hold social events and carpool to local parkour gyms and trampoline parks. 

To learn more about the club, feel free to join the GroupMe or reach out to one of the leaders of the organization. 

 

[ 𝔾𝕣𝕠𝕦𝕡𝕄𝕖 ]  for discussing real time updates, gym trips, and when people move to new spots
Summary: Michigan Parkour is a club dedicated to training the discipline of parkour and freerunning. We strive to provide a community where practitioners can learn and train together all while having a ton of fun!

Name: Michigan Parole Preparation Project
Description: Parole Preparation Project, in collaboration with Humanity for Prisoners, will work with incarcerated folk who are eligible for parole to prepare them for their hearings and develop thorough plans for when they are released.
Summary: Parole Preparation Project, in collaboration with Humanity for Prisoners, works with incarcerated folk who are eligible for parole to prepare them for their hearings and develop thorough plans for when they are released.

Name: Michigan Performance Outreach Workshop
Description:
Through biannual workshops on the University of Michigan Campus led by UM students, MPOW aims to helps the youth of Southeast Michigan foster a life-long relationship with the performing arts. MPOW's constantly evolving, educational field trips work to promote creative expression, build self-esteem, and introduce elementary school kids to a wide variety of performing arts disciplines they may come to fall in love with.

At MPOW, we believe in the importance of presenting kids with the opportunity to discover their own artistic expression from a young age through interaction and collaboration with various performing arts disciplines and college-aged artists! An organization run primarily by students studying liberal and fine arts, we work to share our passion and introduce the performing arts as a means of self expression, and maybe even a future career path. Together, through creative experiences and expression, we can use our arts education to positively impacting our surrounding communities and ultimately strengthen the performing arts community on our own campus.
Summary: The Michigan Performance Outreach Workshop strives to share the educational power of the performing arts in order to inspire the youth of the Southeast Michigan community to pursue their own unique and life-long relationships with the arts.

Name: Michigan Photography Club
Description:
Michigan Photography Club’s mission is to build a creative and diverse community of photographers; offering networking, social, and development opportunities. MPC offers gallery exhibitions, trainings, alumni talks, contests, and networking/social events. We also can connect students or organizations with our photographers for personalized photography needs from large events to small group portraitures to graduation photos. 

 

We welcome photographers of all levels and backgrounds.

 

To join and be added to our emailing list, please email the club head. For more information or to hire one of our photographers for an event, please email us at michiganphotographyclub@umich.edu.
Summary: Michigan Photography Club’s mission is to build a creative and diverse community of photographers; offering networking, social, and development opportunities.

Name: Michigan Pickleball Club
Description: The Michigan Pickleball Club aims to provide a safe, inclusive space for players of all skill levels to come together and enjoy the sport of pickleball, improve our skills, and encourage the unfamiliar to give the amazing sport a try.
Summary: The Michigan Pickleball Club aims to provide a safe, inclusive space for players of all skill levels to come together and enjoy the sport of pickleball, improve our skills, and encourage the unfamiliar to give the amazing sport a try.

Name: Michigan Poker Club
Description:
Michigan Poker Club provides students the opportunity to learn, enjoy and play poker. There will be social and networking opportunities through playing poker that will teach students theories that will help in many professions. The Michigan Poker Club will be a club strictly focused on recreational play. Therefore, the club will never interfere with any Michigan gambling laws.

Reach out to a contact below for information on joining the club. 

 

Join the Discord here: https://discord.gg/trRUJSWa
Summary: Michigan Poker Club provides students the opportunity to learn, enjoy and play poker.  There will be social and networking opportunities through playing poker that will teach students theories that will help in many professions.

Name: Michigan Pole Dance Society
Description: We are a student-run club that practices the art of pole dancing and fights against the social stigma that pole dancing is only for strippers and for the strip club. Pole dancing is an alternative form of fitness where we focus on improving your strength and core. You’ll learn how to do handstands, inversions, spins, splits and tricks with our club as well as boost your self-confidence within our warm and welcoming group. All skill levels are welcome, but you must be 18 or older to attend the bi-weekly classes.
Summary: We are an inclusive pole-fitness student organization and are working towards de-stigmatizing the art of pole.

Name: Michigan Political Consulting
Description: By offering a youthful, student perspective, and a strong understanding of campaign strategy and public relations, we aim to offer bold solutions to our client's problems. At the University of Michigan, we foster student growth by providing our members with opportunities to gain real, professional skills in the world of politics. Through this relationship between organization and client, we seek to offer hands-on experience for our members.
Summary: Michigan Political Consulting is a student-run political consulting group at U of M, dedicated to bringing pro-bono political analysis and strategic consulting to campaigns, activist organizations, and non-profits.

Name: Michigan Pops Orchestra/UAC
Description: Pops brings classical music to life with performances featuring current amazing pieces of music: Star Wars, Harry Potter, Superman, etc, are all past features that engage students on campus with the sounds of their favorite films. With plenty of opportunities for both performance and leadership, Pops remains a unique music group at the University of Michigan.
Summary: Michigan Pops is the only student-run, student-directed symphony orchestra on campus. We perform a major concert each fall and winter semester. Our small ensembles also perform several small concerts each semester.

Name: Michigan Pre-Law Society
Description:
Not sure if the law is the path for you? Well, the Michigan Pre-Law Society strives to promote a deeper understanding of law to interested undergraduate students! Meetings are bi-weekly and consist of LSAT info sessions, collaborations with the UofM Law School, student panels, speaker events, socials, and more. Applications open at the beginning of both the fall and winter semesters. 

 

Please follow our Instagram @mprelawsociety and feel free to reach out with any questions!
Summary: The Michigan Pre-Law Society strives to promote a greater understanding of the field of law to all interested undergraduate students.

Name: Michigan Premier League Club
Description: The aim of the MPL club is to bring together students who enjoy watching the English Premier League. This club serves as a way to make friends with a common interest in soccer, and as an outlet for discussing and debating top level soccer. Events are organized throughout the year including (but not limited to) virtual watch parties and FIFA tournaments. MPL club is open to all students who appreciate soccer and is a social club with no level of commitment required.
Summary: We are an group of students who share a passion of Premier League soccer and are dedicated to watching games together and discussing the league.

Name: Michigan Puzzle Club
Description: Michigan Puzzle Club aims to create a casual and inclusive space for those interested in doing jigsaw puzzles, whether you’ve done them for years or it’s your first time. Puzzles will be provided by the club, but feel free to bring your own puzzle if you would like to work on that too!
Summary: Michigan Puzzle Club aims to create a casual and inclusive space for those interested in doing jigsaw puzzles, whether you’ve done them for years or it’s your first time.

Name: Michigan Real Estate Club
Description:
The Michigan Real Estate Club (MREC) is one of the most diverse clubs at the Ross School of Business with undergraduate and graduate student members pursuing degrees in architecture, business, law, engineering, natural resources and environment, sports management and urban planning. Our mission is to promote educational, networking and career development opportunities within the entire spectrum of the real estate industry for our members at Ross and undergraduates and graduates across the University of Michigan. No prior experience or knowledge is required! 

If you would like to join the club, please visit our website and select your preferred membership option. You will then be added to our email list. 

Please also feel free to reach out to any board members if you have any questions about the club!
Summary: Please visit our website www.michreclub.com for the latest information on the Club, as we do not routinely update our Maize Pages account. Thank you!

Name: Michigan Recreational Tennis Club
Description:
IMPORTANT: To join the organization and receive email updates, please contact rectennis@umich.edu. 

 
Welcome! We are an organization that allows players of all levels to play tennis and have fun. We welcome ALL players, although most of the players that stick around and enjoy it the most are those that have at least high school, USTA, or any competitive tennis experience. Practice is entirely up to you (sets, drop and hit games, etc.).
 
Please note, however, that this is NOT a good place to learn how to play tennis for the first time.
 
Here's how it works:
Rec Tennis meets three times per week, however we are also a zero commitment club meaning you attend as many or as few days as you would like.
 
For Fall 2023 our session schedule is as follows:
 
Tuesday 10:00PM-12:00AM
Thursday 10:00PM-12:00AM
Sunday 6:00PM-8:00PM
 
Price: $130 (for the semester) + $50 VTC membership (September-August)
 
-Rec Tennis meets at the Varsity Tennis Center, a facility that requires a one-time $50 membership fee that covers the entire year. Non-members can pay a $10 guest fee.
 
Here is a link to the VTC website, which provides more membership information:
http://www.tennis.umich.edu/index.php/membership/
 
Additionally, organization dues are $130. This covers court rental and balls. Prospective members may try their first Rec Tennis session for free, however the VTC does charge a guest fee ($10) for non-members.
 
We also allow dues to be payed at $10 per session if you do not want to commit to a whole semester.
 
These dues can be paid with:
-Cash
-Checks made out to the "U of M Recreational Tennis Club"
-Venmo 
 
Since Rec Tennis does not try to make a profit, every member's dues is important. Because of this, we will only refund your money within two weeks after payment. We strongly encourage you to try the free trial session if you are unsure about joining.
 
If these dues are an issue, please contact us so we can try to work something out. We want everyone to have the chance to play and enjoy themselves.
 
Carpooling
We pick up members 15-20 minutes before the scheduled meeting time in front of South Quad on E. Madison St. as well as Mojo on Observatory St.
 
If you have a car and can make this intersection a part of your route to VTC, please do so and pick up as many members as possible. If you can consistently provide rides to other members, dues will be reduced to $65/semester. 
 
If you need a racquet re-strung, please contact rectennis@umich.edu
 
Please contact us with any questions or concerns. Go blue!
Eric An - Co-President
William Yang - Co-President
Marcella Zarouk - Vice President, Treasurer
Lauren Aragones - Secretary, Social Media
Summary: Our goal as a club is to allow anyone who wants to play tennis to be able to have the opportunity to play weekly at the Varsity Tennis Center. We have no tryouts and pride ourselves in welcoming anyone who has a passion and love for the game of tennis.

Name: Michigan Refugee Assistance Program
Description: The Michigan Refugee Assistance Program was founded with the idea that UM students who are passionate about helping refugees could do so right in Ann Arbor, Michigan. The Michigan Refugee Assistance program works closely local refugee resettlement agencies, including Jewish Family Services (JFS), Samaritas, and Washtenaw Refugee Welcome to coordinate student volunteers. In addition, MRAP uses its various platforms to advocate for and raise awareness about the largest displacement crisis our generation is currently witnessing. The goal of MRAP is to connect passionate students with local resettled refugees to not only provide assistance in areas where it is needed most, but also to facilitate cross-cultural understanding between current UM students and refugees.
Summary: MRAP is dedicated to assisting refugees, asylum seekers, and the forcibly displaced in Ann Arbor and around the world. Working directly with local resettlement agencies near the University, MRAP aims to empower this population.

Name: Michigan Rifle Team
Description: The Michigan Rifle Team welcomes all interested students to attend tryouts, regardless of their prior shooting experience. The team will teach students techniques that will help them improve their marksmanship. Our primary goal is to develop our members' shooting skills, have fun, and make long lasting friends! We compete in several competitions against other universities including Purdue, Michigan State, Akron, Clemson, University of Wisconsin-Oshkosh, Grand Valley State, and more.
Summary: The Michigan Rifle Team is a friendly and supportive group of students who compete in Olympic-style collegiate target shooting in both smallbore and air rifle. All students are encouraged to tryout regardless of prior experience!

Name: Michigan Robotic Submarine
Description:
Michigan Robotic Submarine (Michigan RoboSub) is a student-led engineering team of primarily undergraduate students with diverse backgrounds and interests, working together to design and build an autonomous robotic submarine for the annual RoboSub competition in San Diego, CA.

 

Link to Join

 

RoboSub welcomes Wolverines from all backgrounds, experience levels, majors, and class-standings to join our team in advancing Autonomous Underwater Vehicle technology (AUV) by engineering a RoboSub that can perform various incredible sub-nautical tasks, like sonar navigation and torpedo target shooting using machine learning and computer vision.

 

Working alongside our technical subteams, our Business and Media subteams support our mission by securing the funding and public exposure that our team needs to be successful. 

Michigan Robotic Submarine (Michigan RoboSub)

If you are passionate about developing technology of the future, there is a place for you on our software, mechanical, business, and media sub-teams!

 

More information about the annual RoboSub competition can be found here: https://robonation.org/programs/robosub/
Summary: Michigan Robotic Submarine is a student-led engineering team comprised of primarily undergraduate students with diverse backgrounds and interests working to design and build an autonomous robotic submarine for the annual RoboSub competition.

Name: Michigan Sahana
Description:
Michigan Sahānā is a group of Indian classical artists who attend the University of Michigan and was initially formed as ICMD (Indian Classical Music & Dance) during the Winter semester of 2003. Focusing on both performance and appreciation of the traditional art forms of India, we seek to foster the community of students interested in India’s rich tradition of music and dance. This includes putting on unique concerts to showcase the vast talent of the group and organizing educational events to spread awareness. Michigan Sahānā’s performances feature a diverse set of artists, including both Hindustani and Carnatic musicians, and performers of many different styles of Indian classical dance.

Our mission is create a thriving and active Indian classical community at the University of Michigan, through which we hope to fulfill three goals. First, we seek to increase general awareness of the Indian classical arts both on and off campus. Second, we seek to cultivate talent amongst all members. Third, we seek to produce quality performances that equally showcase the various styles of Indian classical music and dance.
Summary: Michigan Sahānā seeks to foster a thriving and active Indian classical music and dance community at UofM that increases general awareness of the Indian arts, cultivates talent within the community, and produces quality performances.

Name: Michigan Sailing Team
Description:
OUR ORGANIZATION

The Michigan Sailing Team is a Club Sport at the University of Michigan. We are affiliated with the Midwest Collegiate Sailing Association (MCSA), a conference in the Intercollegiate Sailing Association (ICSA). Our sailors compete across the Midwest and on both coasts. We sail in both dinghy and keelboat events, and we compete in both co-ed and women's regattas. Our program has consistently qualified for a variety of national sailing events. 

 

TEAM MISSION

To provide opportunities and to represent the University of Michigan across a range of competitive sailing events.

 

TEAM INFO

The team practices at the Michigan Sailing Club on Baseline Lake. We start practicing the first week of school in the fall and as soon as the ice melts in the spring. Practices are held from 3:00 until dark Tuesday, Thursday, and Friday.
 
There are a few ways to join the team.
 
1.) Come to our weekly Monday Meetings (email sailing.exec@umich.edu for the location).
2.) Email sailing.exec@umich.edu or our Sailing Development Chair Abigail Paul at abbypaul@umich.edu for information on Practice Times and Carpools
3.) Email our Communications Chair Jack Hammett at jhammett@umich.edu.
 
 
The Michigan Sailing Team owns a fleet of 12 FJ's that are about two years old. FJ's and 420's are the standard boats for MCSA regattas. By joining the Michigan Sailing Team each member also becomes a member of the Michigan Sailing Club and gains access to its fleet of 14 JY-15's and 5 Lasers. We are always looking to improve our fleet and we do a large amount of fundraising every year to support our fleet replacement fund.
 
The team is run entirely by its elected executive board and general membership. If you have any questions or comments please contact the executive board or the team captains.
Summary: The Michigan Sailing Team is a competitive dinghy and keelboat team within the Midwest Collegiate Sailing Association (MCSA).

Name: Michigan Sand Volleyball Club
Description:
The Michigan Sand Volleyball Club is dedicated to providing university students the opportunity to play volleyball with fellow wolverines to enhance physical fitness, make friends, and destress from the intense rigor that is Michigan Academics. 

We accept any students who express interest in playing volleyball. Our meetings occur weekly and usually last about 1-2 hours. Depending on attendance, games will be either free-play or tournament-style. 

Locations of meetings will be determined on a week-to-week basis. Just click on "join club" to get more details and be added to the email list or join our Groupme:)
Summary: M-Sand has regular athletic events dedicated to playing volleyball in order to support physical well-being and camaraderie between fellow Wolverines.

Name: Michigan Saving Mothers
Summary: Michigan Saving Mothers is a student chapter of the global nonprofit Saving Mothers which is an alliance of healthcare professionals dedicated to eradicating preventable maternal deaths and birth-related complications among marginalized women.

Name: Michigan Science Writers
Description:
MiSciWriters provides structured training in writing and editing as well as providing platforms for practicing science communication. Writers have the opportunity to work with editors to cultivate a quality publication for a public audience. There are also opportunities for showcasing science illustrations.

Events hosted by MiSciWriters provide individualized guidance and feedback for communicating to diverse audiences. Various scientific communication events include career panels, live blogging opportunities, and talks with established science writers. MiSciWriters is also involved with outreach to the community by working with Michigan DNA Day, RELATE, and the Language Bank to translate our posts into Spanish.
Summary: MiSciWriters is a student organization dedicated to improving the written communication abilities of scientists, improving public understanding of science, and advocating for science communication as a field.

Name: Michigan Scuba Club
Description: The Michigan SCUBA Club aims to promote the sport of SCUBA diving among U of M students, and provide opportunities to both learn and use SCUBA skills throughout the year. At the same time we look to operate as a social group where all are welcome and we encourage members to spend time together both inside and outside of club events while not diving. We travel throughout the Midwest and world for weekend and break dive trips. On campus our events promote SCUBA training as well as team work.
Summary: The Michigan SCUBA Club aims to promote the sport of SCUBA diving among U of M students, and provide opportunities to both learn and use SCUBA skills throughout the year.

Name: Michigan Ski and Snowboard Club
Description:
We take two big trips a year, one over MLK weekend and one over Spring Break. For MLK weekend, we depart from Ann Arbor with 2 or 3 motor coaches (depending on trip size). Plenty of partying happens on the ride, which is usually one of the highlights of the trip. Once we arrive you have two full days of skiing before we depart back to Ann Arbor. 

The second trip we plan is during Spring Break. Past destinations have been Whistler Blackcomb, Winter Park, Heavenly, Park City and the French Alps. Join our email list to find out about this year's trip as details become available. 

In addition, we take a few day trips to local resorts throughout the season. More information will be provided both through our e-mail list and the facebook page.

Our club is free to join and skiers and snowboarders of all skill levels are welcome. Check us out on instagram and if you have any questions or want to be added to our mailing list, shoot us an e-mail at scofficers@umich.edu. Can't wait to hit the slopes with you!

Cheers,

   The Scofficers
Summary: Welcome to the Ski and Snowboard Club Maize Page! We organize two ski trips per year, one over MLK weekend and one over spring break. Our club is very fun & free to join! If you have any questions, please email us!

Name: Michigan Snowboard Club
Description:
Whether you ski, board, or have never tried either, there is no reason not to join the best club on campus. Every year the club grows bigger and better. With over 300 members, we remain the largest winter sports organization on campus. Dues are $25 annually and get you access to our rail jams, film premiers, dozens of local trips to resorts, and annual trips over Martin Luther King weekend and Spring Break. If you want to join, fill out the form on our website!

Nothing is better than getting out of Ann Arbor for a day or an afternoon on the slopes. We hope you choose to join the most stoked crew on campus! Here is the link for joining the club, ikon pass, and our Instagram!

Skiers and snowboarders of all skill levels are welcome!
Summary: Focused on getting skiers and snowboarders to the hills during the winter with a spring break trip out west, MLK trip to Canada, and local trips in Michigan. We also do social events so members can get to know each other.

Name: Michigan Songwriters Collective
Description: The Michigan Songwriters Collective (MISC) aims to establish a prominent singer-songwriter culture on campus, providing performance opportunities, educational opportunities, and promotional opportunities for student songwriters at any level.
Summary: The Michigan Songwriters Collective (MISC) aims to establish a prominent singer-songwriter culture on campus, providing performance opportunities, educational opportunities, and promotional opportunities for student songwriters at any level.

Name: Michigan Sport Business Conference
Description: The MSBC is an undergraduate student-run platform whose mission is to empower the next generation of sport industry leaders. Since our founding in 2012, the MSBC has strived to inspire creativity and innovation in the sport industry. We do this by connecting current and future sport business professionals and organizations, culminating in the largest undergraduate-run sport business conference in the country.
Summary: The MSBC is the premier undergraduate-run sport business conference in the United States, and its objective is to inspire creativity and innovation in the sport industry.

Name: Michigan Sport Business Inclusion Community
Description: A career in sport is a dream for many, but few fulfill this aspiration and thrive in the industry. Although the University of Michigan offers a premiere sport management program alongside an elite athletic department, it is no exception to the lack of racial diversity that stains sport business. Racial minority students seeking careers in sport business often find themselves marginalized, which places these students at a disadvantage when navigating their academic and professional careers. We, the members of the Michigan SBIC are committed to enhancing the experiences of students seeking a career in sports who identify as a racial minority through building community. Our community serves to empower the next generation of diverse leaders in sports.
Summary: The Michigan Sport Business Inclusion Community serves as a space for historically underrepresented students pursuing a career in sports and entertainment to enhance their undergraduate experience.

Name: Michigan Sport Consulting Group
Description: Using the engaged sport business community at the University of Michigan, the Michigan Sport Consulting Group hopes to find motivated individuals interested in working with impactful sport entities. We expose students to authentic projects in sport business that help them foster relationships with industry professionals and direct their career path.
Summary: MSCG provides consulting services to organizations in the sport and entertainment industry. We give clients the opportunity to increase their business value by addressing key areas of concern with a meticulous, tailored and innovative solutions.

Name: Michigan Sports Analytics Society
Description:
Statistics and data analysis are the future of sports. More so than ever before, teams in every sport use data to make personnel decisions and devise winning strategies. Learn about how teams do this analysis, find peers for collaboration on research projects, and build your resume with skills attractive to franchises, agencies, and other sports organizations.

Primary Contact: Matthew Wellman Jr

Leadership Board: Ben Weber, Lucy Hanson, Owen Yoo, Amber Gehron, Quinn Snyder, Caylie McMahon, Zach Spivak
Summary: The Michigan Sports Analytics Society exists to provide a platform for interested students to collaborate, gain experience, and publish high-level work in the field of sports analytics.

Name: Michigan Sports Law Society
Description: SLS explores various facets of sports law and career development (e.g., firms, sports agencies, in-house) through events such as guest lectures, informational panels, networking sessions, and other educational and professional activities. SLS also organizes and funds trips to sports law-related competitions (e.g., the Tulane International Baseball Arbitration Competition) and sports-related law school events (e.g., the UVA Law Softball Invitational), as well as works with student organizations at the Ross School of Business to coordinate sports competitions between the two schools here in Ann Arbor.
Summary: Michigan Sports Law Society explores legal issues and career opportunities in the area of sports law. SLS is devoted to providing the necessary resources, guidance, and contacts to support the pursuit of professional endeavors in sports practices.

Name: Michigan Sports Viewing Club
Description: Michigan Sports Viewing Club offers students the opportunity to watch live sports, while making new friends with their peers in a safe environment.
Summary: Michigan Sports Viewing Club offers students the opportunity to watch live sports, while making new friends with their peers in a safe environment.

Name: Michigan Stocks and Bonds Organization
Description: Members gather weekly to discuss the current state of the financial market, as well as any new trends or significant events. This is supplemented with seven pitch desks, where members pitch stocks for the club to invest in. MSBO aims to improve the financial literacy of members and prepare them for life. To learn more, visit www.michsbo.org. Join our interest form here: https://forms.gle/6gvcntsVj3sEv8Ae7
Summary: All-inclusive student organization with the goal of improving financial literacy among members, with a concentration in learning about investing in the various sectors of the stocks and bonds markets. To learn more, visit www.michsbo.org.

Name: Michigan Strength Augmenting Robotic Exoskeletons
Description: This team is looking to advance the field of powered exoskeleton technology to a practical and useful level.  Most powered exoskeletons are confined to a lab area and are not usable by a person in a real world setting.  Our purpose is to change that by designing and building an exoskeleton that can help the user with everyday tasks and make a difference in the real world.  These practical solutions will help show the technology can be useful outside of just labs and military applications, and are a major step toward making this a mainstream technology that is within the reach of anyone who needs it.
Summary: STARX works toward building practical strength augmenting exoskeletons usable in an everyday setting in order to advance the field of exoskeleton technology and put it to use helping people outside of the lab and military.

Name: Michigan Student Artificial Intelligence Lab
Description:
The Michigan Student Artificial Intelligence Lab (MSAIL) is a group studying recent advances in artificial intelligence and machine learning. We hold a reading group, tutorials, projects, and professional talks.

Website: http://msail.github.io/

Slack channel: https://msail-team.slack.com/signup

Website: http://msail.github.io
Summary: Michigan Student Artificial Intelligence Lab promotes student interest and participation in AI research, application, and development at U of M.

Name: Michigan Surf Club
Description:
As one of the only surf clubs in the Midwest, Michigan Surf Club (MSurf) provides UM students with unique opportunities to connect with the Great Lakes through surfing and environmental stewardship. MSurf is open to surfers of all levels and connects students with the equipment and resources necessary to surf year-round on Lake Michigan and other waters. By developing shared appreciation and respect for the Great Lakes, MSurf seeks to spread a sense of responsibility for Great Lakes protection which translates into MSurf events and projects (e.g., beach clean-ups, advocacy for clean water, environmental partnerships, etc.). Whether the Lakes are firing or flat, MSurf offers fun times to stay stoked.

Listed below are a few events offered throughout the year:

  • Year-round surf trips to Lake Michigan (weather and waves permitting)
  • Year-round surfing on the Huron River
  • Surfing 101 sessions (includes basic surf skills, wave forecasting, and more)
  • Volunteering w/ Alliance for the Great Lakes and Surfrider Foundation
  • Social events (potlucks, surf-related movie watch events, board shaping activities)

To be added to the MSurf email list OR for more information, please email Lhascall@umich.edu
Summary: This organization promotes surfing and environmental stewardship on the Great Lakes. MSurf hosts activities for surfers of all abilities, including year-round surfing, beach clean-ups, informational sessions, and other club events.
