Name: Michigan Sustainable Aviation with General Electric
Description: The Michigan Sustainable Aviation with General Electric (M-SAGE) is a project team associated with the Department of Aerospace Engineering x88 Product Development course series overseen by Professor George Halow. The team partners with General Electric Aerospace to deliver an RC sustainable aviation technology demonstrator platform and digital engineering environment through the use of MBSE tools and processes. The 2023-2024 M-SAGE Project is a program focused on the incorporation of specific sustainable aviation technologies into an RC demonstrator craft. The core deliverable will be a modified Bushmaster RC craft that incorporates a truss-braced wing design and gas turbine propulsion as a success baseline, and a swept wing design and open fan engines as stretch goals. A primary focus will be on the use of MBSE tools and processes to accommodate changing or uncertain customers requirements, and a key deliverable will be the documentation of the effect of MBSE on efficiency, traceability, and design robustness. The project will culminate in a flight demonstration at the end of the project development cycle.
Summary: M-SAGE is a student project team associated with the Department of Aerospace Engineering x88 Product Development course series. The team partners with General Electric to deliver an RC technology demonstrator platform and digital engineering environment

Name: Michigan Synthetic Biology Team
Description:
2023/24 Application Updates:

MSBT operates around the iGEM competition cycle, with iGEM held in November. We collect interest during the Fall semester, but open the application and complete recruitment in January (2024). 

 

Please fill out this form to be added to our interest list and be sent periodic updates about our progress, as well as information surrounding applying to MSBT come January 2024. 

 

In the meantime, check out last year's project wiki page as well as our team website!

 

Who Are We?

The Michigan Synthetic Biology Team is an entirely student run research and engineering design team in the biological sciences. We develop and execute our own research projects in the area of synthetic biology. Students have the opportunity to gain hands on experience in conducting scientific research, running a laboratory, engineering novel biological systems, fundraising, public outreach, leadership, and working as part of a multidisciplinary team. Every year, the team competes in the International Genetically Engineered Machine (iGEM) jamboree competition in Boston.

 

What is Synthetic Biology?

Synthetic Biology combines biology and engineering to design, construct, and test biological devices and systems. Combining these two disciplines allows us to better understand life, and use that understanding to benefit society. Synthetic Biology is distinct from Genetic Engineering in that the latter only alters existing genes, whereas the former utilizes existing, modified, and man-made genes to make life perform useful functions not normally found in nature. Through synthetic biology, it may be possible to solve some of the world’s most challenging problems such as energy shortage, environmental pollution, and disease. However, we must be wary of potential safety and ethical issues along the way.

 

What is iGEM?

iGEM is an international undergraduate synthetic biology competition. In 2015, iGEM consisted of 259 teams and 2700 participants from all over the world. Every year, teams research, design, construct, and test a novel biological system. Students have at their disposal bits of DNA from the iGEM Registry of Standard Biological parts to help aid them in building their biological “machine”. In addition, students are encouraged to build their own parts and develop new techniques to make life easier to engineer. Teams also help to increase awareness for synthetic biology through public outreach and analyze safety concerns as a part of the project design process. Projects are wide ranging and are divided into the following categories: Environment, Food and Nutrition, Energy, Foundational Advance, Health and Medicine, Information Processing, Manufacturing, Software Tools, and New Applications. For more information, see igem.org.

 

Who Can Join?

Any undergraduate student with an interest in synthetic biology and biological engineering is welcome to join! Absolutely no previous experience is required. In addition, we always have places for students interested in mathematical modeling, business, programming, web design, and animation. Our team is composed of undergraduate students from a variety of majors, including (but not limited to) Molecular, Cellular, and Developmental Biology, Biomedical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Mathematics, Biophysics, Neuroscience, Microbiology, Philosophy, and Materials Science & Engineering. We also have graduate students and faculty advisors from multiple colleges and departments on campus. Students will become acquainted with the theory and techniques during weekly meetings from February to the end of Winter Semester, at which point we will transition to working on the year’s project, continuing into the Spring, Summer, and following Fall Semester, until our competition in late October. To join, applications start in the middle of January!

 

Note: Per iGEM rules, students over the age of 23 by March 31 may not perform work. They can however be advisors to the team. Students in a 5-year combined bachelor's/master's degree program who are not older than 23 are eligible to join!
Summary: The Michigan Synthetic Biology Team is an entirely student run research and engineering design team in the biological sciences. We develop and execute our own research projects in the area of synthetic biology.

Name: Michigan Taal
Description: Michigan Taal is a South Asian fusion, competitive dance team that was founded in 2005. The team uses its members’ diverse backgrounds in dance to incorporate a variety of styles such as Bollywood, Bhangra, Hip-hop, Classical, and more into the choreography to compete at competitions all over the country.
Summary: TAAL is a South Asian fusion, competitive dance team that was founded in 2005. The team uses its members’ diverse backgrounds in dance to incorporate a variety of styles such as Bollywood, Bhangra, Hip-hop and Classical into the choreography.

Name: Michigan Table Tennis Club
Description:
THE CLUB WILL REOPEN FOR THE FALL SEMESTER IN SEPTEMBER 2023

 

The objective of the club is to promote, develop, and implement programs for the sport of table tennis regardless of the player’s experience, through family values, excellence, and quality in a sportsmanship environment. Our main goal is to build a stronger table tennis community in the university. UM Table Tennis Club is open to all students, faculty, and community members, regardless of age, gender, or playing levels. Players will have the opportunity to learn on and off the table skills, make lasting friends and have lots of fun! Come and play this amazing, popular, and rapidly growing Olympic sport.
Summary: Our club provides a recreational and competitive aspect to satisfy the interests of any player. Members of any skill level are welcomed to join and become part of a dedicated and friendly community.

Name: Michigan Taekwondo
Description:
Taekwondo (태권도) is a traditional Korean martial art known for its fluid footwork and the development of fast, fancy, explosive kicks. Taekwondo has been an official Olympic sport since 2000, has recently been the cause of global sensation through dynamic demonstrations on TV shows like America's Got Talent, and is the most widely practiced martial art in the world (70+ million in over 200+ countries)!!

The Michigan Taekwondo club (UMTKD) welcomes people of ALL levels of experience: anyone from black belts who have been competing their entire lives, former trainees a few years out of practice, those coming from other martial arts backgrounds, all the way to brand-new first-timers with no athletic experience at all!! NO PRIOR EXPERIENCE IS NECESSARY. BEGINNERS ARE WELCOME!!

We are a member school of the Eastern Collegiate Taekwondo Conference (ECTC) and while competing is NOT MANDATORY (though highly encouraged), we frequently send members to compete at MIT, Brown, Cornell, Princeton, etc. against Ivy League- and other East coast-based schools in both sparring (kyorugi) and forms (poomsae) events. We compete following the WT (World Taekwondo) or Olympic-style rules.

For more information, check out our website: http://umtaekwondo.club

https://youtu.be/oBuSXw0BNU4
Summary: Michigan Taekwondo (UMTKD), functions both as a Taekwondo dojang as well as a competitive collegiate team. We are a part of the Eastern Collegiate Taekwondo Conference (ECTC). NO PRIOR EXPERIENCE NECESSARY. BEGINNERS ARE WELCOME!! http://umtaekwondo.club

Name: Michigan Taiwanese Student Association
Description: Michigan Taiwan Student Association (MTSA), founded at the year of 1986, was a supporting channel for people to discuss diverse issues of the current Taiwanese society. It now also exists to help Taiwanese graduate students with challenges they might encounter in their academic and social life at University of Michigan. By holding social events throughout the year, especially at the times of traditional holidays, MTSA endeavors to establish a supportive network for our fellow Taiwanese students as well as to promote awareness of Taiwanese culture and heritage on campus.
Summary: Michigan Taiwan Student Association (MTSA) supports Taiwanese graduate students at University of Michigan.

Name: Michigan Task Based Robotics
Summary: Michigan Task Based Robotics (MTBR) is a competitive and educational team focused on advancing the field of robotics through innovation, teamwork, and determination.

Name: Michigan Technology Law Review
Description:
Founded in 1994 as the Michigan Telecommunications and Technology Law Review, MTLR was one of the first law journals to use interactive media to promote informed discourse about the interrelated legal, social, business, and public policy issues raised by emerging technologies. As one of the original online law journals in the world, MTLR is a ground-breaking publication.

MTLR publishes online and printed volumes, available through subscription. MTLR is available through Lexis-Nexis, Westlaw, and its website. The Michigan Technology Law Review's primary purpose is to examine the tensions created by advances in computing, telecommunications, biotechnology, multimedia, networking, information, and other technologies.
Summary: MTLR is a law journal which uses interactive media to promote informed discourse about the interrelated legal, social, business, and public policy issues raised by emerging technologies.

Name: Michigan Telefund
Description: Professional development in communication, problem solving, and management skills to build your resume and career prep.
Summary: Professional development in communication, problem solving, and management skills to build your resume and career prep.

Name: Michigan Texas Club
Description: The mission of the Texas Club is (1) to host panels, luncheons, and social events for Michigan Law students to learn about legal practice in Texas, (2) to create a recruiting pipeline of Michigan Law students starting their legal careers in Texas, and (3) to maintain a network of Michigan Law alumni supporting each other in the Texas legal market.
Summary: The purpose of the Texas Club is (1) to educate Michigan Law students on the benefits and opportunities of practicing law in Texas and (2) to provide Michigan Law students who are interested in practicing law in Texas with networking opportunities.

Name: Michigan Theme Park Engineering Group
Description: Michigan TPEG immerses students in the theme park and roller coaster design industries. This is accomplished through weekly meetings, hosted speakers, networking opportunities, group trips, and design projects that encourage open conversation, idea sharing, and cross-disciplinary collaboration as necessary preparation for relevant careers in amusement engineering and design.
Summary: Michigan TPEG is open to ALL majors and disciplines. We are dedicated to educating students on the processes and challenges of designing amusement attractions from blue sky to operation. We also host park trips. TEA Nextgen affiliated.

Name: Michigan Transportation Student Organization
Description: MiTSO was established for the express purpose of developing transportation students' personal and professional interests. Through various events such as field trips, networking events, guest speakers, and more, our mission is to create meaningful experiences and lasting connections for University of Michigan students interested in transportation. Our goal is to foster a community among students and faculty with these shared interests and increase awareness of this area through outreach to new students. MiTSO aims to connect the next generation of transportation engineering students and faculty to opportunities and knowledge that will facilitate collaboration, professional development, and advancements in the transportation engineering field.
Summary: MiTSO is a club for students interested in transportation planning and engineering. We host field trips, networking events, guest speakers, and more to introduce and connect students to the field of transportation. All UM students are welcome to join.

Name: Michigan Undergraduate Law Review
Description:
“The Michigan Undergraduate Law Review is the first and only undergraduate legal publication at the University of Michigan. We provide students interested in careers in law, academia, and policy the opportunity to publish long-form articles on topics in legal scholarship.

Please do not apply to join the organization on Maize Pages. Instead, please complete our F'23 interest form here.”
Summary: We are an undergraduate publication writing long form articles on topics of law and all subfields.

Name: Michigan Undergraduate Students of Statistics
Description:
Please email us directly at mugsstatistics@gmail.com to join our club and be added to our email list! We will not respond to Maize Pages. You can also use the form on our website.

Check out our website!

MUgSS is a student-run organization sponsored by the Statistics Department. We aim to provide academic and career resources for undergraduate students interested in the field of statistics and its many applications. We welcome students from all majors, including (but not limited to): statistics, data science, computer science, business, cognitive science, mathematics, and economics. Our mission is to support, guide, and bring together like-minded individuals by forming a greater network of students, alumni, and faculty.

 

MUgSS offers a variety of events, including:

  • recruiting events — industry speakers, interview workshops, intern panels
  • graduate school — faculty and grad student panels, admissions advice, course planning
  • technical workshops, resume workshops, career exploration events, and more!
Summary: MUgSS is a student-run club sponsored by the Statistics Department. We aim to provide academic and career resources for undergraduate students interested in statistics/data science and its many applications. We welcome students from all majors!

Name: Michigan Venture Club
Summary: Michigan Venture Club aims to create an organization that connects the campus and the VC industry. It provides students with the experience of entrepreneurship, industry research, deal sourcing, and other aspects of venture capital.

Name: Michigan Vertical Flight Technology
Description:
Michigan Vertical Flight Technology is a student-run project team founded in 2018 with a focus on the design and build of electric vertical take-off and landing (eVTOL) aircraft prototypes. These aircraft take off like a helicopter and fly like a plane, and they can be used for missions such as search and rescue, surveillance, humanitarian aid, package delivery, and the emerging industry of Urban Air Mobility (UAM). Our focus is getting students hands-on experience with sustainable eVTOL aircraft.

We have competed in the Vertical Flight Society's design-build-fly competitions for the past two years and placed first in the inaugural one in the 2020-2021 academic year. Prior to competing, the team spent its founding years on independent projects and working to start this intercollegiate design-build-fly team for eVTOL aircraft. 

All majors are welcome at MVFT, and it is a great multidisciplinary design challenge! Some of our current members’ majors include aerospace engineering, electrical engineering, computer science and mechanical engineering, but other non-STEM majors such as business, economics, and communications are welcome and much needed!

 

Below is a video compilation of some of our past work:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QRyuN1dFdQk&t=24s
Summary: Michigan Vertical Flight Technology is a student-run project team focused on the design and build of electric vertical take-off and landing (eVTOL) aircraft prototypes. Every major is welcome!

Name: Michigan Voting Project
Description: The Michigan Voting Project (MVP) seeks to provide University of Michigan law students non-partisan opportunities to explore legal issues in elections, campaigning, and voting rights.
Summary: The Michigan Voting Project (MVP) seeks to provide University of Michigan law students non-partisan opportunities to explore legal issues in elections, campaigning, and voting rights.

Name: Michigan Waterski Team
Description:
This organization is a group of students that love to waterski and wakeboard. We compete at collegiate water ski NCWSA sanctioned tournaments throughout the fall and are dedicated to improvement in the sport, friendly competition and camaraderie among fellow schools, and proudly representing University of Michigan to the waterski community.

Interested in joining? The quickest way to get in the loop is to shoot us an email at water.ski.officers@umich.edu

Feel free to check out our Instagram: @michiganwaterski or on YouTube if you want to see more of what we're up to!!
Summary: A group of students that love waterskiing and wakeboarding. We compete at collegiate tournaments and are dedicated to personal improvement in the sport, friendly competition with fellow schools, and representing U of M to the waterski community.

Name: Michigan Wealth & Asset Management Club
Description: Michigan Wealth and Asset Management Club is the first wealth/asset management club on campus. We specialize in member education for students who may be interested in wealth/asset management or finance in general. MWAM provides education sessions, professional development, speaker events with professionals in the industry, case studies, and a community for like minded individuals in a safe and diverse environment.
Summary: The first and only wealth and asset management club at the University of Michigan. Focused on educating members about the field of wealth/asset management through education sessions, professional development, and case studies.

Name: Michigan Weightlifting
Description: University of Michigan Weightlifting promotes a competitive environment for U-M students. We compete and represent Michigan in local competitions and national competitions (i.e. Junior Nationals, Under 25, University Championships, American Open I, II, III).
Summary: Weightlifting Club promotes a competitive environment for UM students and non students. We compete and represent Michigan in local competitions and national competitions (i.e. National Junior, Under 25, University Championships, American Open I,II,III).

Name: Michigan Wolveraas
Description:
Originally founded in 2001, Michigan Wolveraas is one of the oldest raas teams in the nation. A team steeped in tradition and fueled by passion, we have displayed and celebrated Indian heritage on and off campus for over two decades by spreading awareness of the vibrant raas-garba dance form to fellow students, as well as competing and placing at competitions across the nation. This year, we have come together to compete with a set full of creative formations, eye-catching moves, and high energy, all while spreading Indian culture to our fellow students and introducing new members to our tight-knit family. 

 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0qeSvF35RgI
Summary: Michigan Wolveraas is a competitive cultural dance team dedicated to spreading the tradition of raas and garba to the students of the University of Michigan while representing Michigan at various national competitions.

Name: Michigan Women Empowerment in Sport and Entertainment
Description: Michigan Women Empowerment in Sport & Entertainment is a student organization on campus focused on providing women students with opportunities to create strong connections with their peers and industry professionals, stimulating personal growth, and expanding professional networks in the sport and entertainment industries. Members will have the opportunity to benefit from one-on-one networking, mentorship programs, student organization collaborations, speaker events and round table discussions.
Summary: MWESE is established to provide an inclusive and safe space for women interested in sport and entertainment careers to expand their social and professional network. MWESE is devoted to the development of women leaders in the industry.

Name: Michigan Women Investment Group
Description: Our mission is to empower undergraduate women by providing a supportive community where we collectively strive to become knowledgeable and proficient in the realm of finance. We are dedicated to fostering an inclusive environment that promotes financial literacy, investment education, and professional growth. By leveraging our diverse backgrounds and perspectives, we aim to equip our members with the tools, skills, and confidence to navigate the complex world of finance successfully. Through interactive discussions, workshops, guest speakers, and hands-on investment opportunities, we endeavor to cultivate a strong foundation of financial understanding and strategic thinking. Our ultimate goal is to empower each member to secure their economic futures and become leaders in the field of finance. Together, we aspire to shatter barriers, challenge stereotypes, and create a lasting impact in the world of finance as confident and well-versed women.
Summary: Michigan Women Investment Group aims to foster financial literacy and professional support through education, collaboration, and practical experience for undergraduate women at the University of Michigan.

Name: Michigan Women's Intramural Lacrosse
Description: Michigan Women's Intramural Lacrosse is a place for lacrosse players that want a laid back environment to continue playing lacrosse.
Summary: Michigan Women's Intramural Lacrosse is a club that plays recreational lacrosse for fun and fitness.

Name: Michigan Yoga Club
Description:
Michigan Yoga Club welcomes UMich students of all levels to join an open-minded community that connects various facets of the student body through not only a physical yoga practice, but also a mindful one. 
 
Classes run from January to April and are held at aUM Yoga 1220 South University. To become a member, check out MYC's Instagram for more details @michiganyogaclub. 
 
WANT TO JOIN NOW? EMAIL: avatack@umich.edu
 
MYC Year Long Dues- $480.00: includes a 30-class package to aUM Yoga + Polarity, outdoor classes at S. University Park (Dates TBA), and Special Events ($800.00 Value). Classes are valid from September 6th - April 30th
​
MYC Yoga Fall Semester Dues - $255.00: includes a 15-class package to aUM Yoga + Polarity, outdoor classes at S. University Park (see schedule for details), and Special Events ($525 Value). Classes are valid from January 12th - April 30th. 
​
MYC Busy Body Dues - $90.00: include a 5-class package to aUM Yoga + Polarity and Special Events ($200 Value). Classes are valid for 60 days from purchase date.
Summary: Find Balance.  Find Friends.  Breathe Blue.

Name: Michigan Youth Sports Initiative
Description: The MYSI aspires to evaluate the inequalities in sport due to pay-to-play costs that neglect many lower income families the opportunity to have their youth participate in organized sport. To bridge this gap in surrounding communities, MYSI will provide these opportunities to youth through an acquisition of monetary and in-kind donations from interested sponsors to provide student-led youth teams and programs in the greater Ann Arbor area.
Summary: MYSI is a student led initiative aspiring to provide sports and structure in the lives of youth who have been previously neglected the opportunity to do so due to the pay-to-play costs that make sport inaccessible for many.

Name: Michigan-Blue Origin Payload Project Team
Description:
Project Overview

Design, build, test, and launch a project aboard New Shepard

MBOP-1 (2022-2023 project): Redundant, dissimilar system designed to measure simulated lunar gravity during sub-orbital flight. The data will be used to verify Blue Origin capsule sensor data
Summary: The Michigan-Blue Origin Payload Project Team is run through the Aerospace Engineering x88 course series; our mission as a project team is to design, build, test, and launch a payload or project aboard New Shepard.

Name: Michiganensian Yearbook
Description: The Michiganensian Yearbook is the only publication at the University of Michigan that can truly capture the spirit and character of the entire year. The Michiganensian is a full color, 376-page book featuring campus life, special events, sports, student organizations, and more. It also features the graduates from both the fall of 2020 and winter of 2021 academic terms.
Summary: The Michiganensian Yearbook is the official yearbook of the University of Michigan, and has been published annually for 124 years. Our staff proudly extends an invitation to help us continue this time-honored tradition by ordering your copy today!

Name: Middle Eastern and North African Law Students Association
Description: The Middle Eastern and North African Law Students Association (MENALSA) seeks to foster an inclusive environment and community network for Michigan law students who are interested in the Middle East or identify as Middle Eastern, including Arab, North African, Iranian, Turkish, and Armenian students. MENALSA hopes to provide a space at Michigan law where students of Middle Eastern descent can feel comfortable speaking out on a range of social, legal, and political issues central to their identities. MENALSA also works in tandem with other affinity groups to give Middle Eastern students and other minorities a stronger voice on campus. MENALSA hosts a range of events, including engaging the campus community through panel discussions and events that touch on matters pertaining to the Middle East, its people, and the diaspora. MENALSA seeks to provide opportunities to connect Middle Eastern students with resources to support them in law school and beyond.
Summary: MENALSA seeks to foster an inclusive environment and community network for Michigan law students who identify as being of, share an interest in, or are committed to the welfare of the Middle East and North Africa.

Name: Midnight Book Club
Description: Midnight Book Club is a long-form comedic improvisation team that works hard to make you laugh, cry, love, eat, pray, etc. Midnight Book Club plays on campus once a month for FREE, on other college campuses, and at College Improv Tournament in Chicago. Hit us up if you like watching prov or if you like doing the prov itself!
Summary:
Midnight Book Club is long-form improvisational comedy troupe. 

Comedy, improv, fun, "friends"! We wrote those words so we pop up in your maize page search. Hit us up.

Name: Mindful Michigan
Description:
Find balance, community, and mindfulness!

Mindful Michigan aims to cultivate a diverse community through modern mindfulness practices, including meditation and yoga -- we think that social interaction and engagement are primary means for doing so. Weekly meetings are low commitment and consist of a group discussion on various topics, and conclude with a short meditation practice. We also have less frequent group outings to engage in mindful activities varying from raspberry picking to camping in upstate.

If you have any questions about the club, please feel free to reach out!
Summary: In Mindful Michigan, we aim to cultivate a community of like-minded individuals interested in mindfulness and all things surrounding it.

Name: Minorities in Agriculture, Natural Resources, and Related Sciences of the University of Michigan
Description: Minorities in Agriculture, Natural Resources and Related Sciences (MANRRS) is a national organization with chapters around the country that welcomes people of all backgrounds in agriculture, natural resources, and related sciences focused fields. As a MANRRS undergraduate or graduate member, you will learn valuable career building and networking skills through community service opportunities, skill-building workshops, and conference participation.
Summary: MANRRS is a national organization with chapters around the country that supports students from underrepresented backgrounds in the fields of agriculture, natural resources, and related sciences through academic and professional development opportunities.

Name: Miss STEM Careers
Description: Miss STEM Careers is an NPO and UM club that generates an early interest in STEM careers among young girls through semester-long educational programs which provide teachings regarding STEM careers with substantial gender gaps. This service is designed to foster a lifelong community of driven young women and to provide them with the support and opportunities they need to succeed within the world of STEM.
Summary: Our mission is to provide girls the inspiration they need to pursue STEM career opportunities that traditionally have a gender gap.

Name: Mission Menstruation
Description:
Mission Menstruation at the University of Michigan is a chapter under the national Mission Menstruation organization in partnership with its other collegiate chapters.

 

Mission Menstruation (MM) seeks to hold academic institutions accountable by advocating for better access to free emergency period products. We are committed to establishing sustainable solutions to dismantle the barriers created by systems and furthering the academic success of menstruating people through advocacy programs that promote inclusivity and period equity.

 

The University of Michigan chapter of Mission Menstruation believes that menstrual hygiene is a right, not a privilege. Academic institutions, upon being motivated by students, can address period poverty. With the belief that higher education institutions set the precedent for the way that many other institutions treat marginalized groups, working to educate and advocate for all students who menstruate on these campuses is the first step in making change for all people who have periods.

 

In addition to higher academic institutions, such as but not limited to universities, colleges, and conservatories, etc, the Michigan State Legislature, like sixteen other states (New York, Maryland, Illinois, etc), should take action to implement funding or mandatory budgeting within public school districts for menstrual product dispensers and free products.

 

Menstrual Poverty impacts numerous groups, however research showcases that women of low-income are most affected, followed by low-income students on university campuses. According to the ACLU, “a recent study demonstrated that two-thirds of low-income women in St. Louis could not afford menstrual products during the previous year, instead using cloth, rags, diapers, or paper as a substitute” (ACLU, 2023). Advocating for legislation and supporting groups with the highest rates of menstrual equity, is the most important goal of our chapter at the University of Michigan.
Summary: Mission Menstruation seeks to increase access to free period products on Michigan’s campus and in the greater communities of Washtenaw County. We advocate and work for solutions to period poverty and educate for individuals on menstrual equity

Name: MIST
Description: MIST is an organization geared towards bringing students together to develop leadership, communication, and other creative skills, all while gaining a deeper understanding of Islam and Muslims.
Summary: MIST is an organization geared towards bringing students together to develop leadership, communication, and other creative skills, all while gaining a deeper understanding of Islam and Muslims.

Name: MiTutor
Description: MiTutor is a volunteer-based organization that hails from Ann Arbor, Michigan. Through an individualized matching process, we pair University of Michigan college students with kids who may be struggling in school, to help them reach their full academic potential. Our organization offers free, virtual tutoring to K-12 students in Southeast Michigan.
Summary: MiTutor is a volunteer-based organization that offers free, virtual tutoring to K-12 students in Southeast Michigan. We pair University of Michigan undergraduates with families in the area to help support their academic and personal endeavors.

Name: Mixed@Michigan
Description: Mixed@Michigan is committed to fostering a community of multiracial, multiethnic, transnational adoptee, and international students. Together, we strive to further understand the complexities of the mixed-identity experience and actively participate in advocation, education, and support for mixed students’ well-being, identity exploration, and other pertinent issues.
Summary: Mixed@Michigan fosters a community of mixed, biracial, multiracial, multiethnic, and transnational adoptee students on campus in an effort to create a safe space for cultural exploration and connection.

Name: MLaw Rocks
ShortName: Law Student Rock Climbing Club for Law Student Rock Climbers
Description: MLawRocks! aims to facilitate a rock climbing community among students, faculty, & staff of the University of Michigan Law School to help provide a mental and physical balance to their academic & professional pursuits
Summary: MLawRocks! aims to facilitate a rock climbing community among students, faculty, & staff of the University of Michigan Law School to help provide a mental and physical balance to their academic & professional pursuits

Name: MLead
Description: MLead is a collective of leadership educators that connect students to opportunities that empower them to create social change on their campus and in their community.
Summary: MLead is a collective of leadership educators that connect students to opportunities that empower them to create social change on their campus and in their community.

Name: Mock Trial Team
Description:
Michigan Mock Trial (MMT) is a nationally ranked program within the American Mock Trial Association. MMT prides itself on competitive excellence through the development of analytical, legal, and communications skills, which will serve members regardless of what profession they choose. Through dedicated practice and fierce competition, members develop a complex understanding of legal rules, craft case theories and arguments, and perform as both witnesses and attorneys in high-level competitions. Michigan Mock Trial is entirely student-run, allowing members to take ownership over every step of the process - from the classroom to the courtroom. And of course, travelling to competitions around the nation leads to lifelong friendships and memories.

To learn more about how to join the Michigan Mock Trial, check out our website at michiganmocktrial.com.
Summary: The Michigan Mock Trial Team is a powerhouse in collegiate mock trial. We participate in a form of competitive performance and legal debate, travelling across the nation to portray witnesses and attorneys in trial simulations.

Name: Model Federal Open Market Committee (MFED)
Description: MFED was created in hopes of better understanding the Federal Reserve, specifically by modeling the Federal Open Market Committee’s actions using possible real-world economic scenarios. We aim to host professional speaker events, predict federal interest rates and monetary policy, as well as participate in an annual Mock FOMC competition hosted by the Federal Reserve. MFED works to improve financial literacy and prepare members for the professional world. Email MFED-eboard@umich.edu for more information and/or follow our instagram @mfedumich to stay up to date on recruitment cycles.
Summary: MFED works to spread financial literacy and prepare members for the professional world by modeling monetary policy, global relations, and competing in the annual Mock FOMC competition.

Name: Model United Nations at the University of Michigan
Description:
Model United Nations at the University of Michigan (MUNUM) is a student organization that puts on a Model UN conference for high school students completely organized and run by students at the University of Michigan. Our goal is to provide delegates a space in which to broaden their understanding of international affairs and develop the skills to tackle global issues. The 2024 conference will take place in the winter semester and marks our thirty-seventh iteration!

Membership is open to any student, faculty, or staff at the University of Michigan. We welcome students of all experience levels from diverse fields of study. If you are passionate about international affairs, diplomacy, education, or simply want to spend time with an incredibly dedicated group of students, consider joining the staff of MUNUM!
Summary: MUNUM hosts an annual four-day conference for over 800 high school delegates who are passionate about global issues and diplomacy.

Name: Moli Dance Troupe at University of Michigan
Description:
History:

Moli Dance Troupe was established in 2013 by a group of enthusiastic Chinese dance lovers. In the fall of 2013, Moli's very first debut dance "Xiu Se" (The elegance of the sleeves), performed in Mendelssohn Theater, was a huge success. "Xiu Se" and the dance troupe have since attracted many more students who are interested in Chinese culture and Chinese dance.

Mission:

Our dance troupe aims to promote Chinese culture through the beauty of performing arts. Moli brings to our audience an eclectic collection of dances and performances that evolve from China's thousands years of history: from ethnic dances, to classical dances, and eventually to modern chinese fusion dances. Through Moli, we bring to the University of Michigan community a unique set of eastern movements, thinking, and arts.

Growth:

Moli's literal meaning is the jasmine flower, which is a symbol of friendship in Chinese culture. We welcome both experienced and inexperienced dancers to join the dance troupe. In the long run, Moli aims to expand the realm of performance to Chinese Drama and Chinese costume modeling. We firmly believe that while Moli brings to our audience the best pieces of performing arts from Chinese culture, the strong interests in Eastern arts and dancing in the University of Michigan community will continue support us and help Moli grow.
Summary: With choreography ranging from k-pop, hip hop, jazz, to traditional Chinese dance, Moli Dance Group aims to promote Chinese culture and provide opportunities for those interested in dance through high-quality dance cover videos and performances.

Name: Morgan's Message University of Michigan
Description: Morgan's Message is a worldwide nonprofit organization that was founded after Morgan- a Duke Women's lacrosse player took her life after struggling with mental health issues. This organization expands the dialogue on mental health, normalizes conversations, empowers those who suffer, and supports those who feel alone to reduce the stigma associated with mental health in the world of athletics.
Summary: Morgan's Message strives to eliminate the stigma associated with mental health within the student-athlete community.

Name: Mosaic Students
Description: This organization consists of a community of college-aged students who are unique and imperfect individuals with complementary gifts, strengths, experiences, and abilities. Mosaic Students encourages its members to engage in the community in many different ways, whether it be through another organization, individual projects, or serving as a group. Our unique gifts allow us to serve in many different ways, which we do joyfully and lovingly.
Summary: A community made up of unique and imperfect individuals with complementary gifts, strengths, experiences, and abilities. A body, strengthened by its diversity, charged to support its members and lovingly serve others.

Name: Mosher Jordan Hall Council
Description: Mosher-Jordan Hall Council is a community council designed to program events/activities, purchase building improvements, and assess the needs of the residents in order to better serve the community. The Hall Council executive board consists of Mosher-Jordan residents that are democratically elected by the residential community.
Summary: Mosher-Jordan Hall Council is a community council ran by the residents for the residents. The council provides programs and serves in order to serve the needs of the community and make MoJo a better place to live.

Name: Motley Crew
Description:
Motley Crew at the University of Michigan is a volunteer student organization dedicated to enriching the lives of children, adults, and families through funding, volunteering at, and hosting themed events at a variety of facilities in Southeast Michigan. We volunteer with the Down Syndrome Support Team, Down Syndrome Guild of Southeast Michigan, Penrickton Center for Blind Children, Veteran Affairs Hospital in Ann Arbor, Children's Hospital of Michigan at the Detroit Medical Center, and Fresh Start Clubhouse.

In addition to volunteering, Motley Crew strongly values membership commitment, membership bonding, and community. As such, we host numerous social gatherings for members throughout the semester such as blanket making, pumpkin painting, trivia, going to cider mills, movie parties, study tables, tie-dye parties, and more. 
​
Founded in 2009, Motley Crew got its start volunteering at Mott Children's Hospital with a dedicated crew of 30 members. We have since expanded to over 200 members and volunteer at many facilities. We are always looking for ways to improve our ties to the community, overall club experience for our members, and scale of our events.
Summary: Motley Crew funds, volunteers at, and hosts themed events for children and families at a variety of medical facilities in Southeast Michigan.

Name: Movement Lawyering
Description: The purpose of this club is to promote gentle exercise and social awareness among law school students. In order to provide a supportive and inclusive community for individuals of all fitness and knowledge levels, we host events that incorporate both easy movement and education on pertinent social justice movements.
Summary:
The purpose of this club is to promote gentle exercise and social awareness among law
school students. We aim to provide an inclusive community for individuals of all fitness and knowledge
levels.

Name: Movement of Under-represented Sisters in Engineering and Science
Description: This organization is designed to provide a unique support structure for women from underrepresented and underserved backgrounds who are pursuing advanced degrees, particularly in STEM at the University of Michigan.  MUSES utilizes three principles that are critical to creating an effective support system: empowerment, harmony, and mentoring.
Summary: An organization designed to provide a unique support structure for women of color pursuing advanced degrees at the University of Michigan.

Name: MPowered Entrepreneurship
Description:
MPowered Entrepreneurship is the largest and oldest entrepreneurial organization at the University of Michigan. MPowered brings together a group of highly motivated, detail-oriented students who aren’t afraid to take risks. Our group consists of innovators and on-campus leaders. We pride ourselves on the lasting impact we have on the entrepreneurial community on and off-campus. MPowered members gain lifelong connections as well as valuable skills needed to become better people, students, and entrepreneurs.

 

A taste of what we do:

Makeathon: a 36-hour product design competition and recruitment fair that engages 200+ students and attracts sponsors including Amazon, Google, Texas Instruments, etc

 

Startup Career Fair: a recruiting event that connects 750+ student developers, designers, and talent interested in entrepreneurship to career and internship opportunities at 40+ startups

 

1000 Pitches: a low-stakes, high-energy pitch competition that engages thousands of students on-campus each year

 

Consulting: a pro bono venture support organization focused on solving real business challenges for startups to promote innovation and growth within the local entrepreneurial community

 

TrailBlaze: an outreach program that brings U-M’s diverse skills and resources to low-income, first-generation middle school students to learn about technology, entrepreneurship, and innovation

 

Product Showcase: a launch platform for small startups that want to bring their product into a physical space.

 

Spark Speaker Podcast: a podcast and in-person event series where we speak with entrepreneurs and gain a better understanding of their journey while also discussing topics relevant to entrepreneurship.

 

Marketing & Creative: a team that builds the MPowered presence across campus, online, at all of our events, and beyond

 

We have something for everyone! All members benefit from professional development and learning opportunities including the chance to build out their own idea with the support of MPowered.

For information on how to join, check out our website: https://mpowered.umich.edu/
Summary: The goal of MPowered is two-fold: one, to bring out the courageous self-starters among us to begin their entrepreneurial journey through project based work, and two, to spread their passion to the rest of the U-M community

Name: MRacing Formula SAE
Description: Founded in 1986, the MRacing SAE team at the University of Michigan in Ann Arbor gives engineers the knowledge and teamwork experience critical to excelling in any field. Each year we design, build, and race a formula-style car against other college teams worldwide. We have a long-standing legacy of high-performing vehicles, great success at competitions, and a team that exemplifies the high level of commitment and focus needed to build a winning car. In the past four competition seasons, we placed 1st in the United States and are currently ranked 5th in the world out of over 600 teams. Our most recent achievement includes 1st Overall at Formula SAE Michigan, the biggest collegiate formula competition in the world.
Summary: The University of Michigan - Ann Arbor's Formula SAE Team

Name: MRun – Michigan Running Club
Description:
MRun (as we call ourselves) is a super active club that offers way more than just running. In addition to daily practices, cross country meets, and track meets, we also have numerous social events and charity events throughout each semester! We have about 200 dues-paying members so there's always someone to run with! In the past we've traveled everywhere from Hershey, Pennsylvania, to Richmond, Virginia, for meets.


Getting involved with MRun couldn't be easier--all you have to do is start showing up! During the fall we compete in Cross Country meets, and in the Winter/Spring, Track and Field. Beginning the first day of school in September we hold daily practices that offer a variety of running routes and distances. We meet outside the Central Campus Recreation Building (CCRB) on the walking bridge over Washtenaw Ave. every weekday at 4:15 PM where we will have usually a 3 mile, 5 mile, and 7 mile group go out for runs! We go to races about every other weekend during the Fall, and travel to locations anywhere from East Lansing, Michigan to Anderson, Indiana to Hershey, Pennsylvania. We also have a very successful Track and Field program so if you are not interested in long distance running, there are great opportunities for sprinting, jumping and throwing throughout the entire school year. There are track facilities available and practices and workouts for these events as well. 


However, the absolute best thing about MRun is that every practice, event, or anything is completely optional. You can come as much as you want! We have people who show up every day, and others once a month--it's entirely up to you!


As for social events and charity events, nobody does them better than MRun. During the beginning of the year, we have a bunch of events to help new members (especially Freshmen) get to know everyone in the club. We often joke that we're really just a giant "MRun family" and we've been told that we're one of the most welcoming clubs on campus. Keep in contact with the club as the school year gets closer so you'll know more specifically when these events are! There will be a mass meeting, social events, and many other fun things going on first semester to make the transition into the club as easy and fun as possible!
Summary: The Michigan Running Club (MRun, as we call ourselves) is a very active club that offers more than just running. In addition to daily practices, cross country meets, and track meets, we also have social events and charity events throughout each semester.

Name: MSTP Women and Allies
Description: MSTP Women and Allies is a student run organization that provides access and resources to promote an inclusive training environment as program members prepare for careers in science and medicine.
Summary: MSTP Women and Allies is a student run organization that provides access and resources to promote an inclusive training environment as program members prepare for careers in science and medicine.

Name: Mswing
Description:
MSwing is a social swing dance org focused on teaching the hustle style of swing to whoever wants to learn.  Swing dancing (specifically hustle, or 4-count swing) is a relatively simple partner dance -- and a great way to show off in front of friends or at parties! We're completely free to attend, we're non-competitive, and we have no attendance requirement -- you can feel free to attend as much or as little as you would like to. Each meeting, we'll teach both a beginner and and advanced lesson, play some games, have some open dance, and have E-Board members available for additional help/teach additional moves if desired after meetings end!

 

To receive email updates, please sign yourself up for the email list here: https://mcommunity.umich.edu/group/Mswing%20members

Our schedule for the semester is posted as maize pages events, and we also send out weekly emails reminding when meetings will be. If you have any further questions, please feel free to email leodonne@umich.edu for additional help. We can't wait to meet you :)
Summary: MSwing is a free, social swing dancing club where we do the hustle style of swing -- a partner dance (no partner is required to attend). We meet once a week to teach both beginner and advanced lessons -- no experience required! We'd love to have you :)

Name: MTrek
Description: MTreks are adventure trips around the country and globe designed to foster friendships among classmates, promote leadership development, and introduce incoming MBA students to the team-based environment at the Ross School of Business. Trips take place in after MBA1 orientation in late-August and are open to all incoming students. Small groups of incoming MBA1s students are led by rising MBA2 mentors. Trips vary in location and activities. MTrek is more than a club - it is honored tradition and key point of differentiation for Ross.
Summary: MTrek organizes trips for incoming full-time MBA1s at the Ross School of Business that are led by MBA2s to various destinations before the start of the MBA program.

Name: Mu Epsilon Delta
Description:
We are a co-educational, pre-health fraternity whose mission is to prepare our members on their journey to careers in the health field through professional and academic development, service opportunities, and building a support system of lifelong friendships. MED is a family of students who will both celebrate each other's accomplishments and guide each other through the difficulties of the pre-health path. We foster a community of growth and are committed to the betterment of our brothers to create better future leaders in healthcare. 

 

If you have questions related to rushing in Fall '23, please contact medrushf23@umich.edu. 

 

Visit our website www.medumich.com for more information on our organization and our recruitment process!

Questions about recruitment may be directed to MEDrecruitment@umich.edu

Sign up for our rush emails here
Summary: We are a Pre-Health Fraternity at the University of Michigan dedicated to service, medicine, and brotherhood.

Name: Multicultural Economics Coalition
Description:
The purpose of the Michigan Economics Coalition is to establish a community of underrepresented minority students at the University of Michigan, to encourage coalition building between aspiring economists, and to advocate for diversification in the field of economics.

 

The Michigan Economics Coalition was founded by a collection of underrepresented women studying economics at the University of Michigan to ensure that the field of economics is open for, accessible to, and inspired by Black People, Indigenous People, and People of Color. Economics is a field that contains diversity of thought in a myriad of ways. The Michigan Economics Coalition exists to reflect that same diversity in color, experience, and background.
Summary: MEC strives to establish a community of underrepresented minority students at the University of Michigan, to encourage coalition building between aspiring economists, and to advocate for diversification in the field of economics.

Name: Multicultural Greek Council
Description: The Multicultural Greek Council, 12 organizations, consisting of both fraternities and sororities, was established at the University of Michigan in 2002. With a focus on specific ethnicities, cultures, and/or multiculturalism. In general, these organizations are united to serve as a unique voice and advocate for their respective communities. Service and education are of primary importance, and social activities complete a well-rounded experience for these students.
Summary: The mission of the Multicultural Greek Council shall be to serve all MGC organizations as a support group in their events and communities, to promote multiculturalism and to improve relations between all campus Greeks.

Name: Multicultural Youth Striving to Incorporate Cohesiveness
Description:
MYSTIC is a multicultural council that strives to initiate community building programming, as well as social and cultural events for Alice Lloyd residents, in order to foster increased social and cultural awareness and acceptance within our community.

We seek to help create a safe and inclusive community where residents can learn to understand and accept their own and others' identities by promoting an awareness and appreciation of multiculturalism and diversity, by educating others (and ourselves) about social justice issues, and by celebrating the diversity of our community.
Summary: MYSTIC is a multicultural council that strives to initiate community building programming, as well as social and cultural events for Alice Lloyd residents, in order to foster increased social and cultural awareness and acceptance within our community.

Name: Multiculturalism of Stockwell Advancing Identities and Cultures
Description: This multicultural organization is to provide social and political support for minority and underrepresented groups of residents in Stockwell Residence Hall.
Summary: Resident multicultural council of Stockwell Hall

Name: Multiverse Media
Description:
Multiverse Media is an eclectic, four-episode television series that will function as an artist’s playground, community builder, and resume enhancer. It begins with a writer's room that will write all four, fifteen-minute episodes of our series. The scripts will feature four distinct characters, three locations, and limited stage directions and design suggestions. From there, four teams will each take on a different episode to design and produce. They will create an aesthetic that captures their interpretation of the world of the show, choosing locations and actors to complete their vision. In addition, each episode will include a custom, student-made theme song and poster which capture the team’s artistic vision. Teams are not allowed to view other episodes before their episode is complete in an effort to make them as unique as possible. Our goal is to showcase a wide range of students’ creativity and to build a network across departments in the process. Once a team has completed their episode, it will be aired on our Youtube channel, @MultiverseMedia, for anyone and everyone to view. By the end of the semester, we will have our completed series uploaded to our Youtube channel for everyone to share and appreciate.

MM is established to share the talents of our students, create a network of artists, provide funded learning opportunities, and foster an environment that encourages curiosity and collaboration. Overall, this organization creates a campus-wide community that highlights and appreciates the talents of its individuals. Beyond the University, our series is created to share the incredible talent, creativity, and curiosity of our students with the world.
Summary: Multiverse Media is an eclectic television series that will function as an artist’s playground, community builder, and resume enhancer. We aim to create a campus-wide community that highlights and appreciates the talents of its students.

Name: Munger Graduate Residences
Summary: Munger Graduate Residences

Name: Music For Dementia
Description: This is the University of Michigan Chapter of Music for Dementia (MFD), founded in 2019. MFD aims to help nursing home residents suffering from dementia cope with memory loss and find more joy in everyday life through a personalized music program. Familiar music helps them become more present and connected to their environment, so the program focuses on each individual by providing live performances and personalized playlists on digital devices. The club relies on volunteers to inquire about residents’ musical preferences and perform songs they would enjoy. All levels of expertise in instrument/vocals are welcome. MFD is a venue for volunteers to meet, form musical groups, and perform in front of an audience. UofM students mainly volunteer at the Brookdale and Orchard Hills care facilities in Ann Arbor, but we hope to expand to other facilities as well! Other sites are also available for those residing outside of Ann Arbor. Volunteer orientation is offered at the beginning of the semester and online workshops are provided throughout.
Summary: Music for Dementia is a volunteer-based student org that aims to help nursing home residents suffering from dementia cope with memory loss and find more joy in everyday life through live musical performances and a personalized music program.

Name: MUSIC Matters
Description: We are one of the largest student organizations at the University of Michigan. Every April we host SpringFest: a full-day lifestyle and music festival run by students, for students. Our proceeds from SpringFest and other concerts showcasing local talent throughout the year allow us to fund our three Social Ventures: The Big Thinkers Scholarship, MOvE: Michigan Overnight Experience, and The CoMMunity Partnership. These Social Ventures and our year-round events allow us to create educational opportunities and celebrate the vibrant Michigan community. Through our collective passion for music and social activism, we intend to make a tangible and positive impact on our community.
Summary: MUSIC Matters is a student-run non-profit organization that aims to use the unifying power of music to drive social impact in our community.

Name: Music Meditation Club
Description:
---EVENTS---

We meet on Tuesdays on 6:30 PM @ East Quad Room 1511! Check out our Instagram for our latest events and meetings!

Click this link to view our Instagram Page

---DESCRIPTION---

Music Meditation Club wishes to facilitate as a meeting place, where we can provide an open, soothing and enriching environment to escape from stress and anxiety; building a community diverse, balanced and supportive. Our key objectives are: 

  • To encourage the student community to appreciate and understand higher dimensions of knowledge as given in the Vedic scriptures.
  • To systematically propagate spiritual knowledge to the student body and to educate all people in the techniques of spiritual life in order to check the imbalance of values in life and to achieve real unity and peace, individually and collectively.
  • To discuss modern issues in the light of the ancient Vedic literatures and encourage modern thinkers to appreciate and apply these ideas.
  • To encourage all youth to espouse eternal principles as given in the Vedic literatures that would help them develop stable, well-rounded personalities.
  • To help all people to discern reality from illusion, spirit from matter, the eternal from the temporary.
  • To develop character and qualities, by incorporating a regulated schedule in our daily lives by efficient time management, stress management and cultivating healthy habits.
  • To help youth to become strong and effective leaders in the society by inculcating the qualities such as humility and compassion towards others.
  • To encourage people in simple living and high thinking.
  • To provide opportunities for involvement and to bring out our inherent skills.
Summary: Through discussion groups, yoga, guided & music meditation, the Music Meditation Club encourages a shift in consciousness and spiritual growth to help students uncover meaning and depth in everyday life. We meet on Tuesdays @ 6:30 PM, East Quad Room 1511

Name: Music Teachers National Association Collegiate Chapter
Description: Founded in 1876 by Theodore Presser and sixty-two of his friends, the Music Teachers National Association is currently the largest professional, non-profit music teachers organization in the world. More than 26,000 members—comprised of independent and collegiate music teachers—are committed to furthering the art of music through teaching, performance, composition and scholarly research. This collegiate chapter aims to be active in five key areas: Recruitment and Exposure, Community and Teacher Service, Research and Presentations, Collaboration and Networking, and Fundraising.
Summary: More than 26,000 MTNA members worldwide—comprised of independent and collegiate music teachers—are committed to furthering the art of music through teaching, performance, composition and scholarly research.

Name: Musicians in STEM
Description: MSTEM strives to create an inclusive environment for students looking to pursue a career in the STEM field, while also maintaining a musical background and love for their instrument. We will share resources to support each other in the competitive academic environment, along with provide each other with opportunities to get more involved with playing their instrument on campus.
Summary: MSTEM is a platform for musicians majoring in STEM who are looking to continue their passion for music. We will work to maintain our love for music in the pursuit of an academically demanding field.

Name: MUSKET/UAC
Description:
MUSKET is the only completely student run musical theatre company on the University of Michigan's campus. Whether it be as an actor on stage, a crew member behind the scenes, or an audience member in the distinguished Power Center venue, there are many opportunities for University of Michigan students to become involved. Each year, MUSKET presents two musical productions: one in the fall semester and one in the winter semester.  

MUSKET has presented a wide variety of shows ranging from classics like WEST SIDE STORY and OKLAHOMA to more contemporary works such as IN THE HEIGHTS and LEGALLY BLONDE and continues to explore ways in which quality theatre can be presented to the University of Michigan and Ann Arbor community. MUSKET is also proud to lay claim to many alums working in the industry, such as Benj Pasek, Justin Paul, Andrew Lippa, Taylor Louderman and many more.
Summary: MUSKET is the only completely student run musical theatre organization, running for almost 100 years. We produce two large-scale musicals per year in the Power Center, and both theatre and non-theatre majors are encouraged to participate.

Name: Muslim Business Students' Association
Description: MBSA is a career-oriented community of Muslim students interested in the various areas of business. We primarily focus on networking, socials, application assistance, interview preparation, and a host of other activities.
Summary: A student organization dedicated to preparing pre-business Muslim students for business school and Muslim students interested in business for a prosperous career through networking, information workshops, and personalized coaching.

Name: Muslim Engineering Society
Description:
MES complements STEM education with professional development to build strong careers. We have a diverse and talented network, with experience at Fortune 500 companies and hot startups. Contact us for coding interview prep, resume advice, courses, & more.

We are much more than just an org, as we are branching further into hosting large events, personal help sessions, and a breadth of many more ideas. Join the MES to become a part of an org making strides in upholding the Muslim and greater Engineering student community at the University of Michigan!
Summary: MES complements STEM education with professional development to build strong careers. We have a diverse and talented network with experience at Fortune 500 companies and top startups. Contact us for coding interview prep, resume advice, courses, & more.

Name: Muslim Fitness Club
Description: MFC exists to help create a safe space for people in the muslim community to not only look for health and fitness knowledge, but also to workout and exercise with a supportive group of peers that share the same fitness and spiritual goals.
Summary: MFC exists to help create a safe space for people in the muslim community to not only look for health and fitness knowledge, but also to workout and exercise with a supportive group of peers that share the same fitness and spiritual goals.

Name: Muslim Graduate Students Association
Description:
The Muslim Graduate Students Association seeks to serve the interests of Muslim graduate students and researchers at the University of Michigan. Specifically, we seek to reach out to those graduate students who do not fall under the umbrella of other Muslim graduate student oragnizations such as the Muslim Medical Students Association or Muslim Engineering Association. We hold educational events and bring in guest speakers, provide social activities, and maintain a mentorhsip program between Muslim graduate students and undergradute students. We also collaborate with other organizations such as the Muslim Students Association to provide events such as the Hijabi Monologues. 

If you would like to be added to our email list for the 2020/2021 academic year, please fill out this form: https://forms.gle/Tgo3VM3RvLGfNzYR9
Summary: The Muslim Graduate Students Association seeks to serve the interests of Muslim graduate students and researchers at the University of Michigan.

Name: Muslim Law Students Association
Description: The MLSA is dedicated to raising awareness regarding legal matters related to American Muslims and Muslims around the world. It also aims to create a community where Muslim law students and other law students interested in learning more about issues affecting Muslim communities and the law can come together.
Summary: MLSA is dedicated to raising awareness regarding legal matters related to American Muslims and Muslims around the world.

Name: Muslim Students in Public Health
Description:
In Muslims Students in Public Health our focus is to create an inclusive organization that focuses on professional development, community service and building bridges with our cultures. We are hoping to connect people from different backgrounds as well as those who share our commonalities. Our meetings will focus on networking, volunteering, advocacy and alumni engagement. 

Our hope is to create a diverse organization that enables University of Michigan students to create a positive impact in Ann Arbor and to build lasting connections with alumni and current students. We hope to facilitate events that create a positive difference through direct community involvement.
Summary: Our purpose is to help build a strong Muslim community here on campus to help them pursue a career in Public Health. Through professional development and networking, we hope to encourage students to be engaged with fellow peers and network with alumni.

Name: Muslim Students' Association
Description:
Assalamu Alaikum Warahmatullahi Wabarakatuhu,

Welcome to the Muslim Students' Association at the University of Michigan! Established in 1964, U-M MSA is one of the oldest MSA chapters in the country and has developed into one of the most active and vibrant student organizations on campus. Since then, the MSA has undergone tremendous growth and progress as its members continuously strive to be the Leaders and Best in strengthening faith, knowledge, and community. We invite you to join us in building on the thrilling and unique Michigan Muslim experience, as well as in promoting the spirit of diversity and dialogue of the Michigan and Ann Arbor community. We welcome everyone to become involved, join our meetings, and stay connected with us. Please browse through our webpage or visit our Facebook page, and feel free to get in touch with us at any time!

With peace,
Your MSA Board

Contact Us

About Us

Our Services

Our Committees
Summary: Welcome to the MSA! We are one of the most active and vibrant student organizations on campus. We strive to be the Leaders and Best in strengthening faith, knowledge and community. We invite you to join us in building onto the Michigan Muslim experience.

Name: Narrative Medicine Interest Group
Description: In this group, we aim to create a space for medical students to share and discuss narrative medicine pieces, work on their own writing, engage in activities such as group book clubs, and find community among fellow medical students who enjoy reading and writing.
Summary: This is a space for medical students to share and discuss narrative medicine pieces, work on their own writing, engage in activities such as group book clubs, and find community among fellow medical students who enjoy reading and writing.

Name: National Arab American Medical Association at the University of Michigan Medical School
Description: NAAMA NextGen at University of Michigan Medical School is the NAAMA graduate chapter at UofM that aims to develop avenues to promote consciousness of health-related needs of Arab and Arab American populations. It also aims to offer opportunities for graduate and undergraduate students to be supported on their journeys to careers in healthcare through mentorship and networking.
Summary: NAAMA NextGen at University of Michigan Medical School is geared towards promoting health literacy of Arab American populations and establishing a structured tier of mentorship among undergraduate and medical students.

Name: National Arab American Medical Association NextGen
Description: The National Arab American Medical Association (NAAMA) is a nonprofit, nonpolitical, educational and humanitarian organization of medical and dental professionals of Arab descent. NAAMA was incorporated in California in 1975 and became a national organization in 1980. Currently, 27 chapters of NAAMA are established in the United States and Canada.  This year, current President-elect Dr. Rouba Ali-Fehmi and the board of NAAMA decided to expand the influence of NAAMA to benefit students who are both interested in their culture as well as have an affinity for the medical sciences. The University of Michigan chapter of the NAAMA NextGen is the debut on-campus NAAMA-affiliated organization, and hopefully the first of many nationwide. Our mission is to help students explore their interest in medicine by providing opportunities to observe or shadow physicians, assisting them with resumes and the medical school application processes, and incorporate the charitable goals of NAAMA by organizing volunteer trips to communities in need both domestically and internationally.
Summary: The NAAMA NextGen is a collective of Arab American students who are interested in medicine. Through their affiliation with the organization, they receive mentorship from esteemed physicians as well as contribute to charitable causes.

Name: National Association for the Advancement of Colored People
Description:
Celebrating 111 Years of Youth Leadership and Activism

The NAACP believes strongly that future leaders must be developed today, and such development is ongoing in the Youth & College Division, created in 1936. Today there are more than 25,000 young people, under the age of 25, representing 700 Youth Councils, High School Chapters and College Chapters actively involved in the fight for civil rights. The NAACP has one of the largest organized groups of young people of any secular organization in the country.

MISSION

The mission of the NAACP Youth & College Division shall be to inform youth of the problems affecting African Americans and other racial and ethnic minorities; to advance the economic, education, social and political status of African Americans and other racial and ethnic minorities and their harmonious cooperation with other peoples; to stimulate an appreciation of the African Diaspora and other people of color’s contribution to civilization; and to develop an intelligent, militant effective youth leadership.

VISION

Developing a New Generation of Civil Rights and Community Leaders

OBJECTIVES

  • Provide young people with personal and leadership development training
  • Proactive political and community activism
  • Public awareness of the necessity of positive youth engagement

ISSUES

Students have always been at the forefront of most major social movements. From the Civil Rights Movement of the 60’s to the anti-apartheid movement of the 1980’s, student activism has forced society and the world to change. NAACP youth units across America are engaged in social justice activism addressing issues at the local, state and national level. The primary focus issues for the Division are the following:

  • Economic Development
  • Education
  • Health & Awareness
  • Juvenile Justice
  • Political Action
  • Voter Empowerment
Summary: Founded in 1909, the NAACP has been the forefront in Civil Rights struggles. The U of M chapter aspires bring together students of color and their allies on campus. Join us today as we make tomorrow's history and try to right yesterday's wrongs.

Name: National Council of Negro Women at The University of Michigan
Description:
The National Council of Negro Women UM highlights issues that have strong effects on women of color such as political awareness, social issues, health issues, and education. We seek to maintain and also to increase the retainment of more women of color here at the University of Michigan.

NCNW-UM focuses on professional development, sexual/reproductive health, physical and spiritual wellness, political awareness, and community service, among others. We are a resource to unite and holistically serve women of color on this campus.
Summary: NCNW-UM seeks to aid in the growth of women of all ethnicities on the U of M campus and surrounding areas through advocacy and programs with a focus on issues that relate to women such as political awareness, social, health, and education issues.

Name: National Lawyers Guild
Description:
We exist to provide a home for truly progressive law students. We train law students to be legal observers whose presence may serve as a deterrent to unconstitutional behavior by law enforcement during protests and demonstrations. We also host panel lunches, collaborative events, and networking opportunities for students to meet truly progressive attorneys across the public and private sectors. 

We are a law student chapter of the National Lawyers Guild, the nation’s oldest and largest progressive bar association and the first one in the US to be racially integrated. NLG's mission is to use law for the people, uniting lawyers, law students, legal workers, and jailhouse lawyers to function as an effective force in the service of the people by valuing human rights and the rights of ecosystems over property interests. NLG is dedicated to the need for basic change in the structure of our political and economic system. Our aim is to bring together all those who recognize the importance of safeguarding and extending the rights of workers, women, LGBTQ people, farmers, people with disabilities and people of color, upon whom the welfare of the entire nation depends; who seek actively to eliminate racism; who work to maintain and protect our civil rights and liberties in the face of persistent attacks upon them; and who look upon the law as an instrument for the protection of the people, rather than for their repression.
Summary: A group of truly progressive law students.

Name: National Organization for Business and Engineering
Description: The National Organization for Business and Engineering is dedicated to bridging the gap between business savviness and technical acumen, by providing real-world projects, upperclassmen mentorship, and professional development resources.
Summary: The National Organization for Business and Engineering is dedicated to bridging the gap between business savviness and technical acumen, by providing professional development resources, real- world projects and upperclassmen mentorship.

Name: National Pan-Hellenic Council
Description:
The Divine 9

Alpha Phi Alpha Fraternity Inc. 1906

Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority Inc. 1908

Kappa Alpha Psi Fraternity Inc. 1911

Omega Psi Phi Fraternity Inc. 1911

Delta Sigma Theta Sorority Inc. 1913

Phi Beta Sigma Fraternity Inc. 1914

Zeta Phi Beta Sorority Inc. 1920

Sigma Gamma Rho Sorority Inc. 1922

Iota Phi Theta Fraternity Inc. 1963
Summary: The NPHC is a national organization comprised of the divine nine historically African American sororities and fraternities.

Name: National Security Law Society
Description: The National Security Law Society aims to foster interest in and understanding of the legal aspects and ramifications of national and international security by sponsoring speakers and programs concerning the many topics within this area of law. We also work to aid members in their pursuits of careers in these fields and to contribute to the development of the law as it relates to national and international security.
