Members work on specific mechanisms, and are responsible for everything from CAD, electronics, and embedded software, while ensuring integration with other subteams. 

 

Lastly, the Business team is what holds our team together - not only do they coordinate the finances and budget for the team, working to secure private sponsorships and manage funding, but they also market the team to the rest of the university and the world. Through outreach events, interaction with other teams and even some of our competition, to managing our technical documentation and presentation material for both our judges and the sponsors we work with, they ensure a unified brand and a team that can continue to reach new heights. While STEM students are highly encouraged, the business team also offers endless opportunities for those from any other discipline - everything from art, to writing, to business, to management is crucial to our team's success. 

 

Our team welcomes all, and encourages opportunities to learn, grow, and build the most important ship of all - friendship! If you have an interest in helping create an unmanned vessel, come join the team!

 

More information can be found at www.umautonomy.com

 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZxFV9WLaQ88
Summary: UM::Autonomy is an award-winning autonomous boat team where students work together to create a surface vessel capable of navigating obstacles and performing tasks using AI for the RoboBoat Competition. Join us and learn more at umautonomy.com!

Name: UMHealthResearch.org - Michigan Institute for Clinical & Health Research
Description: The Michigan Institute for Clinical and Health Research (MICHR) at the University of Michigan, developed an online platform (UMHealthResearch.org), that connects the community to research studies taking place at the University. The goal is to spread awareness about health research, and allow participants to search for studies of interest. Most studies will compensate participants for their time.
Summary: The Michigan Institute for Clinical and Health Research (MICHR) at the University of Michigan, developed an online platform (UMHealthResearch.org), that connects the community to research studies taking place at the University.

Name: Uncover
Description: Uncover provides a platform for A/PIA individuals to tell their own story. Our mission is to promote connection and understanding while challenging stereotypes associated with the A/PIA identity by showcasing the diverse narratives in our community.
Summary: Uncover provides a platform for A/PIA individuals to tell their own story. Our mission is to promote connection and understanding while challenging stereotypes associated with the A/PIA identity by showcasing the diverse narratives in our community.

Name: Undergraduate American Medical Women's Association
Description: American Medical Women’s Association undergraduate branch at the University of Michigan unites students to work to create a diverse community dedicated to women in medicine, through education, leadership, and advocacy.
Summary: American Medical Women’s Association undergraduate branch at the University of Michigan unites students to work to create a diverse community dedicated to women in medicine, through education, leadership, and advocacy.

Name: Undergraduate Consulting at Ross
Description: Undergraduate Consulting at Ross (UCAR) serves to create a community of driven undergraduates through their common interest in consulting as a career path. Through workshops, keynote presentations, and hands-on learning UCAR prepares its members for the consulting recruiting cycle and allows individuals to practice fundamental skills in a safe environment.
Summary: The mission of Undergraduate Consulting at Ross is to create a community of future business leaders interested in pursuing consulting as a career path and to provide undergraduates with the tools necessary to succeed.

Name: Undergraduate Entertainment & Media Club
Description: The Undergraduate Entertainment & Media Club is a student-run organization for University of Michigan students from all majors actively pursuing careers in the Entertainment industry. EMC works to support undergraduate students actively pursuing careers in the Entertainment industry (film & television, media, music, and gaming).
Summary: Undergraduate student organization for students interested in careers in the entertainment industry. All majors welcomed!

Name: Undergraduate Hall of Phi Delta Phi at the University of Michigan
Description:
The Undergraduate hall of Phi Delta Phi is a professional pre-law honor society. The purpose of this organization is to promote the advancement of the highest intellectual, professional, and ethical standards within the University of Michigan.

To express interest in Fall 2023 Recruitment and receive emails about upcoming events, fill out this form:

Phi Delta Phi F23 Rush Interest Form

or contact our Recruitment Chair Ashley Golden at ashgold@umich.edu
Summary: The Undergraduate hall of Phi Delta Phi is a professional pre-law honor society. The purpose of this organization is to promote the advancement of the highest intellectual, professional, and ethical standards within the University of Michigan.

Name: Undergraduate Philosophy Club
Description: This is an amatuer club aiming to share with students the basic continental philosophy knowledge and organise group activities that relate such area with topics ranging from generative AI, gaming to history and technology. Main topics will cover continental philosophy (Hegel, Schelling etc.), psychoanalysis (Lacan(-ian gender study), Slavoj Žižek) mostly by reading and mass culture products criticism, students strongly interested in or with background in such areas are most welcome
Summary: This club is an amatuer club aiming to help students acquire basic continental philosophy knowledge and organise group activities that relate such area with topics ranging from generative AI, gaming to history and technology.

Name: Undergraduate Political Science Association
Description: UPSA hosts events and workshops designed to facilitate a better understanding of politics and political issues on campus. We also host many events that allow students to get to know our amazing Political Science faculty in a smaller, more intimate setting. We additionally host guest speakers, trivia nights, watch parties, and many more fun events!
Summary: The Undergraduate Political Science (UPSA) is a non-partisan organization established to create a community for Political Science undergraduates at UM and aims to serve as a liaison between students and the Political Science faculty and department.

Name: Undergraduate Psychology Society
Description:
The Undergraduate Psychology Society (UPS) is a student-run organization that aims to provide support for undergraduates majoring in psychology, as well as other students interested in the field. This support shall include academic and networking related events designed to help further our members’ goals. Although UPS is primarily an academic organization, we also plan community service and social events, in order to stress the need for a well rounded college experience and to facilitate high quality connections with fellow psych concentrators, graduate students and faculty. Ultimately, UPS aspires to act as an arena for discussion and a valuable resource for its members. We also serve to ensure that the voices and opinions of psychology concentrators are heard by the department.

Link to the website: https://umichups1.wixsite.com/undergraduate-psycho
Summary: The Undergraduate Psychology Society (UPS) provides support for undergraduates studying psychology. We plan events that function to help students to learn about opportunities and develop interests in psychology.

Name: Undergraduate Student National Dental Association Chapter at the University of Michigan
Description: The USNDA aids in the advancement and retention of minority students within the field of dentistry by connecting like-minded undergraduate students in achieving their goals of becoming a dentist. USNDA provides opportunities to serve the community with various volunteering events, facilitates mentorship between members of the Student National Dental Association (SNDA) here at the University of Michigan and provides opportunities to connect and shadow dentists. Members also get to connect with speakers with relevant social, service, professional, and educational information about the field of dentistry.
Summary: The USNDA is the undergraduate chapter for the National Dental Association (NDA) and we uphold NDA's values by aiding in the advancement and retention of minority students within the field of dentistry.

Name: UNICEF at the University of Michigan
Description:
The United Nations Children’s Fund (UNICEF) works in 190 countries and territories to save children's lives, defend their rights, and help them fulfill their potential from early childhood through adolescence. The UNICEF Campus Initiative at the University of Michigan plays a powerful role in this mission. As one of more than 600 active Campus Initiative Clubs around the country, members of the UNICEF chapter at the University of Michigan strive to educate, advocate and fundraise on behalf of UNICEF to reach zero preventable deaths. 

Interested in joining? Fill out this form to get updates.
Summary: The United Nations Children’s Fund (UNICEF) works in 190 countries and territories to save children's lives, to defend their rights, and to help them fulfill their potential from early childhood through adolescence.

Name: United 2 Heal
Description:
United 2 Heal (U2H) is an undergraduate-run nonprofit humanitarian organization at the University of Michigan that helps eliminate global health disparities by collecting, sorting, and shipping surplus medical supplies to countries in need. We strongly believe that each and every human being in the world deserves the same access to high-quality healthcare. Our mission is to fight global health inequity by collecting, sorting, and shipping surplus medical supplies to areas in desperate need all around the world. Our volunteers can be found at World Medical Relief in Southfield, MI, where United 2 Heal is, and has long been, the #1 student organization and an important source of vital student leaders.

 

We take pride in our shipments. United 2 Heal raises funds throughout the year and we use the money to sponsor the shipment of a 40'​ shipping container full of medical supplies from World Medical Relief in Southfield, MI to a country in need. Throughout our history, we have sent several shipments, totaling several millions of dollars of medical supplies, to several countries, including Ghana, Pakistan, and the Ivory Coast.

 

Most notably, United 2 Heal volunteers are among the first in the world to assist in the restoration of pacemaker devices for reuse. Between 1 and 2 million people die every year from lack of a pacemaker, which can cost tens of thousands of dollars per device. As part of an ongoing and revolutionary clinical trial led by My Heart Your Heart, United 2 Heal volunteers are helping to make pacemaker restoration a reality. Ever since this groundbreaking work began for the first time at World Medical Relief in recent years, our volunteers have been working with My Heart Your Heart to interrogate, de-lead, and further process tens of thousands of pacemaker devices, each of which has the potential to save a life.

 

Our community is primarily composed of students and alumni of the University of Michigan in Ann Arbor, but very recently United 2 Heal has founded new chapters at Wayne State University in Detroit, MI, at Oakland University in Rochester, MI, and at the University of Detroit - Mercy in Detroit, MI. United 2 Heal is composed of an Executive Board, a body of active members, and a large community of casual volunteers. Our community means a lot to us, and we organize several social events, workshops, and fundraisers throughout the year to bring people together in recognition of our shared mission.
Summary: United 2 Heal (U2H) is an undergraduate-run nonprofit humanitarian organization at the University of Michigan that helps eliminate global health disparities by collecting, sorting, and shipping surplus medical supplies to countries in need.

Name: United Asian American Medical Student Association
Description: We are the United Asian American Medical Student Association (UAAMSA) at the University of Michigan, a chapter of the Asian Pacific American Medical Student Association (APAMSA). Our organization was established to support the health care and community needs of patients, students, and medical professionals in the greater southeast Michigan area. Not only are we committed to improving health care services and education, but also to building connections and bringing our community closer together.  Past events have included attending the National APAMSA Conferences, organizing mentorship dinners with faculty members, hosting physician panels, and running annual health fairs for the benefit of those in our community.
Summary: A chapter of APAMSA dedicated to supporting the health care and community needs of patients, students, and medical professionals by improving healthcare services and education, building connections, and bringing the AAPI community together.

Name: United Asian American Organizations
Description: The United Asian American Organizations was established in 1988 to work in unity with the Asian American community on campus. We are a coalition group representing various Asian American organizations on campus. Our aim is to serve as the liaison and collaboration agent for diverse Asian American organizations at UM, promote awareness of Asian American issues, serve as a political voice for Asian American organizations on campus, and develop relationships with other POC groups on campus and Asian American organizations outside of UM.
Summary: The United Asian American Organizations serves as a unified voice for Asian American communities at UM, connecting and supporting more than 25 member organizations and legacy programs through community organizing and collaborative programming.

Name: University Activities Center
Description: To provide the campus community with a wide array of cultural, social, educational, and artistic programming while creating opportunities for the development of students through a full range of experiential learning.
Summary: UAC is composed of eighteen student committees whose common goal is to provide the very best in entertainment and extra-curricular enrichment at the University of Michigan.

Name: University Blood Initiative at The University of Michigan
Description:
Our chapter of the University Blood Initiative at the University of Michigan is part of a larger grassroots organization dedicated to combating local blood shortages in the Ann Arbor area. Our mission to support local blood centers through empowering, motivating, and educating blood donors both on campus and in our community. We are different from other blood drive orientated organizations in that we collect donations that stay local. All blood donations that go through us help serve the local community. Giving blood is one of the easiest ways to save lives, through local donations, we can make a big impact on Michigan. 

Our core values center around education, leadership, community, and a passion for our cause. We want to advocate for increased blood donation in our campus community so that we can establish a strong foundation of united blood donors in the next generation. We organize and sponsor blood drives in the Ann Arbor and Metro Detroit area, connect with other organizations in Michigan to educate youth, and are constantly growing in the ways in which we support blood donation.
Summary: Our chapter of the University Blood Initiative at the University of Michigan is part of a larger grassroots organization dedicated to combating local blood shortages in the Ann Arbor and Metro-Detroit area.

Name: University Career Center
Description:
The Career Center is a diverse, professionally trained career development team employing a student-centered, multicultural, educational approach to meet your career needs.

Mission Statement

The Career Center is committed to preparing University of Michigan students and alumni/ae to be active, life-long learners in developing and implementing their career decisions. Guided by theory and reflective practice, The Career Center facilitates clients' overall development and provides resources to help them explore and pursue their career and educational goals in a complex, diverse and interconnected world. The Career Center forges appropriate partnerships with the University community, as well as employers and educational institutions, to support our clients. In these ways, The Career Center fosters meaningful links between education and fulfilling lives.

Principles of Service

Our expectation: To assist you in achieving your goals
Students are at the center of our work, and our goal is to intentionally enhance your educational experience. We hope to exceed your expectations through friendly service from knowledgeable staff.

Our approach: Educational, respectful, flexible, and creative
The Career Center has high office standards and draws on our staff's strengths and expertise to deliver comprehensive, innovative services. We employ a team-oriented approach within an environment that both challenges and supports you and our staff.

Our impact: Helping you contribute to a multicultural society
Through our services, The Career Center strives to create experiences that foster reflection on actions and beliefs. Through these experiences we hope to contribute to your learning and enrich the contribution you make to a multicultural society. We challenge ourselves, as well, to cultivate an open and accepting learning environment.

Our practice: Intentional continuous improvement
Using a theoretical orientation, national benchmarking and input from you, we actively engage in continuous improvement of our services and resources.
Summary: Internship, career and graduate school coaching, connections and resources brought to you by The Career Center at the University of Michigan

Name: University Christian Outreach
Description:
UCO is a community of disciples on mission. Our goal is to lead university students into a personal, mature relationship with Jesus Christ and prepare them for a life of radical discipleship. We long to see God's kingdom be established in the hallways, classrooms, houses and dorms on campus. 

We meet weekly for prayer meetings and bible studies, form men's and women's groups, hold retreats and organize social activities (sometimes crazy ones).
Summary: Founded in 1965, UCO is an ecumenical Christian group enriching our faith as students.

Name: University Lutheran Chapel Student Group
Description: University Lutheran Chapel is an LCMS Lutheran Church located in downtown Ann Arbor. We also have the Common Cup Coffeehouse in the basement! We meet for weekly All Student Gathering Wednesday evenings, and host other social events throughout the school year!
Summary: An official group for students who attend (and who want to attend) University Lutheran Chapel on Washtenaw Ave.

Name: University Musical Society Student Committee
Description:
Gain experience in arts administration, grassroots marketing, and event production.

The University Musical Society Student Committee (UMSSC) is a U-M student organization that connects students across campus to the arts and provides professional development opportunities for its members.

Committee members host events, attend performances together, reach out to students across the university, meet professionals in the performing arts field, and have the opportunity to earn free tickets to UMS events. All U-M students are invited to join!
Summary: The University Musical Society Student Committee (UMSSC) is a U-M student organization that connects students across campus to the arts and provides professional development opportunities for its members.

Name: University of Michigan 3D Printing Club
Description: The University of Michigan 3D Printing Club organizes projects, competitions, and collaborative learning workshops to ultimately enhance knowledge and increase interest in the field of additive manufacturing. A new project is introduced every semester of the school year. All majors are welcome - 3D printing is applicable to all majors.
Summary: The University of Michigan 3D Printing Club strives to bring together 3D printing enthusiasts across campus to advance the science and art of additive manufacturing and providing learning materials to interested groups.

Name: University of Michigan Active Citizens - Alternative Spring Break
Description: Michigan Active Citizens (MAC) is a student organization at the University of Michigan committed to sending students on service-learning based spring break trips since 1990. We accomplish this through established community partnerships with 25 sites, thorough education and training for all site leaders and participants, and thoughtful campus engagement. It is important to us that participants of MAC Alternative Spring Breaks have a holistic understanding of social justice, their selected site topic, and the intersectionality associated with all of our site topics. Our goal is to cultivate a community on the University of Michigan campus of Active Citizens who take part in positive social change for their lives during spring break, their college careers, and their lives after college.
Summary: Alternative Spring Break is a program that encourages learning through community service in communities across America.

Name: University of Michigan Anthropology Club
Description: In this club our goal is to encourage student discussion of all four sub-fields of Anthropology. We aim to provide a unique and laid back experience for aspiring anthropologists, including anthropology and evolutionary anthropology majors, as well as non-majors who are simply curious to learn more about the field. We host academic events including discussions with graduate students and research talks. We also host social events such as game nights and movie screenings.
Summary:
University of Michigan Anthropology Club
Group for all students interested in the different facets of anthropological study.

Name: University of Michigan Asylum Collaborative
Description:
The Asylum Collaborative (UMAC) was conceptualized in 2012 and founded in 2013 by student members of the University of Michigan Medical School chapter of Physicians for Human Rights. In partnership with the University of Michigan Law School, Physicians for Human Rights and community organizations such as Freedom House, this student-led initiative empowers medical professionals and students to advocate for victims and survivors of human rights violations and serve as a voice for those who have limited access to such resources. Our focus is to facilitate inter-professional collaboration between pro bono legal and medical providers to conduct forensic evaluations and medical affidavits for asylum, human trafficking, and other cases that have experienced human rights abuses. We also seek to educate providers and medical students to recognize and advocate for victims of torture and abuse in clinical practice. Our goal is to establish and work with a consortium of providers in the Midwest to provide forensic medical evaluations to support legal cases. Working closely with the national organizing Physicians for Human Rights (PHR), the University of Michigan Law School, and Freedom House Detroit, members invest in projects that challenge the boundaries of the physician’s role and act to protect human rights both in the United States and abroad.  

 

Evaluation requests should be submitted via email to UMACevaluations@med.umich.edu.

For general inquiries, please email umasylumcollaborative@med.umich.edu
Summary: The Asylum Collaborative mobilizes health professionals to advocate for victims and survivors of human rights violations. UMAC members conduct forensic medical evaluations to support legal cases for asylum and human trafficking.

Name: University of Michigan Central Student Government
Description: The Central Student Government (CSG) is the primary and central student government of the University of Michigan, representing students from all university schools and colleges. CSG is the primary funding source for UM registered student organizations through the Student Organization Funding Committee and Wolverine Consulting Group.  CSG also oversees the AirBus program, a non-profit transportation service for UM students from UM campus to the Detroit Metro airport, during the university breaks.
Summary: The Central Student Government (CSG) is the primary and central student government of the Univeristy of Michigan, representing students from all university schools and colleges. CSG is the primary funding source for U-M registered student organizations.

Name: University of Michigan Cheer Team
Description: Athletics
Summary: Athletics

Name: University of Michigan Club Gymnastics
Description: Club gym is a student run, co-ed athletic club. We compete for the University of Michigan at NAIGC events and practice year-round. Our club is no cut- anyone can join!
Summary: We practice and compete for the love of the sport. Our team strives to create a sense of unity and give individuals the chance to continue to be involved in the sport of gymnastics.

Name: University of Michigan Club Triathlon Team
Description: MTri's mission is to promote a healthy lifestyle focused on fitness through the emerging sport of triathlon. We have over 70 active members that attend practices, competitions, social and fundraising events throughout the year. Attendance at every practice and race is not mandatory. We are sponsored by Kurt Kinetic, Kiwami Triathlon, Rudy Project North America, and Roka athletics. Learn more about our club in the following video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=D6ABI0jPfMc
Summary: The U-M Club Triathlon Team is a student-run organization focused on promoting the multi-sport lifestyle at the collegiate level.  A member of the Mideast Collegiate Triathlon Conference, the club works to identify and cultivate triathletes.

Name: University Of Michigan Dentistry Student Council
Description:
The purpose of the student council includes:

1. To provide for the student body an effective means of communication with the administration and faculty in order that the student body can express opinions or ideas related to their dental education or any other professional matter.

2. To poll the student body regarding their opinions or concerns in order that The Council accurately and appropriately represents the student body.

3. To innovatively conceive, plan and execute projects and events for the good of the student body, The School of Dentistry, the dental profession, and the community.

4. Organize and facilitate appropriate student recruitment in organizations, events, and functions, as well as host events for the student body such as Student Organizations Fair.

5. Facilitate interprofessional collaboration with other professional students, while providing events that expose undergraduate students to the field of dentistry.
Summary: Dental student council is a student run organization formed to represent the students of the University of Michigan Dental School in matters including but not limited to policy formation, curriculum design and student welfare.

Name: University of Michigan Detroit Center
Description: The University of Michigan Detroit Center is a meeting and events facility in Midtown Detroit. The goal of the Detroit Center is to facilitate engagement between the U-M community and the city of Detroit. The space is available for University units and student organizations to host events in the city and to spark dialogue between city and the University.
Summary: The University of Michigan Detroit Center is a meeting and events facility in Midtown Detroit. The goal of the Detroit Center is to facilitate engagement between the U-M community and the city of Detroit.

Name: University of Michigan Electric Boat
Description: University of Michigan Electric Boat designs, builds, and races an electric boat to compete in the Promoting Electronic Propulsion competition (PEP) hosted by the American Society of Naval Engineers. Our team offers students the unique opportunity to work on a full-scale boat project. Some challenges we face include designing and fabricating a hull and propeller for efficiency and high-speed performance and building an electrical system for high peak power output.
Summary: University of Michigan Electric Boat designs, builds, and races an electric boat to compete in the Promoting Electronic Propulsion competition (PEP) hosted by the American Society of Naval Engineers.

Name: University of Michigan Esports
Description:
University of Michigan Esports (Michigan Esports) is a Sponsored Student Organization that falls under the Recreational Sports Department. We currently have 10 sponsored titles: Call of Duty, CS:GO, Dota 2, League of Legends, Overwatch, Rainbow 6, Rocket League, Smite, Starcraft II, Super Smash Ultimate, and Valorant. All titles have a varsity team that competes in the highest level collegiate tournaments and most have junior varsity variants that also compete in various collegiate tournaments. Want to compete with us? Reach out to us via email to learn how you can get sponsored to compete under Michigan Esports!

Michigan Esports is the largest gaming community on campus! With our Discord having over 3,500 members and sponsoring over 100 competitors, we are growing esports at Michigan every semester!

Competition isn't our only focus! With such a large community, we host many casual and planned events, such as LAN parties, in-house tournaments, watch parties, sponsored events with giveaways, and much more. To stay up to date with all the latest Michigan Esports news and events, join us on discord by clicking the link below, or follow us on social media!

  • Discord: https://discord.gg/UMichEsports

 

Competitive gaming can often lead to a toxic environment. Here at Michigan Esports, we are dedicated to creating a safe and inclusive space for all members of our community. All competitive team members are required to attend a workshop on creating a safe environment.


If you have any questions or concerns relating to diversity, equity, and inclusion, please contact the Head of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion via Discord or email.
Summary: We are the official University of Michigan Esports under Recreational Sports.

Name: University of Michigan Figure Skating Club
Description:
Visit our webpage for lots of additional information about our team! https://sites.google.com/umich.edu/umichskating/

(Prospective U-M skater? Check out the 'Prospective Skaters' page where you'll find a link to our interest form and an extensive list of FAQs just for you!)

 

〽️⛸️

 

The University of Michigan Figure Skating Club (UMFSC) is a university organization and U.S. Figure Skating (USFS) collegiate team that offers competitive and recreational opportunities for University of Michigan students.

 

During the school year, the UMFSC team competes at the three midwestern USFS intercollegiate competitions and (if we qualify) at the USFS National Intercollegiate Final as well. The intercollegiate competitions include competitive events in freestyle, solo dance, and 'team maneuvers'.

 

In addition, the UMFSC team hosts multiple showcases at our home rink throughout the year. These public performances are a great chance for skaters to perform for fun and show off their talents to family and friends.

 

UMFSC has three practice sessions per week at our campus rink, Yost Ice Arena. These sessions serve not only as a time to practice individual skills and programs but also as an opportunity for skaters to build team friendships.

 

We currently employ two skate coach professionals from the Ann Arbor Ice Cube as coaches for our team.

 

All UMFSC team members must be current, registered members of USFS in order to be eligible to compete. UMFSC does not provide USFS testing opportunities, but many skaters take advantage of the ice time, coaches, and testing sessions offered at nearby rinks, including the Ann Arbor Ice Cube.
Summary: The University of Michigan Figure Skating Club (UMFSC) is a university organization and U.S. Figure Skating (USFS) collegiate team that offers competitive and recreational opportunities for University of Michigan students.

Name: University of Michigan Gilbert and Sullivan Society
Description:
The University of Michigan Gilbert and Sullivan Society (UMGASS) is delighted to welcome members from the University and from the larger Ann Arbor area to join our cast or crew, or to serve in directorial or production staff positions. As the oldest student-run society dedicated to producing the works of William Gilbert and Arthur Sullivan in the country, UMGASS has presented various operettas from the Gilbert and Sullivan canon for decades.

 

We produce two shows per year: one in the fall semester and one in the winter semester. Both take place in the beautiful Lydia Mendelssohn theater, with full staging and orchestration. If you’re interested in joining us, stop by one of our mass meetings (held at the beginning of each semester), check out umgass.org, or reach out to us at umgassexec@umich.edu.
Summary: The University of Michigan Gilbert and Sullivan Society has been dedicated to performing the theatrical works of William S. Gilbert and Sir Arthur Sullivan for over 70 years.

Name: University of Michigan History Club
Description: History Club is the departmental club of the History Department. We work with faculty to have regular discussions with them, in addition to fostering a strong partnership with the Clements library to hold related events. In addition to that we promote finding history outside the classroom through field trips and social events, as well as weekly meetings that cover interesting historical events. Through the History Club, we hope to foster a community of history lovers, both within and outside of the History Department!
Summary: The History Club is an inclusive club for any U of M students who have an interest in History. We host weekly meetings with historical interest, speaker talks with professors, trips to interesting sites, and other excellent events.

Name: University of Michigan Industrial Hygiene Student Association
Description:
UMIHSA is a student group for those interested in industrial hygiene and occupational safety.  We are a recognized local student section of the American Industrial Hygiene Association (AIHA) and collaborate closely with the Michigan Industrial Hygiene Society(MIHS), which is the local AIHA section. We are also recognized as a student chapter of Workplace Health Without Borders (WHWB) and as such focus on both global and domestic occupational health education.

Our members enjoy the many social events sponsored by UMIHSA as well as the opportunity to network with current industrial hygiene professionals.  In addition, we also provide philanthropic and professional development events to help our members become more well rounded and productive professionals. We work closely with our professors to ensure that our activities consistent with our departmental and program goals.
Summary: The University of Michigan Industrial Hygiene Student Association (UMIHSA) is a student group organization committed to promoting and improving the practice of industrial hygiene.

Name: University of Michigan Journal of Law Reform
Description: The Journal of Law Reform publishes legal academic articles on topics involving law reform.
Summary: Publishes legal academic articles on topics involving law reform.

Name: University of Michigan Library
Description: U-M Library Student Ambassadors are undergraduate students who work for the Library to do outreach to other students through programs and social media.
Summary: U-M Library Student Ambassadors are undergraduate students who work for the Library to do outreach to other students through programs and social media.

Name: University of Michigan Men's Club Soccer (UMMCS)
Description: The University of Michigan Men's Club Soccer team is a student run organization which provides competitive soccer without the time commitment of a varsity program. We strive to build a supportive environment built on family, excellence, and joy. UMMCS is perfect for those who would like to play competitively, yet still have enough time for studying and being social with your friends. We compete in the MASC Conference in NIRSA's Region 3, which spans the Midwest from Michigan to Iowa. Our regular season consists of 10 games against our division, which is made up of teams from Michigan including Michigan State, Western Michigan, and Grand Valley State to name a few.
Summary: The University of Michigan Men's Club Soccer team is a student run organization which provides competitive soccer without the time commitment of a varsity program.  We strive to build a supportive environment built on family, ex

Name: University of Michigan Men's Glee Club
Description:
Founded in 1859 on the principles of Tradition, Camaraderie, and Musical Excellence, The University of Michigan Men's Glee Club is one of the oldest collegiate choirs in the United States and the oldest continually-run student organization on the Michigan campus. The group is regarded as one of the world’s finest male choruses, and its members, undergraduate and graduate students chosen by audition at the beginning of both the Fall and Winter terms, represent a majority of the University's 19 schools and colleges. 

Club members serving on the Executive Board and as junior managers are responsible for overseeing all non-musical Club operations. The Glee Club’s musical repertoire ranges from Renaissance motets and opera choruses, to folksongs and spirituals, and, of course, to our signature Michigan songs. The Friars, a nine-member subset of the Glee Club, are in their 64th year and serve as an extension of Club as they maintain an ambitious performing schedule. Please visit our website to learn more about our annual tours, social activities, and everything else that has kept members returning to this organization for over 160 years. Don’t hesitate to reach out to ummgc.info@umich.edu with any further questions!
Summary: Founded in 1859, The University of Michigan Men's Glee Club is one of the oldest collegiate choirs in the nation. The club consists of male and non-binary individuals and its student leadership is responsible for all non-musical aspects of the club.

Name: University of Michigan Powerlifting
Summary: Founded in 2021, our team aims to introduce students at the University of Michigan to the world of Powerlifting. We strive for an inclusive and supportive community that prioritizes strength and friendship.

Name: University of Michigan Rugby Football Club
Description:
The University of Michigan Rugby Football Club competes against other Big Ten teams in D1A, the top division of collegiate rugby in the United States. We provide players with a competitive environment aimed at on-field excellence while also offering a supportive, welcoming community for players to engage socially. Founded in 1959, we have an extensive network of thousands of alumni.

 

We play our primary 15s season in the fall and travel across the country to compete in 7s tournaments during the winter semester. Annually during spring break, we go on tour to another country to play local clubs and bond as a team. Players join the team with varied levels of experience and all athletes are welcome.

 

For more information, go to mrugby.com. Want to play? Email mensrugby@umich.edu.
Summary: UMRFC is Michigan's men's rugby team. We compete against other Big Ten teams at the D1A level. Prior rugby experience isn't required; all athletes are welcome.

Name: University of Michigan Science Olympiad
Description:
Science Olympiad is a nationally recognized competition that involves teams of 15 students competing in 23 different events related to science, technology, engineering, and mathematics. Events range from Electric Vehicle, in which participants design, program, and build an electric locomotive device that has enough precision and speed to stop at a tiny dot several meters away in just 4 seconds, to Chemistry Lab, where participants complete an especially rigorous written test and physical lab based on two fields of chemistry. Science Olympiad events introduce students to new fields in science and technology, that they might not have otherwise found a passion in. Also, many events test concepts and ideas that would be found in college-level textbooks and classes. More details about Science Olympiad’s philosophy, events, and annual competitions can be found at soinc.org.

Members of the UM Science Olympiad chapter can get involved in our tournament by serving as event supervisors, Core members assisting the board with tournament logistics, or as volunteers on the day of the tournament.
Summary: Science Olympiad is a nationally recognized competition that involves teams of 15 students competing in 23 different events related to science, technology, engineering, and mathematics. Our club organizes an invitational tournament held at UM.

Name: University of Michigan Society for Advancement of Hispanics/Chicanos and Native Americans in Science (SACNAS) Chapter
Description: The Society for Advancement of Hispanics/Chicanos and Native Americans in Science (SACNAS) at UMich Chapter is a student run organization that fosters the advancement of underrepresented students in the sciences. The purpose of this chapter is to bring scientists of all levels together and mentor one another. In addition, we will have the support from faculty that promote diversity in the sciences and aid those of underrepresented communities. SACNAS as a whole is a national organization with over 110 professional and student chapters working to increase diversity in Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM). All chapters meet annually at the SACNAS national conference in which students present their research and participate in leadership and professional development sessions. Involvement in SACNAS at Umich will provide members the opportunity to get involved in the community, network with other SACNAS members around the country, and increase diversity in STEM.
Summary: The purpose of SACNAS at UMich is to encourage and promote the advancement of minorities in the sciences at the University of Michigan and surrounding communities. This organization will allow a bridge between students of all levels and professors.

Name: University of Michigan Solar Car Team
Description:
The University of Michigan Solar Car Team is an entirely student-run organization that designs and builds solar electric vehicles. The team races both nationally and internationally. Since its establishment in 1989, the team has built 17 vehicles, won the American Solar Challenge nine times, placed in the top three in the World Solar Challenge seven times, and won one international competition. The team is recognized as the most successful team in North America, and one of the most successful teams in the world.

 

Our primary competition is the Bridgestone World Solar Challenge, a 5-day, 3,000 km endurance challenge across the Australian Outback, designed to push the limits of renewable energy technology, automotive engineering, and the race participants. Our car is designed by the full team during the school year; then a sub-team, called the Race Crew, builds the car over the summer, and takes the following Fall semester off to travel to Australia and race the car. 

 

Members of our team come from many different backgrounds, disciplines, and colleges from within the university, ranging from undergraduate to doctoral studies. Any and all majors welcome! 

 

The team consists of 4 major divisions: Engineering, Business, Operations, and Communications.

 

The Engineering Division is responsible for designing the most efficient solar vehicle in the world. They accomplish this by optimizing each and every system in the car, including the aerobody, array, battery, suspension, structures, and more. The Engineering Division also includes the Strategy and Software team, who are responsible for developing our models and simulations. This division is ideal for people interested in aerospace, electrical, mechanical, and materials engineering, as well as computer and data science, mathematics, and physics. 

 

The Business Division is responsible for fundraising, as well as the public image of the team. Accounts members work to develop and maintain sponsor relations with corporations around the world, large and small. This division is ideal for people interested in business development, finance, and sales.

 

The Operations Division manages supply chain logistics, manufacturing, procurement, and facilities organization for the team. Alongside the Business Division, Operations works to ensure the team has the materials and resources required to build a cutting-edge electric vehicle. Additionally, operations members handle shipping our car, equipment - notably including a 40ft container mobile workspace - and team to Australia. This division is ideal for people interested in industrial and operations engineering, manufacturing processes, supply chain management, transportation and shipping, and business administration. 

 

The Communications Division is responsible for promoting the team. Members produce media dedicated to generating interest in our team, solar racing, renewable energy technologies, and to build the “UM Solar Car” brand. This division is ideal for those interested in marketing, communications, creative writing, graphic design, and media production.

 

Check out our website for more info about our team, our project, and our history: umsolar.com

 

Check out our recruiting events!

 

Mass Meeting on Central Campus

  • Monday, September 4, 2023
  • 6:00 PM 7:30 PM
  • Vandenberg Room, Michigan League (map)

Join us to learn more about the different divisions and ask our members questions! Everyone has a place on our team, so whether you're interested in engineering, business, operations, or communications, we hope to see you there!

 

Mass Meeting on North Campus

  • Tuesday, September 5, 2023
  • 6:00 PM 7:30 PM
  • IOE 1610 (map)

Come join us to explore our diverse divisions and get your questions answered by our team members! We believe there's a role for everyone on our team, whether you have a passion for engineering, business, operations, or communications. We look forward to seeing you there!

 

Taste of Solar Car

  • Sunday, September 10, 2023
  • 1:00 PM 4:00 PM
  • 2505 GGBL (map)

You won’t want to miss this incredible opportunity to experience what it’s really like to be part of our amazing solar car team. Join us at Taste of Solar Car to find your place on the team, talk more with our members, and see our solar car and workspace in person.

 

Women in Solar Car Community Event

  • Tuesday, September 12, 2023
  • 6:00 PM 8:00 PM
  • DOW 1010 (map)

Join us for a relaxed social and community service event led by our Women in Solar Car (WiSC) group. This drop-in event is open to all female-identifying students and anyone else looking to find a welcoming space within Solar Car.

 

First General Team Meeting (GTM #1)

  • Wednesday, September 13, 2023
  • 7:00 PM 10:00 PM
  • 2505 GGBL (map)

In your first general team meeting, you’ll officially meet the members of your division and get started on your training project. This event is mandatory for everyone who wants to join the team.
Summary: The Solar Car Team is a student-run organization that designs, builds, and races solar vehicles. Our team includes business, operations, communications, and engineering divisions, with undergraduate and graduate students from across the University.

Name: University of Michigan Steel Bridge Team
Description: The University of Michigan Steel Bridge Team is a student project team comprised of undergraduate and graduate engineering students. Each year, the team designs, fabricates, and constructs a 1:10 scale bridge according to a set of rules from the American Institute of Steel Construction. The team then competes against other universities at a regional competition, and if the team performs well, they will qualify for the national competition.
Summary: Steel Bridge Team is made of undergraduate and graduate engineering students. Each year, the team designs and fabricates a 1:10 scale bridge based on a standard set of rules.  The team then competes by constructing and loading the bridge at competitions.

Name: University of Michigan Student-Run Free Clinic
Description: The Student-Run Free Clinic is a student organization dedicated to providing quality healthcare free of charge to uninsured adults, while creating opportunities for UM students and physicians to confront health disparities through direct action. At the UMSRFC, patients can receive basic primary and preventative care. Basic tests such as routine blood work or X-rays are also free of charge when the physician refers the patient for testing. The UMSRFC also creates a unique learning and mentorship environment in which clinical and preclinical medical students work together to care for patients, all under the guidance of a volunteer UM physician. The UMSRFC also provides valuable opportunities for inter-professional education, working closely with students from Pharmacy, Nursing, and Social Work.
Summary: We are medical students that run a clinic in Pinckney, MI every Wednesday and Saturday. We have dual responsibilities: to provide free medical care to uninsured adults by recruiting physician volunteers, and to clinically educate medical students.

Name: University of Michigan Supermileage Team
Description:
Supermileage is a student-led multidisciplinary project team creating high efficiency single occupant electric vehicles and internal combustion vehicles to compete in the annual Shell Eco-Marathon (SEM) Americas event. 

 

Established in 2010, Supermileage has raced vehicles at both the SEM and SAE Supermileage competitions. Currently, Supermileage races annually at the Shell Eco-Marathon. Historically, the competition has taken place in Indianapolis IN, Sonoma CA, Fontana CA, Houston TX, Detroit MI, and more. The competition has three energy categories (Battery Electric, Internal Combustion, Hydrogen Fuel Cell) and two body-style categories (Prototype, Urban Concept) providing 6 possible divisions to race in. Currently our team is preparing our battery electric prototype vehicle, Magnolia, and our internal combustion urban concept vehicle, Maple, for the 2024 Shell Eco Marathon.

 

In the past our vehicles have achieved 4,536.693 MPG. This year, Supermileage has ambitions to attain 10,000 MPGe for our prototype electric vehicle, and 700 MPG for our internal combustion vehicle. We can only achieve these lofty goals with your help!

 

Our team’s success relies on the diverse talents, perspectives, and backgrounds of our members. Some of our current members’ fields of study include Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, Physics, Environmental Science, Business, Finance, Art & Design, and more. However, ALL MAJORS ARE WELCOME! 

 

Our team is broken up into 2 major divisions and an executive board.

 

THE ENGINEERING DIVISION is responsible for the design and manufacturing of our vehicles. We have 5 engineering sub-teams, namely Electrical Systems, Mechanical Systems, Aerodynamics, Internal Combustion, and Vehicle Integration, and all engineering is overseen by the chief engineer.

Electrical Systems has two primary focuses: power electronics for our electric drivetrain and vehicle telemetry for data collection and race strategy. The design and testing of the PCB’s which control an electric motor running our car is all done in house. Additionally, electrical systems develops vehicle telemetry software and hardware, tunes motor control algorithms, designs our electrical harnesses, simulates our vehicles, and more.

Mechanical Systems is responsible for chassis design and manufacturing, transmission, steering, brakes, suspension, and more. Members of the mechanical systems team use Computer Aided Design (CAD) and Finite Element Analysis (FEA) softwares to to model and simulate the entire vehicle prior to manufacturing. They also utilize the mill, lathe, CNC mill, CNC lathe, CNC router, and welder while manufacturing our vehicles.

Aerodynamics has two main responsibilities pertaining to the bodies of our vehicles. Iteratively modeling and simulating the body in NX CAD and Hyperworks Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) softwares. And manufacturing the body using carbon fiber layups.

Internal Combustion primarily focuses on the GY6 moped engine currently used in our ICE car, Maple. The team tunes the engine’s software by modifying the engine control unit (ECU) code. Additionally, they develop the transmission of our ICE vehicles, ensuring energy is transferred from the engine to the tires most efficiently.  This year, the team plans to optimize the engine’s performance using a dynamometer to create an optimal fuel efficiency map.

Vehicle Integration uses systems engineering principles to ensure that all aspects of the vehicle work together in unison. They develop tests designed to ensure that the vehicle is both structurally sound and safe for the driver while remaining optimally fuel efficient. Most importantly, they promote proper communication and collaboration between each sub-team.

 

THE BUSINESS DIVISION is responsible for all other aspects of the team. It is comprised of Public Relations, Sponsorship, Finance, and Internal Relations.

Public Relations is responsible for all external communication, marketing, and advertising of the team. They make social media posts, plan recruitment events, create a team newsletter, organize fundraising events, update the team website, and more.

Internal Affairs deal with inner-team logistics such as planning social events, running elections, welcoming new team members, reserving rooms, etc.

Finance focuses on managing the team’s budget, filing reimbursements, financial planning for large purchases and competition events, and forecasting financial needs for current and future projects.

Sponsorship maintains relationships with current sponsors, secures funding/services from old and new sponsors, develops a sponsorship packet and team resume book for company recruitment events, and more.

 

To learn more about The University of Michigan Supermileage team, please visit our website https://supermileage.engin.umich.edu/ . Go Blue!
Summary: Supermileage is a student-led multidisciplinary project team creating high efficiency single occupant electric vehicles and internal combustion vehicles to compete in the annual Shell Eco-Marathon Americas event.

Name: University of Michigan Sustainable Food Program
Description:
UMSFP fosters collaborative leadership that empowers students to create a more just and sustainable food system at the University of Michigan while becoming change agents for a resilient planet. To further this mission, UMSFP focuses effort on partnering with organizations and events that support the local food system, thereby: 

1) Developing responsible student leaders by facilitating education, professional development, and discussion on sustainable food systems.

2) Building community through collaborative programming and mutually beneficial partnerships.

3) Redistribute power between institutions and groups through the principles and practices of visionary organizing.
Summary: UMSFP fosters collaborative leadership that empowers students to create a more just and sustainable food system at the University of Michigan while becoming change agents for a resilient planet.

Name: University of Michigan Undergraduate Research Journal
Description:
UMURJ is a student-run research journal showcasing undergraduate student research conducted on campus. We accept submissions in a variety of fields including Biological Sciences, Social Sciences, Humanities, Math, and Physics. Our mission is to build connections between undergraduate, graduate students, and the public through the publication of non-technical articles in electronic and print outlets.

If interested in joining the journal's staff, please visit umurj.org.
Summary: We are a student-run, multidisciplinary research journal focused on publishing undergraduate work.

Name: University of Michigan Wolverine Battalion
Description:
We are the Army ROTC program at U of M, a comprehensive officer education program with the goal of preparing cadets for commissioning into the US Army. Cadets are expected to participate in a 1-2 hour class and a 2 hour tactical lab each week. In addition cadets who have contracted to commission upon graduation are expected to participate in physical training from 6-7 am Tuesday-Thursday each week and a weekend long field training exercise each semester. Many cadets receive a full tuition scholarship with monthly stipends and opportunities like Project GO, Ranger Challenge, Norwegian Foot March, The Bataan Death March, and Color Guard for many school sports. 

 

If you are looking for leadership experiences, a welcoming and inclusive group, and a head start on your career as an officer in the U.S. Army please ask us about joining!
Summary: We are the Army ROTC program at U of M, a comprehensive officer education program. Every year, the Wolverine Battalion commissions new officers in the US Army.

Name: University of Michigan Women's Club Volleyball
Description: University of Michigan Women's Club Volleyball is a competitive organization that allows young women to continue their volleyball career at a high level and build a fun, close-knit community on campus while still having time to focus on academics. We have two teams that practice twice a week at Cliff Keen Arena and attend 4 tournaments per semester, with 22-26 members total. The season starts in September and ends in April at the NCVF National Collegiate Club Volleyball Championship.
Summary: University of Michigan Women's Club Volleyball is a competitive organization that allows young women to continue their volleyball career at a high level and build a fun, close-knit community on campus while still having time to focus on academics.

Name: University of Michigan Women's Glee Club
Description: The University of Michigan Women’s Glee Club is a vocal performance group for students at the University of Michigan. We represent the University through the medium of music and promote the arts on campus and beyond, all while building a close-knit community through the making of music. The Women's Glee Club welcomes singers who excel at singing in an SSAA choir, regardless of gender identity.
Summary: The University of Michigan Women's Glee Club is a choral ensemble of undergraduate and graduate students from diverse fields and backgrounds. As a club, WGC allows students to form a community that is bonded by a shared love of music.

Name: University of Michigan Women's Rugby Football Club
Description:
Our club aims to provide everyone a chance to learn the sport of rugby. We will provide all committed and hard-working teammates the opportunity to grow as rugby players, athletes and individuals. We are devoted to building a competitive team and program focused on athletics, teamwork, dedication and camaraderie. Joining UMWRFC requires no experience with the sport, just a love for competitive athletics and lasting friendships. Rugby is a game of strategy, grit, and teamwork. Rugby can be played by people of all body types and athletic abilities and it combines elements of many sports. The majority of our team consists of crossover athletes from other sports. Even if you’ve never heard of rugby before, we will teach you everything you need to know to play. If you are interested in playing rugby, please contact us any time at rugby.recruiting@umich.edu for more information!

 

UMWRFC is a Division I Collegiate Women's Rugby Club team. We belong to the Big Ten Universities Conference and play against other notable Big Ten Schools such as Michigan State, Ohio State, and Penn State. Women's Rugby is also designated as a Club Sport at the University of Michigan and has a strong tradition of athletic and academic excellence.
Summary: Michigan Women’s Rugby requires no experience with the sport, just a love for competitive athletics and lasting friendships. Rugby can be played by people of all body types and athletic abilities and combines elements of many sports.

Name: University of Michigan Young Science Innovators
Description: University of Michigan Young Science Innovators encourages socioeconomically disadvantaged students to enter the fields of Science, Technology, Engineering, Math, and Medicine (STEM^2) by running a free week-long summer science camp, planned and run entirely by undergraduate and graduate University of Michigan student volunteers.  The primary goals of U-MYScI are to (1) provide underprivileged students with an opportunity to explore the real-world links among science and engineering disciplines, (2) foster teamwork, enthusiasm, and career interests in science and engineering, and (3) use current bioinformatics , chemistry and educational research to develop mentoring, teaching, and learning methods that build student confidence in problem-solving.
Summary: UMYScI encourages socioeconomically disadvantaged students to enter the fields of Science, Technology, Engineering, Math, and Medicine by running a free week-long summer science camp, planned and run entirely by University of Michigan students.

Name: University Skateboard Collective
Description:
We live by our primary values of Inclusivity, Fun, and Safety, so we want to emphasize that we love beginners and ALL WHEELS ARE WELCOME!!! 

The purpose of the University Skateboard Collective is to highlight, expand, and unite the skateboard community (which includes longboards, penny boards, scooters, rollerskates/blades...). In addition, we want to cultivate a more skateboard-friendly environment on campus.

Our mission is to forge a safe and encouraging community with healthy and productive relationships and a shared love of these sports. Moreover, we hope to gain the support of the community by expressing the joy and importance of skateboard culture. We welcome all skill levels and love to help each other learn and improve, so come join us!

Members also receive a 10% discount on all items at Olympia Skate Shop!!

Join the community group-chat to stay up to date

And follow us on instagram: @Sk8_umich
Summary:
The University Skate Collective highlights, expands, and unites the wheeled-sports community, and seeks to legitimize these sports on campus

We live by our primary values of INCLUSIVITY, FUN, and SAFETY

EVERYONE is welcome and will be respected

Name: University Students Against Rape
Description: University Students Against Rape is the organizer for the University of Michigan Chapter of Take Back the Night, an international rally and march that is organized in local communities with the purpose of unifying all people in an awareness of violence and sexual assault.  We celebrate survivors, honor victims, and educate the community with the Take Back the Night rally and march as well as sexual assault prevention events and a survivor speak out, in which both survivors and supporters are welcome.
Summary: University Students Against Rape organizes the Michigan chapter of Take Back the Night, a rally and march that raises awareness against sexual assault and violence and celebrates survivors.

Name: Unwind
Description:
Unwind is a knitting and crocheting club dedicated to providing a safe and comfortable space to promote mental wellness for everyone, beginners and experienced crafters alike! We donate our work to The Warm Up America! Foundation.

Meetings are held bi-weekly, see our social media for more details!
Summary: Unwind is a knitting and crocheting club dedicated to providing a safe and comfortable space to promote mental wellness for everyone, beginners and experienced crafters alike! We donate our work to The Warm Up America! Foundation.

Name: Up Cancer at the University of Michigan
ShortName: Up Cancer at U of M
Description: Up Cancer at the University of Michigan is committed to educate, engage, & empower those touched by the burden of cancer. Our organization creates a community of patients and survivors and achieves our goals through health & fitness, legislative action though Team Up Cancer, and music & arts. Up Cancer at the University of Michigan is an organization made up of students dedicated to supporting patients and survivors of cancer. We are a chapter of the larger, parent organization, Up Cancer, which is located in Hartford, Connecticut.
Summary: Up Cancer at the University of Michigan is an organization dedicated to raising awareness for cancer research, promoting the health & wellness for cancer patients and survivors, as well as advocating for cancer legislation.

Name: UpRound Ventures
Description: UpRound's mission is to support and enhance the entrepreneurial ecosystem at Michigan and across the region. UpRound's primary activities are designed to source, accelerate, and write checks out our fund to startups that are founded by students. UpRound recruits and provides rich education to new members every semester, while providing a space for students passionate about entrepreneurship to bond, develop, and innovate. We  partner with Plug and Play, Detroit Venture Partners, Bessemer Venture Partners and others to create exclusive career pathways and opportunities for our analysts within the venture capital space. We host open events with prominent VC figures to provide learning opportunities for the Michigan community, and work with university partners to make strategic mentorship available to our analysts and the community at large. Our goal is to increase the prevalence of impactful innovation at Michigan while simultaneously increasing the potency and effectiveness of startups in our shared campus community.
Summary: UpRound sources, funds, and accelerates startups as the universities' first student led venture capital firm. We also work with partners and entrepreneurs to host pitch events, panels, and internal development events throughout the semester.

Name: Urbanism at The University of Michigan
Description:
We are an organization for students interested in the development and management of cities and urban public policy. Our mission is to spread awareness of the virtues of urbanism from environmental, social, and cultural lenses. We strive to promote low-waste, accessible, collaborative societies that are based in smart, efficient policy. We value walkable communities, reliable public transportation, plentiful housing, dense development, environmentally-friendly infrastructure, and financially sustainable cities. We work with local and regional organizations to develop tangible solutions for contemporary urban issues. We hope that our work will improve the overall quality of life for the community’s inhabitants while also benefiting the global community by practicing sustainability.

.
Summary: We examine and discuss public policy in urban areas. Specific focus areas include public health, economic policy, infrastructure, and walkability. Levels of policy include federal, state, and municipal. Any policy related to urban vitality is relevant.

Name: V.O.I.C.E.S. Baits Multicultural Council
Description: The Baits II V.O.I.C.E.S Multicultural Council works to enrich the lives of all Baits II residents by creating opportunities for positive community development; serving as a liaison to Dining, Facilitates, and the Residence Hall Association (RHA); fostering a safe and welcoming environment in recognition of our intersecting identities; and advocating on behalf of historically underrepresented communities at the University of Michigan. In short, we envision a community that is united in common cause and reflective of the change we wish to see in the world.
Summary: V.O.I.C.E.S Baits Multicultural Council serves as the Multicultural Council for the residents of Baits II.

Name: V1 Michigan
Description:
V1 Michigan is a place for driven students to do more than learn — here, they build. We start with crazy, ambitious ideas, from a startup fair designed to land students their dream job to a studio designed to create the next generation of products. But we don't stop there — our team helps bring each of these ideas into fruition. Each of us are driven individuals, but we are more motivated, creative, and innovative together than we could be alone. We all want to do great things — here at V1, we want to equip others with the tools, connections and experience they need to make it happen.

 

By joining V1 Michigan, you will have access to our very own V1 Cohort - build connections and solve problems creatively —  and Product Studio to not only build the next successful student startup, but to meet potential lifelong friends. Other than that, we host regular events like V1 Connect — networking, startup/venture opportunities, and more — and Michigan’s largest student-organized career fair: V1 Startup Fair. 

 

Subscribe to newsletter here: https://v1network.substack.com/
Summary: V1 is the community for ambitious student builders. We provide the most driven students with an extraordinary network, exclusive opportunities within startups, and mentorship to grow and achieve great things.

Name: VAW Global Health Alliances
Description: VAW Global Health Alliances provides an opportunity to work first-hand with experienced local doctors or dentists. As a volunteer, you will fundraise for medications and supplies prior to the trip abroad. While in country, you will assist the doctors or dentists, perform triage, distribute medications, and teach classes on hygiene, nutrition, and first aid. This is an intensive internship valuable to future nurses, physicians, dentists, and other healthcare providers as well as those interested in seeing what it is like to work in a developing country. The internship is focused on giving a variety of experiences in treating patients, deepening understanding of the medical or dental field, and broadening global views.
Summary: Providing students the unique opportunity to gain valuable medical experience and volunteer in underprivileged countries.

Name: VeryUs
Description:
We are VeryUs, an all-female dance crew with an interest in Asian songs and dance. Our members come from various backgrounds and represent various styles of dance. VeryUs was founded by Chinese graduate students as a singing group, but the members quickly realized their passion for dance. They wanted to show the evolution of Chinese music and dance and highlight their cultures. They incorporated fans into both traditional and modern Chinese music for their performances.

With Covid and new leadership, our dance crew has evolved from just Chinese members to a diverse group of members, each hailing from different Asian backgrounds. With this change, we want to reflect it with our dance in order to highlight the many different cultures in Asia. But a core thing we still maintain is the integration of traditional and modern aspects into our performances.
Summary: VeryUs is a female, Asian-interest dance group that performs at various events on campus. Our goal is to represent traditional and pop aspects of music from all over Asia.

Name: Vibrance Dance Company
Description: Modern, contemporary and jazz dance performance company for University of Michigan students. Vibrance group members choreograph their own pieces for stage performance. The company meets to rehearse the choreography and performs for organizations around campus as well as their own showcase at the end of the semester.
Summary: Vibrance is a student-run contemporary and jazz dance company at the University of Michigan. Each member has the opportunity to choreograph and perform unique styles of dance at our annual showcase in the spring.

Name: VictorCrypto
Description: VictorCrypto is the cryptography club at the University of Michigan. We host meetings, round table discussions, and more on both primitive and applied cryptography as well as privacy topics. The club is composed of students and staff who are focused on learning and using cryptography.
Summary: VictorCrypto is the cryptography club at the University of Michigan. We host meetings, round table discussions, and more on both primitive and applied cryptography as well as privacy topics. The club is composed of students and staff who are focus

Name: Victors FC
Description: The goal of this organization is to supply girls with a competitive soccer environment, but with a smaller time commitment than the standing club soccer program. This organization will compete in a league with other local college club teams in Michigan and would participate in all league events/games.
Summary: The goal of this organization is to supply girls with a competitive soccer environment, but with a smaller time commitment than the standing club soccer program.

Name: Victors Value Investments
Description:
Victors Value Investments (VVI) is Michigan's foremost value investing undergraduate club with over $15,000 in assets under management. We invest in a highly concentrated, long-only portfolio of US equities by practicing strict value investing philosophies.

Our mission is to bring engaging investing experience to all members while promoting education, professional development, and industry exposure to students of all levels and backgrounds.

Our club runs an education program dedicated to building the foundation for value investing expertise. Topics range across the basics of value investing, financial accounting, valuation, financial modeling, technical analysis, and information sourcing.

Each semester, members will join a pitch team where they will identify, research, and pitch a stock to the rest of the club during fund meetings on the Tozzi Trading Floor. We also have many different committees that members are encouraged to join that dive deeper into specific aspects of our club and its operations. On top of all of that, our club provides professional development resources, technical skill workshops, and valuable access to senior members of the finance community.

We pride ourselves in our tightly-knit organization, as we focus on fostering relationships and building a strong network within our team and the greater Michigan community.

For more information: https://www.umichvvi.com
Summary: Victors Value Investments (VVI) is a student-led organization with an emphasis on community that manages a portfolio using value investing philosophies, educates its members on financial topics, and provides real-world investing and finance experience

Name: Video Game Music Club
Description:
This is a student-run organization for anyone interested in video game music, whether you have an insatiable love for the genre or are completely new to it. No commitment required! You can just join our discord and say hello!

We hold weekly meetings, with the time and day varying by semester based on member availability. At meetings, we discuss anything and everything related to the field of game audio. We also introduce members to composition and music production!

Anyone interested in performing video game music can join the band portion as well!

 

Announcements are made through our Discord Server which can be joined at the link below!

https://bit.ly/vgmclub
Summary:
This is a student-run organization for anyone interested in video game music, whether you have an insatiable love for the genre or are completely new to it.

Anyone interested in performing video game music can join the band portion as well!

Name: Vietnam International Student Association
Description:
𝗪𝗲𝗹𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗩𝗶𝗲𝘁𝗻𝗮𝗺𝗲𝘀𝗲 𝗜𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗿𝗻𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝗮𝗹 𝗦𝘁𝘂𝗱𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝗔𝘀𝘀𝗼𝗰𝗶𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 (𝗩𝗜𝗦𝗔) 𝗮𝘁 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗨𝗻𝗶𝘃𝗲𝗿𝘀𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝗼𝗳 𝗠𝗶𝗰𝗵𝗶𝗴𝗮𝗻! 

At VISA, we strive to foster a deep understanding of Vietnamese contemporary culture while providing a “home away from home” for all Vietnamese students. Our vision is to create a tight-knit and inclusive environment where members can find friendship, guidance, and a sense of belonging when studying abroad.

Our logo features the ‘chim lạc,’ or the mythical crane, a prominent symbol in ancient Vietnamese culture. The crane soars high through the boundless skies, symbolizing the ancient Vietnamese people’s resilience and ambitions. No matter where they are in the world, they remain anchored to their resilient roots, forever driven by their desires to conquer the skies.

From mouth-watering Hanoian cuisine to Saigon’s vibrant nightlife, we hope to bring authentic Vietnamese culture to the Michigan community. Stay tuned for our upcoming activities!

Time to turn flight mode on!
Summary: Vietnamese International Student Association is a cultural association that aims to foster bonds between Vietnamese international students. The association also aims to promote an authentic Vietnamese culture to students at the University of Michigan.

Name: Vietnamese Student Association
Description: Through numerous activities focusing on the celebration and exposure of Vietnamese culture, we hope to provide the necessary interaction between those of different backgrounds to build cross-cultural bridges and foster acceptance and awareness. As a dynamic and open organization, the Vietnamese Student Association prides itself on its diverse and unified membership and dedication to decreasing cultural tension on campus.
Summary: The Vietnamese Student Association is an organization dedicated to increasing cultural awareness and diversity on campus and in the community. We strive to create a supportive and cooperative environment for those of Vietnamese and non-Vietnamese descent

Name: VOID Tech
Description:
VOID Tech gives members real-world software development experience through real-world projects. We bring together student developers, designers, and Product Managers to partner up in order to create beautiful, functional websites and applications.
We set up students for success by creating cross-functional teams that will allow them to explore their design, development, and management abilities while learning about the process of developing a functional application that solves a real-world problem. Students will have to undergo a development process that ranges from brainstorming, to development, then testing and finally, deployment. We also host multiple social and professional development events throughout the year that will allow you to make lifelong friends and connections!
This club is open to Computer Science, UX Design, Ross or any other student who has the skills and/or passion to learn how to develop an application.
To join our org, come to our events and apply here.
Summary: VOID Tech gives members real-world software development experience through real-world projects. We bring together student developers, designers, and Product Managers to partner up in order to create beautiful, functional websites and applications.
